enumMember.name: NC
enumMember.description: TS/AP session command.

enum.name: TemplateFormatType
enum.description: Lists the possible filename template formats for "audit log files" and "protected audit log files".

enumMember.name: AUDIT
enumMember.description:
AUDIT template format.
When such template format is in use: - the file names generated for "audit log files" have the format: audit.yyyymmdd-HHMMSS - the file names generated for "protected audit log files" have the format: paudit.yyyymmdd-HHMMSS.zip
yyyy indicates the year in four digits.
mm indicates the month in two digits.
dd indicates the day in two digits.
HH indicates the hour (00-23) in two digits.
MM indicates the minutes in two digits.
SS indicates the seconds in two digits.

enumMember.name: LOGFILE
enumMember.description:
LOGFILE template format.
When such template format is in use: - the file names generated for "audit log files" have the format: LOGFILE-yyyy-mm-dd-HHMM - the file names generated for "Protected audit log files" have the format: PLOGFILE_yyyy_mm_dd_HHMM.zip
yyyy indicates the year in four digits.
mm indicates the month in two digits.
dd indicates the day in two digits.
HH indicates the hour (00-23) in two digits.
MM indicates the minutes in two digits.

class.name: AuditLoggingM
class.description:
Represents the root MOC for Audit Logging Management function MOM. It is created by the system and allows activating/deactivating ALOG function, excluding some kind of commands from the logging and showing the excluded items. It also allows enabling of MML over syslog function.
In particular it allows setting the following parameters:
- Status of the ALOG function. - Enabling MML over syslog function using key. - Activating/deactivating MML over syslog function. - Activating/deactivating logging over audit log files. - Capability to log MML command and MML session identification in the audit log. - Capability to skip events with size greater than 1 MB. - Name of the TQ, defined in Data Transfer Management function MOM, to be used for transferring audit events to a remote destination. - Template format to be used by ALOG function when generating the file names of the "audit log files" and the "protected audit log files".
One or more attributes setting or action can fail due to one of the following reasons: - Transfer Queue not defined in the output handler: The specified TQ name does not exist in Data Transfer Management function MOM. - Command Log Transfer Queue configuration is allowed only in Multi-CP system: The TQ for CLOG files can be configured only in Multi CP system. - Not allowed to deactivate Audit Log function in Multi-CP system: The status of ALOG function can be set to LOCKED value (deactivation of the function) only in Multi-CP System. - File Naming Template already configured: The specified template format for the names of "audit log files" and "protected audit log files" is already assigned to the attribute. - Not allowed to activate MML over syslog if the function is not enabled.

action.name: enableMmlSyslog
action.description:
Enables MML over syslog function.
The action can fail due to one of the following reasons: - Invalid key is provided. - Function already enabled. - Internal Program Error: When service encounters internal fault like inter service communication failure.

parameter.name: key
parameter.description: Specifies the key to enable MML over syslog function.

attribute.name: auditLoggingMId
attribute.description: Holds the name used when identifying the MO.

attribute.name: largeEventDataSkipped
attribute.description: Specifies if events (having size) bigger than 1 MB are truncated. If truncation is applied, event size after truncation is exacly 1 MB.

attribute.name: transferQueue
attribute.description: Specifies the identifier of the TQ to be used by ALOG for "audit logging files". Only file based transfer is supported.

attribute.name: alogAdmState
attribute.description: Specifies the status of the Audit Log function.

attribute.name: commandAndSessionAdmState
attribute.description: Specifies the status of the "MML command/session identification" logging feature. If status is UNLOCKED, the event infos "MML command identification" and "MML session identification" are logged (if available). If status is LOCKED, the event infos "MML command identification" and "MML session identification" are NOT logged.

attribute.name: transferQueueDn
attribute.description: Specifies the DN for the MO representing the TQ used by ALOG function for "audit logging files".

attribute.name: templateFormat
attribute.description: Specifies the filename template format for "audit log files" and "protected audit log files". The change of a format does not affect previous generated audit files.

attribute.name: commandLogTransferQueue
attribute.description: Specifies the identifier of the TQ to be used for CLOG files. Only file based transfer is supported. The attribute can be set only in Multi-CP System.

attribute.name: commandLogTransferQueueDn
attribute.description: Specifies the DN for the MO representing the TQ used for CLOG files.

attribute.name: mmlSyslogAdmState
attribute.description: Specifies the status of the MML over syslog function.

attribute.name: alogFileAdmState
attribute.description: Specifies the status of the logging over audit log files.

attribute.name: mmlSyslogAvailabilityState
attribute.description: Specifies the availability state of MML over syslog.

class.name: ExclusionItem
class.description: Represents the set of items, command or printout, to be excluded from logging.

attribute.name: exclusionItemId
attribute.description: Holds the name used when identifying the MO.

attribute.name: type
attribute.description: Indicates the item type to be excluded from ALOG file.

attribute.name: item
attribute.description: Indicates the item string to be excluded from the logging. All the events including such item are not stored in ALOG file.

struct.name: ProductIdentity
struct.description: Contains product information of a component present in the AXE node.

structMember.name: productDesignation
structMember.description: Product name.

structMember.name: productNumber
structMember.description: The product number in Ericsson ABC format.

structMember.name: productRevision
structMember.description: The product revision in the form R[1-9][A-Z].

enum.name: SystemType
enum.description: Specifies the AXE system type in terms of number of CP connected to APG.

enumMember.name: SINGLE_CP_SYSTEM
enumMember.description: Indicates a Single-CP System. It is a system including only one Dual-Sided CP.

enumMember.name: MULTI_CP_SYSTEM
enumMember.description: Indicates a Multi-CP System. It is a system including several types of CPs, regardless if the CPs are Single-Sided CPs or Dual-Sided CPs.

enum.name: AxeApplication
enum.description: Specifies the type of the AXE Application the APG is serving to.

enumMember.name: MSC
enumMember.description: Specifies a MSC-S Application.

enumMember.name: HLR
enumMember.description: Specifies a HLR Application.

enumMember.name: BSC
enumMember.description: Specifies a BSC Application.

enumMember.name: WIRELINE
enumMember.description: Specifies a Wireline Application.

enumMember.name: TSC
enumMember.description: Specifies a TSC-S Application.

enumMember.name: IPSTP
enumMember.description: Specifies an IP-STP Application.

enum.name: AlarmSeverity
enum.description: Defines the set of possible alarm severities for an AXE alarm.

enumMember.name: ALARM_HIGH
enumMember.description: Indicates the highest alarm severity.

enumMember.name: ALARM_MEDIUM
enumMember.description: Indicates the medium alarm severity.

enumMember.name: ALARM_LOW
enumMember.description: Indicates the lowest alarm severity.

enumMember.name: ALERT_HIGH
enumMember.description: Indicates the highest alert severity.

enumMember.name: ALERT_LOW
enumMember.description: Indicates the lowest alert severity.

enum.name: AlarmSource
enum.description: Defines the set of possible sources for an AXE alarm.

enumMember.name: POWER
enumMember.description: Indicates POWER as source of an AXE alarm.

enumMember.name: EXTERNAL
enumMember.description: Indicates EXTERNAL as source of an AXE alarm..

enumMember.name: APT
enumMember.description: Indicates APT as source of an AXE alarm.

enumMember.name: APZ
enumMember.description: Indicates APZ as source of an AXE alarm.

enum.name: ApgShelfArchitecture
enum.description: Specifies the magazine type and the shelf manager type used for the shelf where the APG is located.

enumMember.name: SCB
enumMember.description: APG is into an EGEM magazine with SCB.

enumMember.name: SCX
enumMember.description: APG is into an EGEM2 magazine with SCXB and AXE manages the infrastructure.

enumMember.name: BSP
enumMember.description: APG is into an EGEM2 magazine within BSP.

enumMember.name: SMX
enumMember.description: APG is into an EGEM2 magazine with SMXB and AXE manages the infrastructure.

derivedDataType.name: IpAddressType
derivedDataType.description: Specifies the range for an IP address.

mim.author: Akhila Giramoni
mim.name: AxeCpFileSystem
mim.description: CP File System Management function MOM.

enum.name: CopyMode
enum.description: Specifies how files are copied.

derivedDataType.name: DeleteFileTimer
derivedDataType.description: Specifies the delay in minutes for deletion of subfile.

class.name: CpFileSystemM
class.description:
Represents the root MOC for AXE CP File System Management function MOM. The function provides file management and file processing services for CP applications requiring APG support. It implements the CP file system which is based on AP file system, supporting the different file classes and file types used in the CP.
Two different CP file classes, which indicate the structure of the file, are supported: 1) Simple: A CP simple file only contains data, and is not a part of a composite file. 2) Composite: A CP composite file is made up of a main file and any number of subfiles. The main file is a template for the creation of the subfiles. The subfiles contain the data records.
Two different file types, which indicate how the records in a file are accessed, are supported: 1) Regular: A regular file contains records that may be written or read sequentially or by addressing specific record numbers. 2) Infinite: An infinite file is a composite file where the subfiles are automatically created by the system. An infinite file may be read or written sequentially. When writing to an infinite file, data is written sequentially to the most recently created subfile, called active subfile.
Infinite subfiles in the CP file system may be transfered automatically to a remote side, if the infinite main file has been defined to a data transfer policy.
CP handles file and volume names as case insensitive strings, so two file or volume names can not differ in meaning based on differing use of uppercase and lowercase letters. It is advisable, to avoid misunderstandings, define file and volume names always in uppercase.
A CP File is unique in the CP File System. It means that it is not possible to create, in the same or different CP Volumes, two or more CP Files with the same name.

action.name: importCpFile
action.description:
Imports a file or a directory stored on APG file system to an existing CP file. It is applicable on a Single-CP System configuration. A compressed file can be imported as well. A compressed file or a directory can be imported only in an existing composite CP file. Importing is done taking data from the predefined folder "cp/files".
The action can fail due to one of the following reasons: - Access error: The requested operation conflicts with other user of the file. - Action not executed, AP backup in progress: A backup operation is ongoing. - File exists: <CP file name>: The CP file already exists in the CP file system. - File was not found: <CP file name>: The CP file was not found in the CP file system. - General Fault: Error when executing. - Invalid file name: The CP file name is not correct. - Invalid file reference: Attempt to import an AP file or directory containing incorrect file names to a CP composite file. - Invalid path: The path to import from is invalid. - Not allowed in this system configuration: The action is not allowed in Multi-CP System. - Operation not permitted for this file type: The requested operation is not allowed for CP infinite file. - Physical file error: <detailed information>: An error has occured in the AP file system.

parameter.name: source
parameter.description: Specifies the name of a file system item, file or folder, to import in a CP file. The string should be expressed as: [<FolderPathName>/]<ItemName>. "FolderPathName" is optional since it represents the relative path respect to predefined folder "cp/files". "ItemName" is the name of a file or a folder. For example if the file "cp/files/CpDump/AXEdump" should be imported in a CP file, the parameter "source" should be "CpDump/AXEdump".

parameter.name: destCpFile
parameter.description: Specifies the name of CP file which to act the import into.

parameter.name: mode
parameter.description:
Specifies the import mode.
It can be one of the following values:
OVERWRITE: An existing CP file is overwritten.
APPEND: Data is added to the end of an existing CP file.
NORMAL: Import fails in case the name of the file system item being imported is the same of an already existing destination CP file.
CLEAR: An existing CP file is overwritten. If the destination is a composite CP file, all subfiles belonging to it are deleted before starting import.

action.name: exportCpFile
action.description:
Exports a CP file to the APG file system in a Single-CP System configuration. Exporting a CP composite file means exporting a folder, representing it, and all included files. Exporting a CP simple file or a CP subfile means exporting a single file.
Exporting is done towards the predefined folder "cp/files".
Exported data can be compressed, into zip format, if specified via parameter "toZip".
The action can fail due to one of the following reasons: - Access error: The requested operation conflicts with other user of the file. - Action not executed, AP backup in progress: A backup operation is ongoing. - File is protected. File is connected to a transfer queue: The CP file is connected to a transfer queue and can not be exported. - File was not found: <CP file name>: The CP file was not found in the CP file system. - General Fault: Error when executing. - Invalid file name: The CP file name is not correct. - Invalid path: The path to export is invalid. - Not allowed in this system configuration: The action is not allowed in Multi-CP System. - Parameter error: mode CLEAR not allowed: Export with mode clear is not supported. - Physical file error: <detailed information>: An error has occured in the APG file system.

parameter.name: sourceCpFile
parameter.description: Specifies the name of CP File to export.

parameter.name: dest
parameter.description: Specifies the name of a file system item, file or folder, where to export a CP file. The string should be expressed as: [<FolderPathName>/]<ItemName>. "FolderPathName" is optional since it represents the relative path respect to predefined folder "cp/files". "ItemName" is the name of a file or a folder. For example if a CP file export to file "cp/files/CpDump/AXEdump" is needed, the parameter "dest" should be "CpDump/AXEdump".

parameter.name: mode
parameter.description:
Specifies the export mode.
It can be one of the following values:
OVERWRITE: An existing file system item is overwritten.
APPEND: Data is added to the end of an existing file system item.
NORMAL : Export fails in case the destination path contains a file having the same name as the CP simple file or the CP subfile being exported.
Note: mode CLEAR is not supported.

parameter.name: toZip
parameter.description: Enables or disables creation of a zip archive. The created zip archive is named as specified by the parameter "dest" and its extension is '.zip'.

action.name: copyCpFile
action.description:
Copies a CP file to another CP file. The destination file must already exist.
The action can fail due to one of the following reasons: - Access error: The requested operation conflicts with other user of the file. - Action not executed, AP backup in progress: A backup operation is ongoing. - File exists: <CP file name>: The CP file already exists in the CP file system. - File is protected. File is connected to a transfer queue: The CP file is connected to a transfer queue, and can not be copied from or copied to. - File was not found: <CP file name>: The CP file was not found in the CP file system. - General Fault: Error when executing. - Invalid file name: The CP file name is not correct. - Not a composite file: <CP file name>: The requested operation is only allowed for a CP composite file. - Not a simple file or subfile: <CP file name>: The requested operation is only allowed for a CP simple file or subfile. - Not allowed in this system configuration: The action is not allowed in Multi-CP System. - Operation not permitted for this file type: The requested operation is not allowed for CP infinite file. - Physical file error: <detailed information>: An error has occured in the AP file system.

parameter.name: sourceCpFile
parameter.description: Source CP file.

parameter.name: destCpFile
parameter.description: Specifies the destination CP File.

parameter.name: mode
parameter.description:
Specifies the copy mode.
It can be one of the following values:
OVERWRITE: An existing CP file is overwritten when the CP file is copied.
APPEND: Data is added to the end of an existing CP file when the CP file is copied.
CLEAR: An existing CP file is overwritten when a CP file is copied. If the destination CP file is a composite CP file, all subfiles belonging to this CP file are deleted before the source CP file is copied.
NORMAL : Copy fails in case the destination composite CP file has some CP subfiles with the same name of the CP subfiles being copied.

action.name: moveCpFile
action.description:
Moves a CP file to another CP volume in a Single-CP System configuration. If a composite CP file is moved all the subfiles of that file are also moved. The volume to which the file is moved must already exist.
The action can fail due to one of the following reasons: - Access error: The requested operation conflicts with other user of the file. - Action not executed, AP backup in progress: A backup operation is ongoing. - Cannot move file to same volume: A CP file cannot be moved to the same volume where it is already stored. - File is protected. File is connected to a transfer queue: The CP file is connected to a transfer queue and can not be moved. - File was not found: <CP file name>: The CP file was not found in the CP file system. - General Fault: Error when executing. - Invalid file name: The CP file name is not correct. - Not allowed in this system configuration: The action is not allowed in Multi-CP System. - Operation not permitted for this file type: The requested operation is not allowed for CP infinite file. - Physical file error: <detailed information>: An error has occured in the AP file system. - Volume was not found: <volume name>: The destination volume does not exist.

parameter.name: sourceCpFile
parameter.description: CP file to move.

parameter.name: volume
parameter.description: Destination volume.

action.name: renameCpFile
action.description:
Renames a CP file or a CP subfile in a Single-CP System configuration. A CP file and a related CP subfile cannot be renamed at the same time. A CP infinite file cannot be renamed if it is associated to a transfer queue.
The action can fail due to one of the following reasons: - Access error: The requested operation conflicts with other user of the file. - Action not executed, AP backup in progress: A backup operation is ongoing. - File exists: <CP file name>: The CP file already exists in the CP file system. - File is protected. File is connected to a transfer queue: The CP file is connected to a transfer queue and cannot be renamed. - File was not found: <CP file name>: The CP file was not found in the CP file system. - General Fault: Error when executing. - Invalid file name: The CP file name is not correct. - Not a composite file: <CP file name>: The requested operation is only allowed for a CP composite file. - Not a simple file or a composite file: <CP file name>: A CP file cannot be renamed as a subfile. - Not a subfile: <CP file name>: A subfile cannot be renamed as a CP composite file. - Not allowed in this system configuration: The action is not allowed in Multi-CP System. - Operation not permitted for this file type: The requested operation is not allowed for a subfile of a CP infinite file. - Physical file error: <detailed information>: An error has occured in the AP file system. - Subfile must belong to the same composite file: <CP file name>: The current and new subfiles do not belong to the same CP composite file.

parameter.name: currentName
parameter.description: Specifies the current CP file or subfile name. It is expressed as <CpFileName> in case of renaming of a CP file, or <CpFileName>-<CpSubfileName> in case of renaming of a CP subfile.

parameter.name: newName
parameter.description: Specifies the new CP file or subfile name. It is expressed as <CpFileName> in case of renaming of a CP file, or <CpFileName>-<CpSubfileName> in case of renaming of a CP subfile.

action.name: copyCpClusterFile
action.description:
Copies a CP file to another CP file. The destination file must already exist. The copy mode can be:
Overwrite : An existing CP file is overwritten when the CP file is copied.
Append : Data is added to the end of an existing CP file when the CP file is copied.
Clear : An existing CP file is overwritten when a CP file is copied. If the destination CP file is a composite CP file, all subfiles belonging to this CP file are deleted before the source CP file is copied.
Copies a CP file to another CP file. The destination file must already exist.
The action can fail due to one of the following reasons: - Access error: The requested operation conflicts with other user of the file. - Action not executed, AP backup in progress: A backup operation is ongoing. - File exists: <CP file name>: The CP file already exists in the CP file system. - File is protected. File is connected to a transfer queue: The CP file is connected to a transfer queue, and can not be copied from or copied to. - File was not found: <CP file name>: The CP file was not found in the CP file system. - General Fault: Error when executing. - Invalid file name: The CP file name is not correct. - Not a composite file: <CP file name>: The requested operation is only allowed for a CP composite file. - Not a simple file or subfile: <CP file name>: The requested operation is only allowed for a CP simple file or subfile. - Not allowed in this system configuration: The action is not allowed in Single-CP System. - Operation not permitted for this file type: The requested operation is not allowed for CP infinite file. - Physical file error: <detailed information>: An error has occured in the APG file system.

parameter.name: sourceCpFile
parameter.description: Source CP file.

parameter.name: destCpFile
parameter.description: Specifies the destination CP File.

parameter.name: mode
parameter.description:
Specifies the copy mode.
It can be one of the following values:
OVERWRITE: An existing CP file is overwritten when the CP file is copied.
APPEND: Data is added to the end of an existing CP file when the CP file is copied.
CLEAR: An existing CP file is overwritten when a CP file is copied. If the destination CP file is a composite CP file, all subfiles belonging to this CP file are deleted before the source CP file is copied.
NORMAL : Copy fails in case the destination composite CP file has some CP subfiles with the same name of the CP subfiles being copied.

parameter.name: cpName
parameter.description: The default Central Processor (CP) name or literal "CLUSTER". A valid CP name is an alphanumeric string with a maximum length of seven characters.

action.name: exportCpClusterFile
action.description:
Exports a CP file to the APG file system in a Multi-CP System configuration. Exporting a CP composite file means exporting a folder, representing it, and all included files. Exporting a CP simple file or a CP subfile means exporting a single file.
Exporting is done towards the predefined folder "cp/files".
Exported data can be compressed, into zip format, if specified via parameter "toZip".
The action can fail due to one of the following reasons: - Access error: The requested operation conflicts with other user of the file. - Action not executed, AP backup in progress: A backup operation is ongoing. - File is protected. File is connected to a transfer queue: The CP file is connected to a transfer queue and can not be exported. - File was not found: <CP file name>: The CP file was not found in the CP file system. - General Fault: Error when executing. - Invalid file name: The CP file name is not correct. - Invalid path: The path to export is invalid. - Not allowed in this system configuration: The action is not allowed in Single-CP System. - Parameter error: mode CLEAR not allowed: Export with mode clear is not supported. - Physical file error: <detailed information>: An error has occured in the APG file system.

parameter.name: sourceCpFile
parameter.description: Specifies the name of CP File to export.

parameter.name: dest
parameter.description: Specifies the name of a file system item, file or folder, where to export a CP file. The string should be expressed as: [<FolderPathName>/]<ItemName>. "FolderPathName" is optional since it represents the relative path respect to predefined folder "cp/files". "ItemName" is the name of a file or a folder. For example if a CP file export to file "cp/files/CpDump/AXEdump" is needed, the parameter "dest" should be "CpDump/AXEdump".

parameter.name: mode
parameter.description:
Specifies the export mode.
It can be one of the following values:
OVERWRITE: An existing file system item is overwritten.
APPEND: Data is added to the end of an existing file system item.
NORMAL : Export fails in case the destination path contains a file having the same name as the CP simple file or the CP subfile being exported.
Note: mode CLEAR is not supported.

parameter.name: toZip
parameter.description: Enables or disables creation of a zip archive. The created zip archive is named as specified by the parameter "dest" and its extension is '.zip'.

parameter.name: cpName
parameter.description: The default Central Processor (CP) name or literal "CLUSTER". A valid CP name is an alphanumeric string with a maximum length of seven characters.

action.name: importCpClusterFile
action.description:
Imports a file or a directory stored on APG file system to an existing CP file. It is applicable on a Multi-CP System configuration. A compressed file can be imported as well. A compressed file or a directory can be imported only in an existing composite CP file. Importing is done taking data from the predefined folder "cp/files".
The action can fail due to one of the following reasons: - Access error: The requested operation conflicts with other user of the file. - Action not executed, AP backup in progress: A backup operation is ongoing. - File exists: <CP file name>: The CP file already exists in the CP file system. - File was not found: <CP file name>: The CP file was not found in the CP file system. - General Fault: Error when executing. - Invalid file name: The CP file name is not correct. - Invalid file reference: Attempt to import an AP file or directory containing incorrect file names to a CP composite file. - Invalid path: The path to import from is invalid. - Not allowed in this system configuration: The action is not allowed in Single-CP System. - Operation not permitted for this file type: The requested operation is not allowed for CP infinite file. - Physical file error: <detailed information>: An error has occured in the AP file system.

parameter.name: source
parameter.description: Specifies the name of a file system item, file or folder, to import in a CP file. The string should be expressed as: [<FolderPathName>/]<ItemName>. "FolderPathName" is optional since it represents the relative path respect to predefined folder "cp/files". "ItemName" is the name of a file or a folder. For example if the file "cp/files/CpDump/AXEdump" should be imported in a CP file, the parameter "source" should be "CpDump/AXEdump".

parameter.name: destCpFile
parameter.description: Specifies the name of CP file which to act the import into.

parameter.name: mode
parameter.description:
Specifies the import mode.
It can be one of the following values:
OVERWRITE: An existing CP file is overwritten.
APPEND: Data is added to the end of an existing CP file.
NORMAL: Import fails in case the name of the file system item being imported is the same of an already existing destination CP file.
CLEAR: An existing CP file is overwritten. If the destination is a composite CP file, all subfiles belonging to it are deleted before starting import.

parameter.name: cpName
parameter.description: The default Central Processor (CP) name or literal "CLUSTER". A valid CP name is an alphanumeric string with a maximum length of seven characters.

action.name: moveCpClusterFile
action.description:
Moves a CP file to another CP volume in a Multi-CP System configuration. If a composite CP file is moved all the subfiles of that file are also moved. The volume to which the file is moved must already exist.
The action can fail due to one of the following reasons: - Access error: The requested operation conflicts with other user of the file. - Action not executed, AP backup in progress: A backup operation is ongoing. - Cannot move file to same volume: A CP file cannot be moved to the same volume where it is already stored. - File is protected. File is connected to a transfer queue: The CP file is connected to a transfer queue and can not be moved. - File was not found: <CP file name>: The CP file was not found in the CP file system. - General Fault: Error when executing. - Invalid file name: The CP file name is not correct. - Not allowed in this system configuration: The action is not allowed in Single-CP System. - Operation not permitted for this file type: The requested operation is not allowed for CP infinite file. - Physical file error: <detailed information>: An error has occured in the AP file system. - Volume was not found: <volume name>: The destination volume does not exist.

parameter.name: sourceCpFile
parameter.description: CP file to move.

parameter.name: volume
parameter.description: Destination volume.

parameter.name: cpName
parameter.description: The default Central Processor (CP) name or literal "CLUSTER". A valid CP name is an alphanumeric string with a maximum length of seven characters.

action.name: renameCpClusterFile
action.description:
Renames a CP file in a Multi-CP System configuration. A CP file and a related CP subfile cannot be renamed at the same time. A CP infinite file cannot be renamed if it is associated to a transfer queue.
The action can fail due to one of the following reasons: - Access error: The requested operation conflicts with other user of the file. - Action not executed, AP backup in progress: A backup operation is ongoing. - File exists: <CP file name>: The CP file already exists in the CP file system. - File is protected. File is connected to a transfer queue: The CP file is connected to a transfer queue and cannot be renamed. - File was not found: <CP file name>: The CP file was not found in the CP file system. - General Fault: Error when executing. - Invalid file name: The CP file name is not correct. - Not a composite file: <CP file name>: The requested operation is only allowed for a CP composite file. - Not a simple file or a composite file: <CP file name>: A CP file cannot be renamed as a subfile. - Not a subfile: <CP file name>: A subfile cannot be renamed as a CP composite file. - Not allowed in this system configuration: The action is not allowed in Single-CP System. - Operation not permitted for this file type: The requested operation is not allowed for a subfile of a CP infinite file. - Physical file error: <detailed information>: An error has occured in the AP file system. - Subfile must belong to the same composite file: <CP file name>: The current and new subfiles do not belong to the same CP composite file.

parameter.name: currentName
parameter.description: Specifies the current CP file or subfile name. It is expressed as <CpFileName> in case of renaming of a CP file, or <CpFileName>-<CpSubfileName> in case of renaming of a CP subfile.

parameter.name: newName
parameter.description: Specifies the new CP file or subfile name. It is expressed as <CpFileName> in case of renaming of a CP file, or <CpFileName>-<CpSubfileName> in case of renaming of a CP subfile.

parameter.name: cpName
parameter.description: The default Central Processor (CP) name or literal "CLUSTER". A valid CP name is an alphanumeric string with a maximum length of seven characters.

attribute.name: cpFileSystemMId
attribute.description: Holds the name used when identifying the MO.

class.name: CpVolume
class.description: Instance of this class represents a volume in the CP file system. A CP volume can contain several CP files and subfiles. A CP file or subfile can only belong to one CP volume.

attribute.name: cpVolumeId
attribute.description:
Holds the name used when identifying the MO. It is the name of the volume and the CP to which it belongs. A valid value must comply the following rule:
<volumeName>[:<defaultCpName>]
where:
<volumeName> is an alphanumeric string with a maximum length of fourteen characters, also the low hyphen symbol can be used. The string must begin with an alphabetic character; it is recommeded to use upper case characters.
<defaultCpName> is an alphanumeric string with a maximum length of seven characters. It must be set to the default CP name or literal "CLUSTER". It is mandatory only on Multi-CP System.

class.name: CompositeFile
class.description: Instance of this class represents a CP regular composite file. It consists of a template for the creation of subfile and one or several subfiles.

attribute.name: compositeFileId
attribute.description: Holds the name used when identifying the MO. It is the name of the composite CP file. A valid name is an alphanumeric string with a maximum length of twelve characters. The name must start with an alphabetic character.

attribute.name: recordLength
attribute.description: The length, in byte, of the data records. A record contains data elements that are treated as a single unit.

attribute.name: exclusiveAccess
attribute.description: Indicates an exclusive read or write access on the CP file.

attribute.name: numOfReaders
attribute.description: The number of current users with read access on the CP file.

attribute.name: numOfWriters
attribute.description: The number of current users with write access on the CP file.

attribute.name: deleteFileTimer
attribute.description:
Specifies the delay in minutes for deletion of the subfile.
When the deleteFileTimer expires, the file is deleted from the APG. If minus one (-1) is specified, no delete FileTimer is defined for the file. Consequently, minus one (-1) is not regarded as an actual deleteFileTimer value. It is instead used to disable the automatic deletion of the file.
In Multi-CP System this attribute is not applicable.

class.name: SimpleFile
class.description: Instance of this class represents a simple CP file. It consists of a regular data in one data file.

attribute.name: simpleFileId
attribute.description: Holds the name used when identifying the MO. It is the name of the simple CP file. A valid name is an alphanumeric string with a maximum length of twelve characters. The name must start with an alphabetic character.

attribute.name: recordLength
attribute.description: The length, in byte, of the data records. A record contains data elements that are treated as a single unit.

attribute.name: size
attribute.description: Indicates the size of the CP file, expressed in records.

attribute.name: numOfReaders
attribute.description: The number of current users with read access on the CP file.

attribute.name: numOfWriters
attribute.description: The number of current users with write access on the CP file.

attribute.name: exclusiveAccess
attribute.description: Indicates an exclusive read or write access on the CP file.

class.name: InfiniteFile
class.description: Instance of this class represents a infinite composite CP file. It is a composite file where the subfiles are created automatically by CP applications. For this type of CP file is possible associate a transfer policy.

action.name: releaseSubFile
action.description: Changes the active subfile. Closes the active and opens a new subfile.

attribute.name: lastSubfileSent
attribute.description: Specifies the last subfile transferred.

attribute.name: maxSize
attribute.description: Specifies the maximum number of records that can be written in an Infinite CP subfile.

attribute.name: maxTime
attribute.description: Specifies the maximum length of time between each change of active subfile of the infinite CP file.

attribute.name: recordLength
attribute.description: Specifies the length, in byte, of the data records. A record contains data elements that are treated as a single unit.

attribute.name: overrideSubfileClosure
attribute.description: Specifies the release condition for the Infinite CP File. If the release condition is enabled (true) and an Infinite subfile is closed, a new active subfile is created. If the release condition is not enabled (false) and the infinite file is closed and opened again, then the active subfile will remain the same.

attribute.name: activeSubFile
attribute.description: Specifies the number of the active subfile.

attribute.name: infiniteFileId
attribute.description: Holds the name used when identifying the MO. It is the name of the infinite CP file. A valid name is an alphanumeric string with a maximum length of twelve characters. The name must start with an alphabetic character.

attribute.name: exclusiveAccess
attribute.description: Specifies an exclusive read or write access on the CP file.

attribute.name: numOfReaders
attribute.description: Specifies the number of current users with read access on the CP file.

attribute.name: numOfWriters
attribute.description: Specifies the number of current users with write access on the CP file.

attribute.name: transferQueue
attribute.description: Specifies the name of the file transfer queue. It will be used to transfer the infinite CP file to a remote destination.

attribute.name: activeSubfileExclusiveAccess
attribute.description: Specifies an exclusive read or write access on the active infinite subfile.

attribute.name: activeSubfileNumOfReaders
attribute.description: Specifies the number of current users with read access on the active infinte subfile.

attribute.name: activeSubfileNumOfWriters
attribute.description: Specifies the number of current users with write access on the active infinite subfile.

attribute.name: activeSubfileSize
attribute.description: Specifies the active infinite subfile size expressed in records.

attribute.name: transferQueueDn
attribute.description: Specifies the DN for the MO representing the TQ used by Infinite File.

class.name: CompositeSubFile
class.description: Instance of this class represents a subfile of a regular composite CP file.

attribute.name: compositeSubFileId
attribute.description: Holds the name used when identifying the MO. It is the name of the composite CP subfile. It consists of two parts, separated by a dash.The first part is an alphanumeric string with a maximum length of twelve characters. The optional second part indicates the subfile generation, it can be an alphanumeric string with a maximum length of six characters.

attribute.name: size
attribute.description: Indicates the size of the subfile, expressed in records.

attribute.name: numOfReaders
attribute.description: The number of current users with read access on the CP subfile.

attribute.name: numOfWriters
attribute.description: The number of current users with write access on the CP subfile.

attribute.name: exclusiveAccess
attribute.description: Indicates an exclusive read or write access on the CP subfile.

mim.author: Harika Bavana
mim.name: AxeCpReloadClassic
mim.description: CP Backup and Reload Parameters model defines parameters for system backup generation handling and command log handling on all Classic (APZ 212 3x). The parameters are used at reload attempts when the reload is caused by software faults, command initiated reload (SYREI:RANK=RELOAD) and forced executive (FEX) reload.

struct.name: DynamicParams
struct.description: This is a read only structure containing the current state of the reload volume and information related to the last reload attempt.

structMember.name: loadingState
structMember.description: Internal state of he CP backup function on the AP which is used for calculating the file to reload.

structMember.name: currentTruncationAttempt
structMember.description: Current truncation attempt for RELFSW0. When cyclic reloads occur and automatic command log handling has been enabled, the impact can be mitigated by repetitive truncation of the command log (each reload results in additional commands being truncated from the command log).

structMember.name: currentFileNumberInFFR
structMember.description: Current active file in First File Range (FFR). That is RELFSWj (with j = 0, 1, ...99). RELFSW0 is the system-defined reload file, where the regular system backup copy is located (used for automatic outputs of the small or large data dump and for reload).

structMember.name: currentFileNumberInSFR
structMember.description: Current active file in Second File Range (SFR). That is RELFSWk (with k = 100, 101, ...127). Usage of SFR is optional and is intended to be used when changes in the exchange are not considered to be stable. Consequently when SFR is used the backup generations in the FFR are not considered to be reliable until they have been verified in use.

structMember.name: highestFileNumberInFFR
structMember.description: Highest permissible number of generation file within the age restriction as specified by oldestAcceptedDate, in first file range (FFR).

structMember.name: highestFileNumberInSFR
structMember.description: Highest permissible number of generation file within the age restriction as specified by oldestAcceptedDate, in second file range (SFR). When 0, no accepted file exists in the second file range. Number 0, 100 - 127

structMember.name: numberOfTruncatedCommands
structMember.description: Number of commands truncated, at execution of the latest command log subfile, after reload of generation RELFSW0 (only for automatic command log handling).

structMember.name: lastPermissibleGeneration
structMember.description: Last permissible generation file number in the fallback sequence. Value is only valid if loadingState parameter has the value of LAST_PERMISSIBLE_FILE.

structMember.name: logOmissionSetting
structMember.description: Command log subfile omission setting for generation 0 (RELFSW0). Only for automatic command log handling.

structMember.name: expiringTimeSupervision
structMember.description: Expiring Time Supervision (Refer to the description of supervisionTime in StaticParams structure.) YYYY-MM-DD HH:MM

struct.name: CommandLogReferences
struct.description: This is a read only structure containing references to the relevant command log subfiles. These values are automatically set and updated by the CP and are thus read only.

structMember.name: currentSubfileNumber
structMember.description: This parameter contains the current active command log subfile number and is the subfile that is currently used for logging of commands. This reference is automatically updated after every large data dump, manually incremented using command SYCSI or in connection with setting of preparedCommandLog parameter of DelayedMeasures structure.

structMember.name: mainStoreSubfileNumber
structMember.description: When the function Backup in Main Store (BUMS) is used in the CP, this attribute contains the command log subfile from where reading and execution shall start after a reload from the main store. This value is automatically updated after every large data dump provided that the BUMS function is active or manually incremented using command SYCSI.

structMember.name: preparedSubfileNumber
structMember.description: This attribute contains the command log subfile from where reading and execution shall start after a switch-back of the CP sides. This value is automatically updated when the CP sides are for some reason separated without the SB-side being fault marked or manually incremented using command SYCSI. The purpose of this subfile is to avoid the loss of logged commands that could arise in case of a side switch during the separation.

struct.name: LastReload
struct.description: This is a read only structure containing the values used at reload as well as information about the last automatic reload attempt.

structMember.name: commandLogMode
structMember.description: Manual or automatic command log handling during reload attempts.

structMember.name: generationFileNumber
structMember.description: This value indicates which generation file was loaded e.g. 0 - RELFSW0, 1 - RELFSW1.

structMember.name: lastPossibleGenerationFile
structMember.description: Indicates whether last possible generation file was loaded.

structMember.name: currentTruncatedCommands
structMember.description: Number of commands truncated, at execution of the latest command log subfile, after reload of generation RELFSW0 (only for automatic command log handling).

structMember.name: supervisionTime
structMember.description: Supervision time value (in minutes) as detailed in the StaticParams description for Time Supervision.

structMember.name: logOmissionSetting
structMember.description: Log subfile omission value for generation 0 (RELFSW0).

structMember.name: logSubfileNoOfLastAutoReload
structMember.description: The numeric reference of the associated command log subfile which is the start subfile in a sequence of logfiles that has been or shall be executed after reload of that system backup copy.

structMember.name: programStoreReferenceStoreOutputTime
structMember.description: Output time of the Program Store (PS) and Reference Store (RS) (i.e. subfile R5) in the last reloaded file.

structMember.name: dataStoreSmallDumpOutputTime
structMember.description: Output time of the small data dump (subfile R1 or R2) in the last reloaded file.

structMember.name: dataStoreLargeDumpOutputTime
structMember.description: Output time of the large data dump (subfile R3 or R4) in the last reloaded file.

struct.name: DelayedMeasures
struct.description:
This is a read only structure containing the configured Delayed Measures that define what happens if the stepping of the command log fails for some reason (for instance the IO is unavailable). Delayed measures are set by events such as small or large data dump, that have occurred when the command log is unavailable.
Any issued delayed measure remains until the action initiated by the CP can be completed or is no longer required for some reason. The CP will continue to perform automatic mainstore backups (if such has been configured) as scheduled even when the IO is unavailable.
The delayed measures are ordered when the command log becomes available again.

structMember.name: preparedCommandLog
structMember.description: Controls if reading and executing the prepared command log can be delayed or not. Specifies the number of the command log subfile from where reading and execution of the command log shall start after a switch-back. This reference is set when the CP sides are for some reason separated without the SB-side being fault marked. The purpose of this subfile is to avoid the loss of logged commands that could arise in case of a side switch during the separation.

structMember.name: mainStoreCommandLog
structMember.description: Controls if reading and executing the command log for the Main Store can be delayed or not.

structMember.name: currentCommandLog
structMember.description: Controls if reading and executing the current command log can be delayed or not.

structMember.name: mainStoreStepping
structMember.description: Controls if command log stepping at dump to main store can be delayed or not.

structMember.name: dumpStepping
structMember.description: Controls if command log stepping when creating a dump can be delayed or not.

structMember.name: preparedStepping
structMember.description: Controls if stepping of the prepared command log can be delayed or not.

structMember.name: smallBackupArea
structMember.description: Controls if small data dump transfer can be delayed or not.

structMember.name: largeBackupArea
structMember.description: Controls if large data dump transfer can be delayed or not.

struct.name: StaticParams
struct.description:
This structure contains configurable parameters for setting the command log handling, age restriction for generation file, automatic reload attempts with generation files from first and second file range and time supervision setting.
MANUAL COMMAND LOG HANDLING
In case of manual command log handling, the first reload attempt, possibly after an unsuccessful reload attempt with the main store dump, is done with the lowest numbered generation file (RELFSW0 in CP file system) and an alarm is given to the operator to read and execute command log manually.
All other reloading attempts are made with regard to values of parameters oldestAcceptedDate,includeFirstFileRange and includeSecondFileRange (and supervisionTime). These reloading attempts are done automatically. An alarm is given to the operator to read and execute the command log manually.
AUTOMATIC COMMAND LOG HANDLING
The first reload attempt, possibly after an unsuccessful reload attempt with the main store dump, is always done with the lowest numbered (which is supposed to be the youngest) generation file (RELFSW0 in CP file system) and the corresponding command log including the entire, latest, command log subfile. This action is done when the command log mode is AUTOMATIC.
In case of any two successive reload attempts with less than supervisionTime minutes in between, the parameters given by this command are used by the loader to select the next type of reload attempt. The number of truncation attempts, numberOfTruncationAttempts, and the additional number of commands truncated at each truncation attempt, numberOfTruncationCommands, are used only for their loading attempts with RELFSW0. If parameter numberOfTruncationAttempts has value 0 (no truncation attempts), then the value of parameter numberOfTruncationCommands is not used (unimportant). If, at any truncation attempt, the number of truncated commands is greater than or equal to the number of commands in the latest command log subfile, then the entire latest command log subfile will be omitted. In this case, if the value of parameter logOmissionMode is NONE or EXCLUDE_LAST, it will be counted as NONE. This means that a reload attempt within supervision time (supervisionTime) will use next older generation file. If value of parameter logOmissionMode is ALL, then total omission attempt will be done (see below).
If, after numberOfTruncationAttempts truncation attempts, the number of truncated commands was less than the number of commands in the latest command log subfile, then the parameter logOmissionMode will determine whether a total omission attempt will be made (EXCLUDE_LAST, ALL) or not (NONE).
If last truncation attempt was with numberOfTruncatedCommands at maximum value, then at subsequent truncation attempts, the numberOfTruncatedCommands maximum value will be repeated up to the numberOfTruncationAttempts value.
When loading older generation files (RELFSWj in central processor file store (CP file system), j>0), the corresponding, complete command log is always loaded.
AGE RESTRICTION FOR GENERATION FILES
The parameter oldestAcceptedDate sets an age limit for the backup generation files that are to be included in the automatic reloading attempts. If a file has a birth date older than the date specified by oldestAcceptedDate, then the file will not be included in the automatic reload attempts and all further reload attempts from that file range will be stopped. This age limitation is valid for files in both first and second file ranges with the exception of RELFSW0, that is even if RELFSW0 is older than oldestAcceptedDate then there will be an automatic reload attempt using RELFSW0.
AUTOMATIC RELOAD ATTEMPTS WITH FILES FROM FIRST FILE RANGE
If RELFSW0 is specified in parameter includeFirstFileRange, all reloading attempts are made with the lowest numbered generation file. If ANY is specified, all on-line generation files from the first file range that have consecutive numbers can be used for the reloading.
AUTOMATIC RELOAD ATTEMPTS WITH FILES FROM SECOND FILE RANGE
If parameter includeSecondFileRange is indicated and if all attempts to reload generation files from the first file range, specified in parameter includeFirstFileRange, fail, automatic attempts to reload generation files from the range specified in parameter includeSecondFileRange will be done. If it is specified that reloading attempts shall be made from the second file range, then the automatic reload attempts in the second file range will start from RELFSW100. Automatic reload attempts with files from the second file range will finish with the highest specified file from that range, file RELFSWhhh, where hhh must be a number within a consecutive series of file numbers going from 100 upto 127.
TIME SUPERVISION
At the start of each reload attempt, a time supervision is started. During the time supervision, any new reloading attempt is made according to the parameters set by the user. If all reloading attempts, selected according to the parameters set by the user, fail, i.e. the time for supervision has not expired at the last possible attempt plus one, then their loading will be done as in preceding attempt. When the time supervision expires, a successful reload attempt is considered to have occurred, meaning that any subsequent reloading attempt will be made from the start of the sequence described above.

structMember.name: commandLogMode
structMember.description: Manual or automatic mode command log handling during reloading attempts.

structMember.name: includeFirstFileRange
structMember.description: Generation files from the first file range included in the reload attempts.

structMember.name: includeSecondFileRange
structMember.description: Highest file number for attempts to reload generation files from second file range. The file number must be within a consecutive series of file numbers going from 100 upto 127. Reload attempts are made from RELFSW100 and upto the given file number. All files are subject to the age limitation imposed by oldestAcceptedDate. If set to zero, no attempt wil be made to reload from the second file range. Number 0, 100 - 127

structMember.name: oldestAcceptedDate
structMember.description: Specifies the oldest accepted birth date for an on-line generation file, from either file range, that may be included in the reload attempts. If a file from a permissible file name sequence to be used in a reload attempt should fall outside the age limit imposed by oldestAcceptedDate, then reloading attempts within that file range will be stopped, even if the next file would be permissible both with regard to name and age. The input date must be of the form YYYY-MM-DD.

structMember.name: logOmissionMode
structMember.description: Log subfile omission attempt with RELFSW0.

structMember.name: numberOfTruncationAttempts
structMember.description: Specifies the number of attempts to reload RELFSW0 with truncation of the latest command log subfile. Values greater than 2 should be used with caution. Only for automatic command log handling.

structMember.name: numberOfTruncationCommands
structMember.description: Specifies the number of additional commands to be truncated in the latest command log subfile at each attempt to reload RELFSW0. If parameter numberOfTruncationAttemps has value 0, then value of parameter numberOfTruncationCommands doesn't affect reloading attempts. Only for automatic command log handling.

structMember.name: supervisionTime
structMember.description: Specifies time (in minutes) for supervision of reload attempts. The specified value is rounded down to a multiple of ten minutes. Recommended value is 60, do not change this unless there is a strong reason. If the time since last reload attempt exceeds supervisionTime, then the last reload attempt is considered to be successful.

enum.name: CommandLogModeT
enum.description: Enumeration type for Command Log Mode.

enumMember.name: MANUAL
enumMember.description: Manual command log handling during reloading attempts.

enumMember.name: AUTOMATIC
enumMember.description: Automatic command log handling during reloading attempts as long as on-line command log subfiles are available.

enum.name: LogOmissionModeT
enum.description: Enumeration type for Command Log Omission Mode.

enumMember.name: ALL
enumMember.description: Attempt to reload RELFSW0 with complete corresponding command log omitted.

enumMember.name: NONE
enumMember.description: No omission attempt.

enumMember.name: EXCLUDE_LAST
enumMember.description: Attempt to reload RELFSW0 with the last command log subfile omitted.

enum.name: ValidityT
enum.description: Enumeration type for Validity

enum.name: IncludeFirstFileRangeT
enum.description: Enumeration type for Include First File Range.

enumMember.name: RELFSW0
enumMember.description: Only the lowest numbered generation file may be included in the reload attempts.

enumMember.name: ANY
enumMember.description: All on-line generation files with numbers going from 0 upto the highest consecutive number in the first file range (highest possible is 99) may be included in reload attempts. All subject to the age limitation imposed by oldestAcceptedDate.

enum.name: CurrentStateT
enum.description: Enumeration type for Current State.

enum.name: LoadingStateT
enum.description: Enumeration for Loading State.

enumMember.name: INITIAL_STATE
enumMember.description: Initial state. Usually after the user changes the reload parameters in the StaticParams structure or supervision time is expired, the dynamic parameters are reset to default value and reload sequence is reset.

enumMember.name: AUTO_CMD_LOG
enumMember.description: Load RELFSW0 with auto command log with command truncation if applicable.

enumMember.name: LOG_OMISSION_MODE
enumMember.description: Load RELFSW0 with auto command log omit command log (logOmissionMode) if applicable.

enumMember.name: USE_FFR
enumMember.description: Load file in FFR.

enumMember.name: USE_SFR
enumMember.description: Load file in SFR.

enumMember.name: LAST_PERMISSIBLE_FILE
enumMember.description: Load the last permissible file.

derivedDataType.name: NumberOfTruncationT
derivedDataType.description: Specifies Number Of Truncation Commands or Number Of Truncation Attempts.

derivedDataType.name: SubfileNumberT
derivedDataType.description: Derived numeric data type for command log subfile numbers.

derivedDataType.name: GenerationFileT
derivedDataType.description: Derived numeric data type for Generation File.

derivedDataType.name: SecondFileRangeT
derivedDataType.description: Derived numeric data type for Second File Range.

derivedDataType.name: Date
derivedDataType.description: Specifies the date format: YYYY-MM-DD.

class.name: ClassicCp
class.description:
Represents the root MOC for CP Reload Management function MOM. It allows setting parameters for system backup generation handling and command log handling during CP fallback reload on Classic system (APZ 212 3x). The parameters are used at reload attempts when the reload is caused by software faults, command initiated reload (SYREI:RANK=RELOAD) and forced executive (FEX) reload.
The command log handling can be set to automatic or manual via commandLogMode attribute.
The attributes that are not specified will not be changed.
Note that whenever user changes any parameter in the staticParams attribute of this class instance, all of the parameters in the dynamicParams attribute are automatically calculated by the system.
GENERAL RELOADING SEQUENCE
0 load MS-dump, read associated command log (optional)
1 load RELFSW0, read associated command log
2...n load RELFSW0, read truncated associated command log or omit it completely (as specified by numberOfTruncationAttempts, numberOfTruncationCommands and logOmissionMode)
...
n+1 load RELFSW1, read associated command log
n+2 load RELFSW2, read associated command log
...
n+m load RELFSWm (last file from the first file range, as determined by includeFirstFileRange and oldestAcceptedDate), read associated command log
n+m+1 load RELFSW100 (first file from the second file range, as determined by includeSecondFileRange and oldestAcceptedDate) (optional), read associated command log
n+m+2 load RELFSW101, read associated command log
...
n+m+o load RELFSWhhh (last file from the second file range, as determined by includeSecondFileRange and oldestAcceptedDate), read associated command log
n+m+o+1 return to step 0 after time supervision (as determined by the supervisionTime), else do as in step n+m+o
The order remains after system restart and reload.

action.name: resetStaticParams
action.description: This action will reset all static parameters to the default values. The default values set are: includeFirstFileRange = RELFSW0, use only RELFSW0 includeSecondFileRange = 0, use no files from second file range numberOfTruncationCommands = 10, ten additional commands truncated with each reload attempt. oldestAcceptedDate = 1990-01-01, all files after January 1st 1990 may be used for reload attempts. commandLogMode = MANUAL, use manual command log handling logOmissionMode = NONE, no log subfile omission attempts supervisionTime = 60, use a supervision time of 60 minutes numberOfTruncationAttempts = 0, no truncation attempts with RELFSW0

attribute.name: classicCpId
attribute.description: Holds the name used when identifying the MO. The value of this attribute is "1".

attribute.name: dynamicParams
attribute.description: This structure contains the current state of the reload volume. It is a number of RELFSW files and associated subfiles.

attribute.name: commandLogReferences
attribute.description: Contains references to the relevant command log subfiles. They are executed from the APG after a reload/switch-back. These values are automatically set and updated by the CP and are thus read only.

attribute.name: delayedMeasures
attribute.description: Defines what happens if the command log is unavailable for some reasons. The enabled delayed measures are automatically ordered when the command log becomes available again.

attribute.name: lastReload
attribute.description: This structure contains the values used and reload details at the time of the last reload attempt.

attribute.name: staticParams
attribute.description: Contains configurable parameters. In particular for command log handling, age restriction for generation file, manual and automatic reload attempts and time supervision setting.

attribute.name: isStaticParamsValid
attribute.description: Indicates if static parameters are valid or not. At the installation or upgrade of the CP backup function on the AP, these Static Parameters are invalid. This attribute will become valid if user changes any parameter in the StaticParams structure.

attribute.name: isDynamicParamsValid
attribute.description: Indicate Dynamic Parameters are valid or not. At the installation or upgrade of the CP backup function on the AP, these Dynamic Parameters are invalid. This attribute will become valid in one of the following cases: - User changes any parameter in the StaticParams structure. - User initiates a reload.

attribute.name: isDelayedMeasuresValid
attribute.description: Indicates if delayed measures parameters are valid or not. At the installation or upgrade of the CP backup function on the AP, these Delayed Measures Parameters are invalid. This attribute will become valid if the user initiates a reload.

attribute.name: isCommandLogReferencesValid
attribute.description: Indicate Command Log References Parameters are Valid or not. At the installation or upgrade of the CP backup function on the AP, these Command Log References Parameters are invalid. This attribute will become valid if the user initiates a reload.

attribute.name: isLastReloadValid
attribute.description: Indicates if last reload parameters are valid or not. At the installation or upgrade of the CP backup function on the AP, these Last Reload Parameters are invalid. This attribute will become valid if the user initiates a reload.

mim.author: Harika Bavana
mim.name: AxeCpReload
mim.description: CP Backup and Reload Parameters model defines parameters for system backup generation handling and command log handling on Non-Classic Dual (APZ 212 40 and later) and Cluster system. The parameters are used at reload attempts when the reload is caused by software faults, command initiated reload (SYREI:RANK=RELOAD) and forced executive (FEX) reload.

derivedDataType.name: FirstFileRangeT
derivedDataType.description: Derived numeric data type for First File Range in a Classic CP or Dual Sided CP.

derivedDataType.name: SupervisionTimeT
derivedDataType.description: Derived numeric for Supervision Time (in minute).

derivedDataType.name: FirstFileRangeClusterT
derivedDataType.description: Derived numeric data type for First File Range in CP Cluster system.

class.name: CpReloadM
class.description: This fragment provides all configuration settings applicable to reload handling of the CP. Specific classes are automatically provided by the system matching the APZ type.

attribute.name: cpReloadMId
attribute.description: Holds the name used when identifying the MO. It is automatically set.

class.name: DualSidedCp
class.description:
The class DualSidedCp configures the system backup generation handling during CP fallback reload for AXE dual sided systems, from APZ 212 40 and later. The parameters are used at reload attempts when the reload is caused by software faults as well as when the reload is command initiated (that is MML command SYREI:RANK=RELOAD;).
When the backup parameters are not defined the default backup parameter values are used.
DEFAULT BACKUP PARAMETER VALUES
firstFileRange = 0, only RELFSW0 is used from the first file range secondFileRange = 0, no files are used from second file range supervisionTime = 60, supervision time of 60 minutes is used
GENERAL RELOADING SEQUENCE
Reload attempt 1
load MS-dump
Reload attempt 2
load RELFSW0
...
Reload attempt x
load RELFSWn (last file from the first file range, as determined by firstFileRange)
Reload attempt x+1
load RELFSW100 (first file from the second file range, as determined by secondFileRange)
...
Reload attempt y
load RELFSWm (last file from the second file range, as determined by secondFileRange)
return to reload attempt 1 after time out (as determined by supervisionTime), else reload the latest reloaded file again
TIME SUPERVISION
At the start of each reload attempt, a time supervision is started. During the time supervision, any new reloading attempt is made according to the parameters. When the time supervision expires, a successful reload attempt is considered to have occurred, meaning that any subsequent reloading attempt will be made from the start of the sequence described above.
When the user change reload parameters during a reload sequence, the reload sequence will return to reload attempt 2. If the change is executed during a reload sequence and at a time out (as determined by supervisionTime), the reload sequence will return to reload attempt 1.
The order remains after system restart and reload.

attribute.name: dualSidedCpId
attribute.description: Holds the name used when identifying the MO. It is automatically set. For a Single-CP System, the value of this attribute is "1". For a Multi-CP System, the value of this attribute is "1001" for CP1 and "1002" for CP2.

attribute.name: firstFileRange
attribute.description: This attribute defines the highest file number for attempts to reload generation files from first file range. The file number must be within a consecutive series of file numbers going from 0 up to 99. The first file range is not limited to the Cluster backup range. Reload attempts are made from RELFSW0 and up to the given file number.

attribute.name: secondFileRange
attribute.description: This attribute defines the highest file number for attempts to reload generation files from second file range. The file number must be within a consecutive series of file numbers going from 100 up to 127. Reload attempts are made from RELFSW100 and up to the given file number. If defined to zero, no attempt will be made to reload from the second file range. Numeral 0, 100 - 127

attribute.name: supervisionTime
attribute.description: This attribute defines the time (in minutes) for supervision of reload attempts. Recommended value is 60. If the time since last reload attempt exceeds supervision time, then the last reload attempt is considered to be successful.

class.name: CpCluster
class.description:
The class CpCluster defines parameters for system backup generation handling during CP fallback reload on CP Cluster system. The parameters are used at reload attempts when the reload is caused by software faults and command initiated reload (SYREI:RANK=RELOAD).
When the backup parameters are not defined the default backup parameter values are used.
DEFAULT BACKUP PARAMETER VALUES
firstFileRange = 0, only RELFSW0 is used from the first file range secondFileRange = 0, no files are used from second file range supervisionTime = 60, supervision time of 60 minutes is used
GENERAL RELOADING SEQUENCE
Reload attempt 1
load MS-dump
Reload attempt 2
load RELFSW0
...
Reload attempt x
load RELFSWn (last file from the first file range, as determined by firstFileRange)
Reload attempt x+1
load RELFSW100 (first file from the second file range, as determined by secondFileRange)
...
Reload attempt y
load RELFSWm (last file from the second file range, as determined by secondFileRange)
return to reload attempt 1 after time out (as determined by supervisionTime), else reload the latest reloaded file again
TIME SUPERVISION
At the start of each reload attempt, a time supervision is started. During the time supervision, any new reloading attempt is made according to the parameters defined by the user. When the time supervision expires, a successful reload attempt is considered to have occurred, meaning that any subsequent reloading attempt will be made from the start of the sequence described above.
When the user change reload parameters during a reload sequence, the reload sequence will return to reload attempt 2. If the change executed during a reload sequence and at a time out (as determined by supervisionTime), the reload sequence will return to reload attempt 1.
The order remains after system restart and reload.

attribute.name: cpClusterId
attribute.description: Holds the name used when identifying the MO. It is automatically set to "1".

attribute.name: firstFileRange
attribute.description: This attribute defines the highest file number for attempts to reload generation files from first file range. The file number must be within a consecutive series of file numbers going from 0 up to 29. The first file range is not limited to the Cluster backup range. Reload attempts are made from RELFSW0 and up to the given file number.

attribute.name: secondFileRange
attribute.description: This attribute defines the highest file number for attempts to reload generation files from second file range. The file number must be within a consecutive series of file numbers going from 100 up to 127. Reload attempts are made from RELFSW100 and up to the given file number. If defined to zero, no attempt will be made to reload from the second file range. Numeral 0, 100 - 127

attribute.name: supervisionTime
attribute.description: This attribute defines the time (in minutes) for supervision of reload attempts. Recommended value is 60. If the time since last reload attempt exceeds supervision time, then the last reload attempt is considered to be successful.

enum.name: LengthType
enum.description: Specifies the range for files length.

enumMember.name: VARIABLE
enumMember.description: The length of a block of records is variable. The length of a block is adjusted so that no unused bytes are included.

enumMember.name: FIXED
enumMember.description: The length of a block of records is fixed. Bytes not occupied by are filled with the character specified by paddingChar attribute.

enumMember.name: EVEN
enumMember.description: The length of a block of records is variable with even number of bytes. The length is made even, if needed, by addition of a padding character specified by paddingChar attribute.

enum.name: CdrCounterFlag
enum.description: Specifies the range for CDR counting function.

enumMember.name: ENABLE
enumMember.description: CDR counting function is enabled.

enumMember.name: DISABLE
enumMember.description: CDR counting function is disabled.

enum.name: FixedFileRecordsFlag
enum.description: This enum is used for the attribute 'fixedFileRecordsFlag'.

enumMember.name: VARIABLE
enumMember.description: Length of a file record is variable.

enumMember.name: FIXED
enumMember.description: Length of a file record is fixed.

derivedDataType.name: MessageStoreName
derivedDataType.description: Specifies message store name pattern.

derivedDataType.name: NumberOfFiles
derivedDataType.description: Specifies range for number of files.

derivedDataType.name: NumberOfRecords
derivedDataType.description: This derived data type is used for the attribute 'numberOfRecords'

derivedDataType.name: RecordSize
derivedDataType.description: Specifies record size range.

derivedDataType.name: BlockHoldTime
derivedDataType.description: Specifies hold time range for block based transfer.

derivedDataType.name: FileHoldTime
derivedDataType.description: Specifies hold time range for file based transfer.

derivedDataType.name: FileSize
derivedDataType.description: Specifies file size range.

derivedDataType.name: MinFileSize
derivedDataType.description: Specifies minimum file size range.

derivedDataType.name: PaddingChar
derivedDataType.description: Specifies range for padding characters.

derivedDataType.name: Length
derivedDataType.description: Specifies length range.

derivedDataType.name: AlarmLevel
derivedDataType.description: Specifies alarm level range.

class.name: DataRecordM
class.description: Represents the root MOC for Data Record Management function. This function can be mainly segregated into the below parts: - Transfer of record data originating from CP towards message stores in the form of message records. - Transfer of message records from message stores in the form of either files or blocks. - Send the files or blocks to remote destination using TQs.

attribute.name: dataRecordMId
attribute.description: Holds the name used when identifying the MO.

class.name: BlockBasedJob
class.description:
Represents a block based record transfer job. This job facilitates in the transfer of charging data records from the message stores to the remote server in the form of volatile buffers. Unlike the file based charging transfer which stores the record transfer files onto disk, block based charging transfer does not store anything on disk. The attributes of this class help in configuring the block record transfer towards remote server. Transfer of these blocks to a remote system is achieved with the help of the Data Transfer Management function.
One or more attributes setting can fail due to one of the following reasons:
- Unset mandatory attribute(s): This message appears when the attribute 'transferQueue' is not provided during block based job creation. - Transfer queue not defined: This message appears when the transfer queue name entered is not defined. - Job already defined: This message appears when an attempt is made to define a job under a message store which already has a job (file or block) created. - No access to Data Transfer Functionality: This message appears when there is no access to the data transfer functionality. - Message Store buffer larger than block size : This message appears when length attribute value is smaller than the value of recordSize attribute of MessageStore MO class.

attribute.name: blockBasedJobId
attribute.description: Holds the name used when identifying the MO.

attribute.name: transferQueue
attribute.description: The TQ name used for transferring record data to a remote destination.

attribute.name: holdTime
attribute.description: Specifies the maximum number of seconds a call record block is held before closing it.

attribute.name: length
attribute.description: Specifies the maximum length of a call record block.

attribute.name: lengthType
attribute.description: Specifies whether the block length is fixed, variable or variable with even number of bytes.

attribute.name: paddingChar
attribute.description: The decimal value of a character used to fill unused bytes. Such unused bytes are filled in a fixed length call record block or in a call record block with a variable length but with a required even number of bytes.

class.name: FileBasedJob
class.description:
Represents a file based record transfer job. This job facilitates in the transfer of charging data records from the message stores to the remote server in the form of files. In this kind of transfer, the record transfer files are stored on disk. Each file consists of the message records which are retrieved from message stores. Each file is built with the received message records, before it is stored on data disk. The attributes of this class help in configuring the record transfer flow towards the remote server. Transfer of these files to a remote system is achieved with the help of data transfer functionality.
One or more attributes setting can fail due to one of the following reasons:
- Unset mandatory attribute(s): This message appears when the attribute 'transferQueue' is not provided during file based job creation. - Transfer queue not defined: This message appears when the transfer queue name entered is not defined. - Job already defined: This message appears when an attempt is made to define a job under a message store which already has a job (file or block) created. - No access to Data Transfer Functionality: This message appears when there is no access to the data transfer functionality. - Message Store buffer larger than fixed record size: This message appears in case of attribute fixedFileRecordsFlag is set to FIXED and value of the recordLength attribute is smaller than the value of recordSize attribute of MessageStore MO class.

action.name: endCurrentDataFile
action.description:
Ends the record transfer file which is under construction and send it to remote destination immediately.
The action can fail due to the following reason: - No data file to end: No data files are under construction in the specified FilebasedJob.

attribute.name: fileBasedJobId
