enum.name: ClusterOpMode
enum.description: This enumerator is used to specify the current Cluster Operation Mode.

enum.name: ClusterOpModeRequestedEnum
enum.description: This enumerator is used to specify the requested Cluster Operation Mode.

enum.name: FunctionalBoardNameApBlade
enum.description: This enumerator is used to specify the functional board name of an AP blade.

enumMember.name: APUB
enumMember.description: Adjunct Processor Unit.

enumMember.name: DISK
enumMember.description: Disk.

enumMember.name: DVD

enumMember.name: GEA

enum.name: LedStatusType

enumMember.name: ON

enumMember.name: OFF

enumMember.name: NOT_AVAILABLE

enumMember.name: SLOW_BLINK

enumMember.name: FAST_BLINK

enum.name: NicStatusType

enumMember.name: UNDEFINED
enumMember.description: Indicates two condition. Either that the APUB the NIC belongs to is running as AP passive node or an intermediate NIC status before obtaining the real status of it.

enumMember.name: CONNECTED
enumMember.description: It means NIC is working.

enumMember.name: MEDIA_DISCONNECTED
enumMember.description: It means that NIC is not available: it happens when it is not able to answer the status request.

enum.name: StorageType
enum.description: It specify the media storage status.

enumMember.name: UNDEFINED
enumMember.description: It is an intermediate status reported before to check the real status of the raid.

enumMember.name: ACTIVE
enumMember.description: The raid is up and running.

enumMember.name: NOT_ACTIVE
enumMember.description: The raid is down or there is a problem.

enum.name: SideEnum

enum.name: CpArchitectureType

enum.name: LedColour
enum.description: LED colour.

enum.name: TemperatureStatus

enum.name: FunctionalBoardNameOtherBlade

enumMember.name: SCB_RP

enumMember.name: GESB

enumMember.name: SCXB
enumMember.description: board SCXB.

enumMember.name: IPTB
enumMember.description: board IPTB.

enumMember.name: EPB1
enumMember.description: board EPB1.

enumMember.name: CMXB
enumMember.description: board CMXB.

enumMember.name: EVOET
enumMember.description: board EVOET.

enumMember.name: IPLB
enumMember.description: board IPLB.

enumMember.name: SMXB
enumMember.description: board SMXB.

enum.name: FunctionalBoardNameCpBlade
enum.description: This enumerator is used to specify the functional board name of a cp blade.

enumMember.name: CPUB
enumMember.description: Central Processor Unit.

enumMember.name: MAUB
enumMember.description: Maintenance Unit.

enumMember.name: RPBI_S
enumMember.description: Regional Processor Bus Interface - Serial.

enum.name: BoardResetType
enum.description: Describes allowed reset types for OtherBlade objects.

enumMember.name: NORMAL
enumMember.description: Triggers the normal reset which excludes data loss on the board.

enumMember.name: FACTORY_DEFAULT
enumMember.description: Triggers the return to the factory default settings of the board.

enumMember.name: NETWORK_BOOT
enumMember.description: Triggers a reset where the blade is set to boot from network.

enumMember.name: FORCE_NORMAL
enumMember.description: Triggers a normal reset of the blade regardless the status of the other blade in the same cluster.

enumMember.name: FORCE_NETWORK_BOOT
enumMember.description: Triggers a reset where the blade is set to boot from network. Regardless the status of the other blade in the same cluster.

enum.name: AsyncActionStateType

enumMember.name: FINISHED

enum.description: Lists of action name.

enumMember.name: UNDEFINED
enumMember.description: Undefined anction.

enumMember.name: IMPORT_CCF
enumMember.description: Import of CCF anction.

enumMember.name: ACTIVATE_CCF
enumMember.description: Activation of CCF action.

enumMember.name: CHANGE_OM_PROFILE
enumMember.description: Change of OaM Profile action.

enumMember.name: CHANGE_OP_MODE
enumMember.description: Change of Operative Mode action.

enumMember.name: EXPORT_CCF
enumMember.description: Export of CCF action.

enumMember.name: ROLLBACK_CCF
enumMember.description: Rollback to the previous CCF action.

enumMember.name: REMOVE_OM_PROFILES
enumMember.description: Remove of all supported OaM Profile action.

enum.name: OmProfileState
enum.description: Lists of OaM Profile State.

enumMember.name: UNDEFINED
enumMember.description: UNDEFINED state of the OaM Profile.

enumMember.name: ACTIVE
enumMember.description: Active state of the OaM Profile.

enumMember.name: SUPPORTED
enumMember.description: Supported state of the OaM Profile.

enum.name: CcfState
enum.description: Lists of CCF.

enumMember.name: NOT_ACTIVE
enumMember.description: Represents the state NOT_ACTIVE of CcFile MOC.

enumMember.name: ACTIVE
enumMember.description: Represents the state ACTIVE of CcFile MOC.

enumMember.name: BACKUP
enumMember.description: Represents the state BACKUP of CcFile MOC.

enum.name: ProfileScope
enum.description: Lists possible values of OaM profile scope.

enumMember.name: CP_AP
enumMember.description: To both CP and APG.

enumMember.name: ONLY_APG
enumMember.description: Only to APG.

enum.name: MauType
enum.description: Lists MAU types.

enumMember.name: UNDEFINED
enumMember.description: Specifies UNDEFINED type.

enumMember.name: MAUB
enumMember.description: Specifies hardware MAU.

enumMember.name: MAUS
enumMember.description: Specifies software MAU.

derivedDataType.name: SlotInterval
derivedDataType.description: Specifies the range for a slot number that must be a value either in the range 0-25 or 26 or 28.

derivedDataType.name: ShelfAddress
derivedDataType.description: Specifies the range for defining the shelf address for the magazine where the board is placed. The address is made up from the address plugs in the magazine. Expressed as a.b.c.d where a Address plug 0 Integer 0-15, 255. When address plug is not present this value is 255 for GESB board and 0 for all other boards. b Address plug 1 Integer 0-15, 255. When address plug is not present this value is 255 for GESB board and 0 for all other boards. c Address plug 2. Shall be 1 in Virtualized environment and 0 in nonVirtualized environment. Integer 0 d Address plug 3 Integer 0-15, 255. When address plug is not present this value is 255 for GESB board and 0 for all other boards.

derivedDataType.name: SystemNumber
derivedDataType.description: Defines the number of the system that together with systemType identifies a group of blades. It forms a working unit (i.e. an Adjunct Processor, a blade or a Dual-Sided CP). The system number must be an integer within the range of 0-999.

derivedDataType.name: ApzSystemDualCP
derivedDataType.description: Specifies the range for the APZ system of a Dual-Sided CP. The possible values are: 0: unspecified. APZ 212n: where n is 50-99

derivedDataType.name: CpType
derivedDataType.description:
It is used to specify the type of the Central Processor. The possible values are:
212n, where n is 50-99

derivedDataType.name: ApzSystemClusterCp
derivedDataType.description: It is used to define the APZ System of a Cluster CP. The possible values are: 0: unspecified. APZ 214n, where n is 01-99.

derivedDataType.name: SequenceNumber
derivedDataType.description: Specifies the range for the sequence number of a CP. -1 is used when not applicable.

derivedDataType.name: OmProfileInterval
derivedDataType.description: Identifies the OmProfile Interval.

class.name: Apg
class.description: Represents an APG and it is the parent of all blades belonging to it.

attribute.name: apgId
attribute.description: Holds the name used when identifying the MO. It is the APG name.

attribute.name: apBladesDn
attribute.description: Specifies the list of DNs of the MOs representing the blades an APG consists of.

class.name: ApBlade
class.description: Represents an AP hardware blade and contains its configuration data. The number of ApBlades does not change under normal operation. There is no need to recreate the corresponding ApBlade object if a hardware blade needs to be replaced.

action.name: block
action.description:
Requires to manually block the blade.
The action can fail due to one of the following reasons: - Blade not present: No Hardware is present in specified shelf and slot position. - Another operation ongoing: Another operation is currently in progress. - Blade already blocked: The blade in the given slot is already in state blocked. - Last working DISK cannot be blocked: The last working disk cannot be blocked. - Active APUB cannot be blocked: The action cannot block the currently active APUB. - Service not responding: The Adjunct Processor Blade Management (APBM) service does not respond. - Error when executing (general fault): An error occurred during execution.

action.name: deblock
action.description:
Requires to manually deblock the blade.
The action can fail due to one of the following reasons: - Blade not present: No Hardware is present in specified shelf and slot position. - Another operation ongoing: Another operation is currently in progress. - Blade already deblocked: The blade in the given slot is not blocked. - Service not responding: The Adjunct Processor Blade Management (APBM) service does not respond. - Error when executing (general fault): An error occurred during execution.

action.name: reset
action.description:
Requires to manually reset the blade.
The action can fail due to one of the following reasons: - Blade not present: No Hardware is present in specified shelf and slot position. - Another operation ongoing: Another operation is currently in progress. - Active APUB cannot be reset: The action cannot reset the currently active APUB. - Cannot reset blocked blade: The action cannot reset a blocked blade. - Service not responding: The Adjunct Processor Blade Management (APBM) service does not respond. - Error when executing (general fault): An error occurred during execution.

attribute.name: apBladeId
attribute.description: Holds the name used when identifying the MO. It is the shelf number, that is shelf position, of the blade.

attribute.name: systemNumber
attribute.description: Identifies a group of Ap blades that form a working unit.

attribute.name: side
attribute.description: Identifies the side of the blade (A or B).

attribute.name: functionalBoardName
attribute.description: Identifies the functional category of the blade. This attribute describes the basic functionality of the AP blade.

class.name: ApBladeInfo
class.description: Specifies the informations of an AP blade. All attributes of this class are updated when a trap is received from the SCB-RP/4 or SCX, or when local monitoring functions (on Network Interface Cards and on RAID) discover changes.

attribute.name: apBladeInfoId
attribute.description: Holds the name used when identifying the MO. It is the shelf number, that is shelf position, of the blade.

attribute.name: temperatureStatus
attribute.description: Specifies the board temperature status and it is applicable only for APUB and GEA boards. A temperature sensor present on board monitor current internal temperature.

attribute.name: biosRunningMode
attribute.description: Used to show which kind of BIOS image is set on APUB board.

attribute.name: storageStatus
attribute.description: Specifies the status of RAID established between the 2 GED presents in magazine. If a fault is detected the value is set to NOT_ACTIVE and an alarm is raised to signal it.

attribute.name: boardStatus
attribute.description: Specifies the status of the board.

attribute.name: alarmInterfaceStatus
attribute.description: Indicates the alarm interface status of GEA board. If the status is FAULTY the board can not handle alarms.

attribute.name: biosVersion
attribute.description: Specifies the BIOS version of APUB.

attribute.name: nicInfo
attribute.description: Specifies some information related to all NICs present on an APUB running as active AP node. No information are printed for an AP passive node.

attribute.name: productInfo
attribute.description:
Specifies the Hardware identity of board as below.
Product number (ROJ 208 841/21), Product Revision State (e.g. R2B), Product Name (e.g. APUB2), Serial number (e.g. A063935365) Manufacturing Date (e.g. 20090615) Vendor (e.g. Ericsson AB)

attribute.name: operationalLed
attribute.description: Specifies the operational status LED of APUB and GEA boards.

attribute.name: faultLed
attribute.description: Specifies the fault status of APUB and GEA boards.

attribute.name: maintenanceLed
attribute.description: Specifies the maintenance status of the board.

attribute.name: statusLed
attribute.description: Specifies the information status of APUB4 board.

class.name: EquipmentM
class.description: Represents the root MOC for AXE Equipment function MOM. The function configures and manage all components present in an AXE node.

attribute.name: equipmentMId
attribute.description: Holds the name used when identifying the MO.

class.name: DualSidedCp
class.description: Represents a set of one or more CP blades that work as one unit.

attribute.name: dualSidedCpId
attribute.description: Holds the name used when identifying the MO. It is the default CP name. The name format is CPx where x is the system number (either CP1 or CP2).

attribute.name: apzSystem
attribute.description: Specifies the AXE (control) system the CP belongs to.

attribute.name: cpType
attribute.description: Specifies the type of the Central Processor.

attribute.name: cpBladesDn
attribute.description: Specifies the list of DNs of the MOs representing the blades a Dual-Sided CP consists of.

attribute.name: cpAlias
attribute.description:
Represents an alternative name that an operator can use to specify a custom name for a CP. The alias is used instead of the default name into MML session header.
It is not allowed to define in a Single-CP System.

attribute.name: mauType
attribute.description: Specifies the MAU type based on hardware or software MAU.

class.name: CpBlade
class.description: Represents a CP hardware blade and contains its configuration data. For the node to operate properly, all hardware blades must have a corresponding blade object with configuration data. The number of CpBlades does not change under normal operation. There is no need to recreate the corresponding CpBlade object if an hardware blade needs to be replaced.

attribute.name: cpBladeId
attribute.description: Holds the name used when identifying the MO. It must be set to the number of the shelf slot, or shelf position, of the blade.

attribute.name: cpArchitecture
attribute.description: Identifies the type of system. (i.e.a Blade Cluster Central Processor system or a non-Blade Cluster Central Processor system) the blade belongs to. Together with systemNumber the systemType identifies a group of blades that form a working unit.

attribute.name: systemNumber
attribute.description: Represents the number of the system. It together with systemType identifies a group of blades that form a working unit.

attribute.name: side
attribute.description: Represents the side of the blade (A or B).

attribute.name: sequenceNumber
attribute.description: Used to enumarate otherwise similar blades with the same function. System type and system number so that they can distinguished from each other. For a Blade Cluster Central Processor, the sequence number must be within the range 0-63.

attribute.name: ipAliasEthB
attribute.description: Internet Protocol (IP) address of the blade for the second network (B). It must be an IPv4 address in a dotted decimal form expressed as a.b.c.d. The use of an IP alias is application specific and the only validation done for this attribute is that it is on a correct format.

attribute.name: ipAliasEthA
attribute.description: Internet Protocol (IP) address alias for the blade on the first network (A). This must be an IPv4 address in a dotted decimal form expressed as a.b.c.d. The alias address is used as an alternative IP address for the blade. The use of an IP alias is application specific and the only validation done for this attribute is that it is on a correct format.

attribute.name: ipAddressEthB
attribute.description: Represents the Internet Protocol (IP) address of the blade for the second network (backplane). It must be an IPv4 address in a dotted decimal form expressed as a.b.c.d.

attribute.name: ipAddressEthA
attribute.description: Represents the Internet Protocol (IP) address of the blade for the first network (backplane). It must be an IPv4 address in a dotted decimal form expressed as a.b.c.d.

attribute.name: functionalBoardName
attribute.description: Identifies the functional category of the blade. This attribute describes the basic functionality of the blade.

attribute.name: aliasNetmaskEthB
attribute.description: Represents the IP netmask for the alias IP address of network B (ipAliasEthB). It is specified in a dotted decimal form expressed as a.b.c.d. The use of an IP alias is application specific and the only validation done for this attribute is that it is on a correct format.

attribute.name: productInfo
attribute.description: Specifies the Hardware identity of board as below. Product number (21/ANZ 212 61). Product Revision State (e.g. R3A). Product Name (e.g. CPUB).

attribute.name: aliasNetmaskEthA
attribute.description: Represents the IP netmask for the alias IP address of network A (ipAliasEthA). It is specified in a dotted decimal form expressed as a.b.c.d. The use of an IP alias is application specific and the only validation done for this attribute is that it is on a correct format.

class.name: HardwareMgmt
class.description: Represents the HW view of all boards connected in shelves.

attribute.name: hardwareMgmtId
attribute.description: Holds the name used when identifying the MO.

class.name: OtherBlade
class.description: Represents a blade which is neither a CP blade nor an AP blade.

action.name: block
action.description:
Requires to manually block the blade.
The action can fail due to one of the following reasons: - Blade not present: No Hardware is present in specified shelf and slot position. - SNMP Failure: A SNMP failure has occurred. - Action not allowed for this Functional Board Name (FBN): The operation is not applicable to this FBN. - Service not responding: A service is not responding. - Error when executing (general fault): An error occurred during execution.

parameter.name: force
parameter.description: Indicates if the action should be forced. Regardless the status of the other board in the same cluster. Only applicable for IPLB.

action.name: deblock
action.description:
Requires to manually deblock the blade.
The action can fail due to one of the following reasons: - Blade not present: No HW is present in specified shelf and slot position. - SNMP Failure: A SNMP failure has occurred. - Action not allowed for this Functional Board Name (FBN): The operation is not applicable to this FBN. - Service not responding: A service is not responding. - Error when executing (general fault): An error occurred during execution.

action.name: reset
action.description:
Requires to manually reset the blade.
The action can fail due to one of the following reasons: - Blade not present: No Hardware is present in specified shelf and slot position. - SNMP Failure: An SNMP failure has occurred. - Action not allowed for this Functional Board Name (FBN): The operation is not applicable to this FBN. - Operation not allowed: blade blocked: Reset to factory default cannot be executed because the board is blocked, - Service not responding: A service is not responding. - Error when executing (general fault): An error occurred during execution.

parameter.name: type
parameter.description: Indicates the reset type.

attribute.name: otherBladeId
attribute.description: Holds the name used when identifying the MO. It must be set to the number of the shelf position of the blade.

attribute.name: bladeProductNumber
attribute.description: Identifies the product number of the blade.

attribute.name: currentLoadModuleVersion
attribute.description: Represents the current loaded module on the blade. it a refernce to either ApManagedSwPackage or CpManagedSwPackage MO of BladeSwMangement MoM.

attribute.name: side
attribute.description: Identifies the side of the blade (A or B).

attribute.name: ipAddressEthB
attribute.description: Identifies the Internet Protocol (IP) address of the blade for the second network (B). It must be an IPv4 address in a dotted decimal form expressed as a.b.c.d.

attribute.name: ipAddressEthA
attribute.description: Identifies the Internet Protocol (IP) address of the blade for the first network (A). It must be an IPv4 address in a dotted decimal form expressed as a.b.c.d.

attribute.name: functionalBoardName
attribute.description: Identifies the functional category of other blade board.

attribute.name: systemNumber
attribute.description: Represents the number of the system. It together with systemType identifies a group of blades that form a working unit.

attribute.name: sequenceNumber
attribute.description: Used to enumarate otherwise similar blades with the same function. System type and system number so that they can distinguished from each other. For a Blade Cluster Central Processor, the sequence number must be within the range 0-63.

class.name: Shelf
class.description: Represents a magazine containing several blades.

attribute.name: shelfId
attribute.description: Holds the name used when identifying the MO. It is used to specify the shelf address for the magazine where the board is placed.

class.name: LogicalMgmt
class.description: Represents the logical view of the configured blades.

attribute.name: logicalMgmtId
attribute.description: Holds the name used when identifying the MO.

class.name: CpCluster
class.description: Represents a cluster system that provides CP functionality. It is implemented using a variable number of Cluster CPs/CP blades.

action.name: changeClusterOpMode
action.description:
Changes the Cluster Operation Mode.
The action can fail due to one of the following reasons: - Not allowed during Cluster Operation ongoing. - Error when executing (general fault): An error occurred during execution.

parameter.name: clusterOpModeRequested
parameter.description: value of the new cluster operation mode that the system should change to.

attribute.name: cpClusterId
attribute.description: Holds the name used when identifying the MO.

attribute.name: clusterOpMode
attribute.description: Specifies the type of activities the system is able to handle. There are two types of Cluster Operation Mode, Expert Mode and Normal Mode. Expert mode is a cluster level mode of operation used for maintenance purposes (e.g. SW updates/upgrades). Normal mode is a cluster level mode of operation used for normal Operation and Maintanence activities. In this mode of operation the system protects itself, to some extent, from becoming inconsistent.

attribute.name: reportProgress
attribute.description: Specifies the progress of the last action permormed.

attribute.name: alarmMaster
attribute.description: Specifies the default name of the CP. CP that is working as the alarm master CP and receives all AP alarms from all.

attribute.name: clockMaster
attribute.description: Specifies the default name of the CP. CP that is working as the clock master CP, which is the master clock for all AP in the NE. All APs will have their clocks synchronized to the clock of the clock master CP.

attribute.name: allBcGroup
attribute.description: Specifies all Single-Sided CPs defined in the ME.

attribute.name: operativeGroup
attribute.description: Specifies the Operative Group.

class.name: ClusterCp
class.description: Represents a Single-Sided CP (Cluster CP) regardless the state.

attribute.name: clusterCpId
attribute.description: Holds the name used when identifying the MO. It holds the default CP name.

attribute.name: cpBladesDn
attribute.description: Specifies the DN of the MO representing the Single-Sided CP.

attribute.name: apzSystem
attribute.description: Specifies the AXE (control) system the CP belongs to.

attribute.name: cpType
attribute.description: Specifies the type of the CP.

attribute.name: cpAlias
attribute.description: Specifies an alternative name that an operator can use to specify a custom name for a CP. The alias is used instead of the default name into MML session header.

class.name: OmProfile
class.description: Represents the OaM profile.

attribute.name: omProfileId
attribute.description: Holds the name used when identifying the MO.

attribute.name: apzProfile
attribute.description: Specifies the APZ profile corresponding to the OaM profile.

attribute.name: aptProfile
attribute.description: Specifies the APT profile corresponding to the OaM profile.

attribute.name: state
attribute.description: Specifies the state of OaM profile.

class.name: CcFile
class.description: Represents the CCF.

attribute.name: ccFileId
attribute.description: Holds the name used when identifying the MO.

attribute.name: state
attribute.description: Specifies the state of the CCF.

attribute.name: rulesVersion
attribute.description: Specifies the version of the CCF.

class.name: OmProfileManager
class.description: Represents the management of OaM profile.

action.name: changeOmProfile
action.description:
Changes the OaM profile of the AXE node. This action is only valid for a Multi-CP System. It is an asynchronous action and the progress is readable via omProfile attribute's value.
The action can fail due to one of the following reasons: - Not allowed during Cluster Operation ongoing. - Error when executing (general fault): An error occurred during execution.

parameter.name: omProfileRequested
parameter.description: Identifies the desired OaM Profile number to set for the AXE node.

action.name: removeOmProfiles
action.description:
Removes all supported OaM profiles by removing the related instances of MOC OmProfile.
The action can fail due to one of the following reasons: - Not allowed during Cluster Operation ongoing. - Error when executing (general fault): An error occurred during execution.

action.name: activateCcFile
action.description:
Activates the CCF that has been previously imported and has state NEW as CCF of active OaM profile.
The action can fail due to one of the following reasons: - Not allowed during Cluster Operation ongoing. - Error when executing (general fault): An error occurred during execution.

action.name: exportCcFile
action.description:
Exports the CCF in use on APG file system.
The action can fail due to one of the following reasons: - Not allowed during Cluster Operation ongoing. - Error when executing (general fault): An error occurred during execution.

action.name: rollbackCcFile
action.description:
Activates the backup CCF for the active OaM profile.
The action can fail due to one of the following reasons: - Not allowed during Cluster Operation ongoing. - Error when executing (general fault): An error occurred during execution.

attribute.name: omProfileManagerId
attribute.description: Holds the name used when identifying the MO.

attribute.name: activeCcFile
attribute.description: Specifies the CCF in use. For example: CXP12345-17_R2B.

attribute.name: reportProgress
attribute.description: Specifies the progress of the last performed action.

attribute.name: omProfile
attribute.description:
Specifies the OaM profile in use. The OaM profile defines the OaM functional level that is in effect on APG and the CP Cluster.
The value is: - PROFILE <oam_profile> (where <oam_profile> is the OaM profile in use) - PROFILE <oam_profile>, SWITCHING TO <req_oam_profile> (where <oam_profile> is the OaM profile in use and <req_oam_profile> is the new OaM profile) - PROFILE <oam_profile>, COMMIT IN PROGRESS (where <oam_profile> is the new committed OaM profile but the commit operation is still ongoing)

attribute.name: scope
attribute.description: Represents the OaM profile scope. It is used to establish where the OaM profile should be applied: either to both CP and APG, or only to APG.

class.name: CcFileManager
class.description: Represents the management of CCFs stored in APG file system.

attribute.name: ccFileManagerId
attribute.description: Holds the name used when identifying the MO.

class.name: CandidateCcFile
class.description: Represents a CCF stored in APG file system and ready to be imported.

action.name: importCcFile
action.description:
Imports the CCF for the OaM profile that can be activated.
The action can fail due to one of the following reasons: - Error when executing (general fault): An error occurred during execution.

attribute.name: candidateCcFileId
attribute.description: Holds the name used when identifying the MO. It is the CCF name.

attribute.name: reportProgress
attribute.description: Specifies the progress of the last performed action.

class.name: Lag
class.description: Represents the SCX front port for enabling the LAG. The MOC allows to enable and disable LAG in SCX on front port GE1 and GE2 related to CP magazine.

attribute.name: lagId
attribute.description: Holds the name used when identifying the MO.

attribute.name: operationalState
attribute.description: Specifies the operational state of LAG on SCX. It is disabled if administrativeState is set to LOCKED or at least one SCX front ports GE1 and GE2 is down.

attribute.name: administrativeState
attribute.description: Specifies the administrative state of the LAG on SCX.

class.name: SwMau
class.description: Represents the SW emulation of CP Maintenance Unit (MAU). The MAU is responsible for controlling the CP states, monitoring the CP-A and CP-B side for faults, and provides expert commands (CPT) that allow the operator to recover the CP in case of fault.

attribute.name: swMauId
attribute.description: Holds the name used when identitying the MO.

attribute.name: administrativeState
attribute.description: Allows to change the state of SW MAU. When it is set to LOCKED, it can fail for the following reasons. - Cannot change this attribute: when PTCOI command is in progress, it inhibits locking of SW MAU.

attribute.name: operationalState
attribute.description: Specifies the state of SW MAU.

enum.name: PriorityType
enum.description: Lists the possible failover algorithms used to supervise the APG network in case the physical separation support is configured.

enumMember.name: PUBLIC_NET
enumMember.description: The public network connected to NIC(s) ETH0/ETH1 has higher priority than the one connected to NIC ETH2 in the failover algorithm. A failover is ordered only in case the network on ETH0/ETH1 is still reachable by APG.

enumMember.name: PUBLIC2_NET
enumMember.description: The public network connected to NIC(s) ETH2 has higher priority than the one connected to NIC ETH0/ETH1 in the failover algorithm. A failover is ordered only in case the network on ETH2 is still reachable by APG.

enum.name: StatusType
enum.description: StatusType is an enumeration having values NO and YES.

class.name: ExternalNetworkSurveillanceM
class.description: Represents the root MOC for Network Surveillance Management function MOM. Network Surveillance Management function pings all default gateways for the network adapter used for external communication. If PS is configured, gateway configured on the separated network are monitored as well. Alarms are raised when routers not responding and a failover is requested when none of the routers responds to the active node. If PS is configured, the failover algorithm is based on a configurable parameter that sets a priority between the two external networks.

action.name: resetFailoverCount
action.description:
Resets the attribute failoverCount to zero. Whenever Network Surveillance Management function triggers a failover the attribute failoverCount is incremented and no other failover is performed for 60 minutes post the failover trigger time. After 60 minutes, the attribute failoverCount is reset to zero and a new failover might be triggered. The action allows resetting the attribute without waiting 60 minutes. The action is not allowed in BSP.
The action can fail due to one of the following reasons: Not allowed operation for this system configuration : The action is not allowed in BSP.

attribute.name: isSurveillanceActive
attribute.description:
Specifies the current status of Network Surveillance Management function. Default value is YES, meaning that external network surveillance is active after first APG installation. In BSP default value is NO, meaning that external network surveillance is not active.
The modification can fail due to one of the following reasons: Not allowed operation for this system configuration: The attribute change is not allowed in BSP.

attribute.name: failoverCount
attribute.description: Specifies the number of performed failovers.

attribute.name: externalNetworkSurveillanceMId
attribute.description: Holds the name used when identifying the MO.

attribute.name: failoverPriority
attribute.description:
Specifies the public network to be prioritized by the failover algorithm in case physical separation support is configured. By default, public network on ETH0/ETH1 has higher priority than the physically separated public network. In BSP, no physical separation support can be configured, hence this attribute cannot be modified.
A failover is performed during the following conditions (a) If the routers connected to the prioritized network are not responding on the active node but are responding on passive node, the failover is ordered. (b) If the not prioritized network is not receiving response by its routers on active node, the failover is ordered only if on passive node both networks are receiving response by the respective routers. (c) If both networks are not working on the active node the failover is ordered only if at least one network is receiving response by the respective routers on passive node.
The modification can fail due to one of the following reasons: Not allowed operation for this system configuration: The attribute change is not allowed in BSP or when PS support is not configured.

mim.author: Harika Bavana
mim.name: AxeExternalAlarmReceiver
mim.description: AXE External Alarm Receiver function MOM.

enum.name: AlarmCondition
enum.description: Indicates the possible alarm conditions.

enumMember.name: CLOSED_CIRCUIT
enumMember.description: An external alarm is raised issued on closed circuit.

enumMember.name: OPEN_CIRCUIT
enumMember.description: An external alarm is raised on open circuit.

derivedDataType.name: DelayTime
derivedDataType.description: Specifies the delay time range between <1 to 10>.

class.name: ExternalAlarmReceiverM
class.description: Represents the root MOC for External Alarm Receiver Management function MOM.

attribute.name: externalAlarmReceiverMId
attribute.description: Holds the name used when identifying the MO.

class.name: ExternalAlarmReceiver
class.description: Represents an external alarm emitting equipment connected to an APG via an IO port on GEA board.

action.name: cease
action.description:
External alarm receiver manually ceases external alarms, when "manualCease" option is set to TRUE. This action is unsuccessful otherwise.
This action can fail due to one of the following reasons: - Internal Program Error : When service encounters internal fault. - Alarm board not available : When GEA board is not available. - Alarm board not available in the current configuration : When GEA board is not part of current configuration. - Alarm is not present : When administrativeState is not UNLOCKED or alarmState is not TRUE. - External Alarm Receiver can not be manual ceased : When manualCease attribute is not TRUE.

attribute.name: externalAlarmReceiverId
attribute.description: Holds the name used when identifying the MO. It is the external alarm receiver id, ranges from <1 to 32>, mapped with external alarm equipment. For example, if an MO ExternalAlarmReceiver is created with externalAlarmReceiverId=2 and alarmSource as DOORALARM, then any change of state from port 2 are considered alarm from DOORALARM.

attribute.name: additionalAlarmSlogan
attribute.description: Specifies the further details relating to the primary cause of the alarm.

attribute.name: alarmState
attribute.description: Specifies the alarm state of external alarm receiver. False: external alarm is not present. True: external alarm is present.

attribute.name: alarmSeverity
attribute.description: Specifies the severity of the alarm.

attribute.name: alarmSlogan
attribute.description: Indicates the primary cause of the alarm.

attribute.name: alarmCondition
attribute.description: Specifies whether the external alarm is to be initiated on open or closed circuit. If the external alarm receiver is defined to be initiated on open circuit, alarm is triggered when switch is open and ceases the alarm when the switch is closed. By default external alarm is issued on closed circuit.

attribute.name: alarmSource
attribute.description: Specifies the source of the alarm. POWER and EXTERNAL are valid enum values for externalAlarmReceiver.

attribute.name: delayTime
attribute.description: Specifies the length of the time in seconds between indication and the issuing of the alarm. The unit is in seconds. By default, the delay time is one second.

attribute.name: manualCease
attribute.description: Specifies whether the alarm source has the capability cease alarms manually. external alarm remains active until it manually ceased through action cease(). False: The alarm does not need to be manually ceased. True: The alarm need to be manually ceased.

attribute.name: administrativeState
attribute.description: Specifies the administrative state of external alarm receiver. By default it is LOCKED.

struct.name: ExternalMediaActionProgress
struct.description: Represents the structure used to store the action result Information.

structMember.name: actionName
structMember.description: Specifies the name of the invoked action. e.g exportToMedia(),formatAndExportToMedia(),importFromMedia() on ExternalMedia MO

structMember.name: result
structMember.description: Specifies the result of completed action.

structMember.name: resultInfo
structMember.description: Specifies the textual description of outcome of the operation. e.g it contains error message in case of action failure.

structMember.name: actionStartTime
structMember.description: Specifies the end time of action.

structMember.name: actionEndTime
structMember.description: Specifies the end time of action.

structMember.name: lastUpdatedTime
structMember.description: Specifies the updated time for action. Info like actionEndTime,actionstartTime,actionName,result and resultinfo.

structMember.name: state
structMember.description: Specifies the state of the invoked action.

enum.name: OperationResult
enum.description: This represents valid results in external media operations.

enumMember.name: SUCCESS
enumMember.description: The value used to represent result of action is success.

enumMember.name: FAILURE
enumMember.description: The value used to represent result of action is failed.

enumMember.name: NOT_AVAILABLE
enumMember.description: The value used to represent status of action is not available.

enum.name: ActionState
enum.description: This represents valid types of states in external media operations.

enumMember.name: RUNNING
enumMember.description: The value used to represent state of action is running.

enumMember.name: FINISHED
enumMember.description: The value used to represent state of action is finished.

enum.name: ActionType
enum.description: Represents current invoked action.

enumMember.name: EXPORT_TO_MEDIA
enumMember.description: An export from AP to media is ongoing.

enumMember.name: FORMAT_AND_EXPORT_TO_MEDIA
enumMember.description: An export from AP to media, contextually erased, is ongoing.

enumMember.name: IMPORT_FROM_MEDIA
enumMember.description: An import from media to AP is ongoing.

enumMember.name: LOCK_MEDIA
enumMember.description: Enabling media access is ongoing.

enumMember.name: UNLOCK_MEDIA
enumMember.description: Disabling media access is ongoing.

enum.name: ExternalMediaType
enum.description: Specifies type of the external media.

enumMember.name: DVDMINUSR
enumMember.description: Used media is DVD-R.

enumMember.name: DVDPLUSR
enumMember.description: Used media is DVD+R.

enumMember.name: DVDPLUSRW
enumMember.description: Used media is DVD+RW.

enumMember.name: DVDMINUSRW
enumMember.description: Used media is DVD-RW.

enumMember.name: THUMBDRIVE
enumMember.description: Used media is THUMBDRIVE.

class.name: ExternalMediaM
class.description:
Represents the root MOC for External Media Management function MOM. The function allows moving data to/from an external media: like a DVD,Thumb Drive from/to APG file system. It supports following actions:
1) Export to media - Copies of file(s)/folder(s) from APG file system to the media.
2) Format and export to media -Clears the media contents: Copies files from the APG file system to media.
3) Import from media - Copies of file(s)/folder(s) from the media to APG file system.
4) Fetch media information - Fetches information related to external media.
All above operations require that the External Media Management function state is enabled.
Function state can be changed using the following 2 actions:
1) Unlock media - Enables External Media Management function by mounting the external media contents. Media contents are mounted to folder /media in APG file system.
2) Lock media - Disables External Media function by unmounting the external media contents. Media contents are unmounted from folder /media in APG file system.

action.name: exportToMedia
action.description:
Exports specified list of file(s) or folder(s) from the APG file system to media.
Specified file(s) or folder(s) are taken from the predefined folder "media" in the AP file system and copied to media maintaining the same folder structure. This action is applicable for both readonly and rewritable media. Once copy starts the result is shown in attribute resultOfOperation.
The action can fail due to one of the following reasons: - External media access is not enabled: When attribute OperationalState is in DISABLED state. - Invalid Argument: Invalid argument supplied by the user e.g. file not found or invalid label. - Media drive is busy: When exportToMedia is initiated before completion of previously executed action. - No external media board available: When Media board is not present. - No Media in Media Drive: Media Drive has no media. - Operation is already in progress: When exportToMedia is initiated before completion of previous exportToMedia. - Unable to connect to server: When connected DVD is not reachable.

parameter.name: label
parameter.description:
Specifies the label (for example volume name) given to external media during export operation.
Label can be set to external media only during first copy operation. It is not possible to set label on external media in subsequent append operations.
For rewritable media (i.e for DVD+RW or DVD-RW), label can be set during every copy operation. For readonly media (i.e for DVD+R or DVD-R), label can be set only during first copy operation. It is not possible to set label on these media in subsequent append operations.

parameter.name: fileList
parameter.description: Specifies the list of file(s)/folder(s) path that has to be copied to the media. In case of multiple files/folders to be copied, each file/folder path must be ";" separated within the complete string.

action.name: refreshMediaInfo
action.description:
Fetches information related to external media. This information includes type of media, total, free and used spaces of media. Attributes mediaType, totalSizeOfMedia, freeSpaceOnMedia, totalSizeOnMedia attributes are updated with the latest data after completion of action.
The action can fail due to one of the following reasons: - External media access is not enabled: When OperationalState is in DISABLED state. - Media drive is busy: When refreshMediaInfo is initiated before completion of previously executed action.

action.name: importFromMedia
action.description:
Imports file(s)/folder(s) from the media to APG file system. Specified file(s) or folder(s) are copied from media to the predefined folder "media" in the APG file system.
Once copy starts the result is shown in attribute resultOfOperation.
The action can fail due to one of the following reasons: - External media access is not enabled: When OperationalState is in DISABLED state. - No external media board available: When Media board is not present. - No Media in Media Drive: Media Drive has no media. - Operation is already in progress: When importFromMedia is initiated before completion of previous importFromMedia. - Media drive is busy: Media drive is busy with some other operation. - Invalid Argument: Invalid argument supplied by the user e.g file not found. - Media empty, copy is not possible: When media is empty.

parameter.name: overwriteEnable
parameter.description: Specifies enable/disable of overwrite during copy operation. If true, file/folder is overwritten in destination folder if a file/folder with same name exists. If false, file/folder is not overwritten in destination folder if a file/folder with same name exists and the copy operation fails.

parameter.name: destinationFolder
parameter.description: Specifies complete path of destination folder that is being used for import from media operation.

parameter.name: fileList
parameter.description: Specifies the list of files/folders path that has to be copied from the media. In case of multiple files/folders to be copied,each file/folder path must be ";" separated within the complete string.

action.name: formatAndExportToMedia
action.description:
Formats the media and copies specified list of file from the AP file system to media. Specified file(s) or folder(s) are taken from the predefined folder "media" in the APG file system. Above files are copied to media maintaining the same folder structure after erasing the media contents. This action is applicable only for rewritable media. Once copy starts the result is shown in attribute resultOfOperation.
The action can fail due to one of the following reasons: - External media access is not enabled: When OperationalState is in DISABLED state. - Invalid Argument: Invalid argument supplied by the user e.g file not found or invalid label. - Media drive is busy: When formatAndExportToMedia is initiated: before completion of previously executed action. - No external media board available: When Media board is not present. - No Media in Media Drive: Media Drive has no media. - Operation is already in progress: When formatAndExportToMedia is initiated: before previous action is completed. - Overwriting data to this media is not supported: When Media media is readonly. - Unable to connect to server: When connected DVD is not reachable.

parameter.name: label
parameter.description: Specifies the label (for example volume name) given to external media during copy operation.

parameter.name: fileList
parameter.description: Specifies the list of file(s)/folder(s) path that has to be copied to the media. In case of multiple files/folders to be copied, each file/folder path must be ";" separated within the complete string.

action.name: lockMedia
action.description:
Disables External Media Management function by unmounting the external media. Clears the predefined folder /media on APG file system.
The attribute operationalState is set to DISABLED after successful action completion. This is asynchronous action and result is updated in attribute resultOfOperation.
The action can fail due to one of the following reasons: - Operation is already in progress: When this action is initiated before completion of previous one. - Media drive is busy: When this action is initiated before completion of another ongoing action.

action.name: unlockMedia
action.description:
Enables External Media Management function by mounting the external media. Making the related file system visible in the predefined folder /media on APG file system.
The attribute operationalState is set to ENABLED after successful action completion. This is asynchronous action and result is updated in attribute resultOfOperation.
The action can fail due to one of the following reasons: - Media drive is busy: When this action is initiated before completion of another ongoing action. - No external media board available: When Media board is not present. - No Media in Media Drive: Media Drive has no media or corrupted. - Operation is already in progress: When this action is initiated before completion of a previous one. - Unlocking failed due to media already mounted on the other AP: When DVD is already mounted to the other AP. - Unlocking Failed due to mount failure: The mount failed in case of thumb drive.

parameter.name: formatEnable
parameter.description: Specifies enable/disable of format during unlock operation. If true, the external media (thumb drive) will get format and then mount to the predefined folder /media on APG file system. If false, mounts the external media to /media on APG file system.

attribute.name: externalMediaMId
attribute.description: Holds the name used when identifying the MO.

attribute.name: freeSpaceOnMedia
attribute.description: Specifies the avaiable free space on external media.

attribute.name: lastUpdatedTime
attribute.description: Specifies the updated time for media attributes. Attributes like mediaType,ownerOfMedia, totalSizeOfMedia, usedSpaceOnMedia,freeSpaceOnMedia.

attribute.name: mediaType
attribute.description: Specifies type of the external media.

attribute.name: totalSizeOfMedia
attribute.description: Specifies the total size of external media in KB.

attribute.name: usedSpaceOnMedia
attribute.description: Specifies the used space of external media in percentage (%).

attribute.name: resultOfOperation
attribute.description: Specifies the result of external media operation.

attribute.name: operationalState
attribute.description: Specifies the operational state of External Media Management function. It can assume one of the following values: DISABLED: The external media cannot be accessed. The predefined folder "/media" on APG file system is empty. ENABLED: The external media can be accessed. The predefined folder "/media" on APG file system shows the related file system.

struct.name: AsyncActionProgress
struct.description: Used by NMS to query progress of ongoing asyncronous actions.

structMember.name: actionName
structMember.description: The name of the invoked asynchronous action.

structMember.name: additionalInfo
structMember.description: Used for logging significant messages during execution of an action. Each log message is a separate value. The NMS system may display this information, but it is not recommended to build any logic on the content of this field.

structMember.name: progressInfo
structMember.description: Textual information describing the actual state of the execution of the action. The NMS system may display this information, but it is not recommended to build any logic on the content of this field.

structMember.name: progressPercentage
structMember.description: Progress of the action. The range is between 0 and 100.

structMember.name: result
structMember.description: Result state of completed action. This field has the value NOT_AVAILABLE if the action is not finished.

structMember.name: resultInfo
structMember.description: Textual description of the outcome/result of the action containing useful info for the NMS. It can contain an error message if the action failed. The NMS system may display this information, but it is not recommended to build any logic on the content of this field.

structMember.name: state
structMember.description: Current state of the action.

structMember.name: actionId
structMember.description: The struct member actionId uniquely identifies each value of a multivalued attribute of type struct AsyncActionProgress.

structMember.name: timeActionStarted
structMember.description: The date and time when the current action was started.

structMember.name: timeActionCompleted
structMember.description: The date and time when the action was completed (successfully or unsuccessfully).

structMember.name: timeOfLastStatusUpdate
structMember.description: The date and time when the struct member state was last updated.

enum.name: Functions
enum.description: Defines the possible distributable AP functions among the AP nodes of a Multi-APG system.

enumMember.name: CHS
enumMember.description: Indicates the first MO MessageStore provided by Data Record Management function MOM.

enumMember.name: CHS1
enumMember.description: Indicates the second MO MessageStore provided by Data Record Management function MOM.

enumMember.name: CHS2
enumMember.description: Indicates the third MO MessageStore provided by Data Record Management function MOM.

enumMember.name: CHS3
enumMember.description: Indicates the fourth MO MessageStore provided by Data Record Management function MOM.

enumMember.name: CHS4
enumMember.description: Indicates the fifth MO MessageStore provided by Data Record Management function MOM.

enumMember.name: CHS5
enumMember.description: Indicates the sixth MO MessageStore provided by Data Record Management function MOM.

enumMember.name: CHS6
enumMember.description: Indicates the seventh MO MessageStore provided by Data Record Management function MOM.

enumMember.name: CHS7
enumMember.description: Indicates the eighth MO MessageStore provided by Data Record Management function MOM.

class.name: FunctionDistributionM
class.description:
It is the root MOC for Function Distribution Management function MOM. The function allows distributing AP functions among APGs in a Dual-APG configuration and a user can decide which APG is appointed to provide each of them. Th set of such AP functions is predefined and cannot be changed.
Currently the AP functions supporting the distribution among AP nodes are the Message Stores entities defined as MessageStore MOCs in Data Record Management function MOM.
By default are present 8 Function MOs as children of MO Apg=AP1.
e.g. Dual AP system: there are 2 AP nodes named AP1 and AP2. The MOM contains: - the FunctionDistributionM MO with rdn functionDistributionMId=1 - 2 Apg MOs children of FunctionDistributionM MO representing the AP nodes with rdn apgId=AP1 and apgId=AP2 - 8 Function MOs as children of AP1 MO representing the Message Stores. Rdn are functionId=CHS, functionId=CHS1,functionId=CHS2,functionId=CHS3,functionId=CHS4,functionId=CHS5,functionId=CHS6,functionId=CHS7.

action.name: moveFunction
action.description:
Allows moving of an AP function from an APG node to another one part of a Multi-APG system.
The result of the action can be monitored checking the attribute progressReport.
If the action is successfully executed then the specified Function MO is moved under the specified Apg MO. If the action fails then the specified Function MO remains under the source Apg MO and attribute progressReport reports the sub-attribute result as FAILURE and the sub-attribute resultInfo with one of the following diagnostics messages:
"AP Function <Function MO> failed to be moved on <Apg MO>: <error message>"
where <error message> is one of the following: - AP is not defined. An AP with the specified name does not exist. - Duplicated function. The Function MO is already specified on the target AP MO. - Error when executing. An internal error occurred during the execution.

parameter.name: function
parameter.description: The Function MO key value to distribute.

parameter.name: ap
parameter.description: Indicates the identity of the APG where the AP function is going to be moved on.

attribute.name: functionDistributionMId
attribute.description: Holds the name used when identifying the MO.

attribute.name: progressReport
attribute.description: Specifies the progress report (including result) of the ongoing moveFunction action. This MO supports only one action to be executed at a time.

class.name: Apg
class.description: Represents an APG in a Single-APG or Dual-APG configuration.

attribute.name: apgId
attribute.description: Holds the name used when identifying the MO. It is expressed as AP<n> where <n> is the number of APG connected into AXE node. For example in a Dual-APG configuration the value can be AP1 or AP2.

class.name: Function
class.description: Represents the AP function that can be distributed among APGs in a Dual-APG configuration.

attribute.name: functionId
attribute.description: Holds the name used when identifying the MO. It is the string that uniquely identify an AP function.

attribute.name: description
attribute.description: Specifies the description of the distributable AP function.

attribute.name: functionDn
attribute.description: Specifies the DN of the MOC providing the AP function.

slot.name: description
slot.value: Represents the 5th message store handled by Data Record Management function.

slot.name: description
slot.value: Represents the 4th message store handled by Data Record Management function.

slot.name: description
slot.value: Represents the 8th message store handled by Data Record Management function.

slot.name: description
slot.value: Represents the 2nd message store handled by Data Record Management function.

slot.name: description
slot.value: Represents the 3rd message store handled by Data Record Management function.

slot.name: description
slot.value: Represents the 6th message store handled by Data Record Management function.

slot.name: description
slot.value: Represents the 7th message store handled by Data Record Management function.

slot.name: description
slot.value: Represents the 1st message store handled by Data Record Management function.

enum.name: ApgIdentity
enum.description: Defines the identity of an APG.

enumMember.name: AP1
enumMember.description: Indicates AP1.

enumMember.name: AP2
enumMember.description: Indicates AP2.

enum.name: ApNodeIdentity
enum.description: Indicates the AP node identity.

enumMember.name: A
enumMember.description: Node A.

enumMember.name: B
enumMember.description: Node B.

enum.name: ApgOamAccessType
enum.description: Lists the possible ways to reach APG from MS for OaM activities.

enumMember.name: FRONTCABLE
enumMember.description: Front cables are used.

enumMember.name: NOCABLE

derivedDataType.name: WelcomeMessage
derivedDataType.description: Specifies the pattern to follow for welcomeMessage attribute.

class.name: AxeFunctions
class.description:
Represents the root MOC for AXE Functions Management function MOM.
AXE Functions Management consists of AXE specific functions aiming to configure and operate an AXE node.
The AXE specific functions are structured in five function layers and each of them is a functions set belonging to it:
Data Output Handling. Functions set handling statistical counters collection, and data transfer with local media or remote destination. DataOutputHandling is the root MOC for the related MOM.
Security Handling. Functions set allowing to configure the audit logging, the hardening and the user authority on APG. SecurityHandling is the root MOC for the related MOM.
Supervision Handling. Functions set providing, in the applicable APG configurations, the handling of externally generated alarms in the AXE node and supervision of network interfaces used to communicate with a MS.
System Component Handling. Functions set allowing to administer the HW, MW and SW configuration for the different components in the AXE node. SystemComponentHandling is the root MOC for the related MOM.
System Handling. Functions set providing basic configurations for handling the AXE node, like license management and alphanumeric device administration. SystemHandling is the root MOC for the related MOM.

attribute.name: axeFunctionsId
attribute.description: Holds the name used when identifying the MO.

attribute.name: systemType
attribute.description: Specifies the AXE system type.

attribute.name: axeApplication
attribute.description: Specifies the AXE node type.

attribute.name: apgShelfArchitecture
attribute.description: Specifies the shelf infrastructure in which APG is located.

attribute.name: ap
attribute.description: Specifies the APG identity a user is logged in.

attribute.name: apgOamAccess
attribute.description: Specifies how the APG is accessed from an MS for OaM activities. Either via front cables or via backplane connection.

class.name: SecurityHandling
class.description:
Represents the root MOC for Security Handling function MOM.
Security Handling is an AXE specific function layer consisting of functions set allowing to configure the AP sessions properties, audit logging, TS users policy and user authority for MML sessions.
It allows defining the welcome message text.
One or more attributes setting can fail due to one of the following reasons: - Unreasonable value: Welcome message contains invalid special characters.

attribute.name: securityHandlingId
attribute.description: Holds the name used when identifying the MO.

attribute.name: welcomeMessage
attribute.description:
Specifies the welcome message to be displayed before entering the password in all session types. The welcome message is not displayed when a TLS-based session type is opened. The welcome message contains the operator legal notice and it might optionally contain the privacy notice as well, according to company policies and local country regulations, which sets the right expectations for users regarding authorized and acceptable use of the node. The privacy notice is to be showed in the countries where the usage of the product may require providing Notice of privacy policy. When configuring this attribute, the tag "
" can be used to insert a line break into the string at the time it is shown in the session. The default value of this attribute consists of the legal notice string only. The welcome message string is always shown between a default sequence of wildcard characters "*".

derivedDataTypeRef.name: WelcomeMessage
derivedDataTypeRef.defaultValue: IF YOU ARE NOT AN AUTHORIZED USER, PLEASE EXIT IMMEDIATELY.

class.name: SystemHandling
class.description:
Represents the root MOC for System Handling function MOM.
System Handling is an AXE specific function layer providing basic configurations for handling the AXE node, like license management and alphanumeric device administration.

attribute.name: systemHandlingId
attribute.description: Holds the name used when identifying the MO.

class.name: SupervisionHandling
class.description:
Represents the root MOC for Supervision Handling function MOM.
Supervision Handling is an AXE specific function layer consisting of functions set providing, in the applicable APG configurations, the handling of externally generated alarms in the AXE node and supervision of network interfaces used to communicate with a MS.

attribute.name: supervisionHandlingId
attribute.description: Holds the name used when identifying the MO.

class.name: DataOutputHandling
class.description:
Represents the root MOC for Data Output Handling function MOM.
Data Output Handling is an AXE specific function layer consisting of functions set handling statistical counters collection, and data transfer with local media or remote destination.

attribute.name: dataOutputHandlingId
attribute.description: Holds the name used when identifying the MO.

class.name: SystemComponentHandling
class.description:
Represents the root MOC for System Component Handling function MOM.
System Component Handling is an AXE specific function layer allowing to administer the different components present in an AXE node.

attribute.name: systemComponentHandlingId
attribute.description: Holds the name used when identifying the MO.

struct.name: HwProductIdentity
struct.description: Contains product information of a component present in the AXE node.

structMember.name: productDesignation
structMember.description: Product name.

structMember.name: productNumber
structMember.description: The product number in Ericsson ABC format.

structMember.name: productRevision
structMember.description: The product revision in the form R[1-9][A-Z]

enum.name: BusTypeEnumeration
enum.description: This type holds the bus type: IPMI and MBUS are the elements of the enumeration. IPMI indicates the board's bus type is intelligent platform management interface whereas MBUS indicates he board's bus type is maintenance bus.

enumMember.name: IPMI
enumMember.description: IPMI indicates the board's bus type is Intelligent Platform Management Interface.

enumMember.name: MBUS
enumMember.description: MBUS indicates the board's bus type is Maintenance Bus.

enum.name: DeviceTypeEnumeration
enum.description: This type holds the values for the device type of power and fan module, LOD and HOD are the two elements of the enumeration. LOD indicates that the power and fan module is a low ohmic dstribution device whereas HOD indicates that the power and fan module is a high ohmic distribution device.

enumMember.name: HOD
enumMember.description: HOD indicates that the Power and Fan Module is High Ohmic Distribution device.

enumMember.name: LOD
enumMember.description: LOD indicates that the Power and Fan Module is Low Ohmic Distribution device

derivedDataType.name: CabinetNumberInterval
derivedDataType.description: This type is defined to hold the cabinet number value: possible values are 1..99.

derivedDataType.name: CabinetRowInterval
derivedDataType.description: This type is defined to hold cabinet row number: possible values are 1-999.

derivedDataType.name: XPositionInterval
derivedDataType.description: This type is defined to hold values for x position of shelves and blades in the cabinet: possible values are 0..255.

derivedDataType.name: YPositionInterval
derivedDataType.description: This type is defined to hold values for y position of shelves and blades in the cabinet: possible values are 1..255.

class.name: HardwareInventoryM
class.description:
Represents the root MOC for Hardware Inventory Management function. The function provides HW related information for all blades present in an AXE node consisting of EGEM2 magazines with either SCXor SMX acting as shelf manager. It does not provide any info in all other cases. So the MO is system created but only in case of EGEM2-SCX or SMX shelf architecture.
Shown HW information are cabinets, shelves, blades and power&fan modules present in the node. Moreover the operator can set some user configurable site specific data such as the position of the shelf or blade in the cabinet.

attribute.name: hardwareInventoryMId
attribute.description: Holds the name used when identifying the MO.

class.name: ShelfInfo
class.description: This class provides hardware inventory information related to each shelf present in the node. The system creates an instance of this class for each shelf and fills all attributes with the retrieved information. The operator can set site specific data such as x position and y posistion of shelf and also the cabinet number and cabinet row of the cabinet the shelf belongs to.

attribute.name: serialNumber
attribute.description: It indicates the shelf serial number

attribute.name: supplier
attribute.description: It indicates the name of the shelf supplier. Usually this value is Ericsson AB for a shelf provided by Ericsson.

attribute.name: manufacturingDate
attribute.description: It indicates the shelf manufacturing date.

attribute.name: cabinetNumber
attribute.description: It indicates the cabinet number for the shelf. In particular this value represents the cabinet number a Shelf belongs to.

attribute.name: cabinetRow
attribute.description: It indicates the cabinet row number for a shelf. In particular the related value represent the cabinet row a shelf belongs to.

attribute.name: xPosition
attribute.description: It indicates the x position of the shelf in the cabinet.

attribute.name: yPosition
attribute.description: It indicates the Y position of the shelf in the cabinet.

attribute.name: shelfInfoId
attribute.description: Holds the name used when identifying the MO. It is the address of the shelf.

attribute.name: productIdentity
attribute.description: It indicates the product identity in terms of product designation, product number and revision of the shelf.

class.name: BladeInfo
class.description: This class provides hardware inventory information related to a blade present in a shelf. The system creates an instance of this class for each blade present in a shelf and fills all attributes with the retrieved information. The operator can set site specific data such as x position and y posistion of the blade.

attribute.name: xPosition
attribute.description: It indicates the x position of the blade in the cabinet.

attribute.name: yPosition
attribute.description: It indicates the y position of the blade in the cabinet.

attribute.name: serialNumber
attribute.description: It indicates the blade serial number.

attribute.name: supplier
attribute.description: It indicates the name of the blade supplier. Usually this value is Ericsson AB for blades provided by Ericsson.

attribute.name: manufacturingDate
attribute.description: It indicates the blade manufacturing date.

attribute.name: busType
attribute.description: It indicates the information about the blade bus type.

attribute.name: bladeInfoId
attribute.description: Holds the name used when identifying the MO. It is the slot position of the blade in the shelf.

attribute.name: productIdentity
attribute.description: It indicates the product identity in terms of product designation, product number and revision for a blade.

class.name: PowerFanModuleInfo
class.description: This class provides hardware inventory information related to the module providig power supply and fan to the shelf. The system creates at most two instances of this class representing the upper and the lower power and fan module present for each shelf. The operator can set site specific data such as x position and y posistion of the power and fan module .

attribute.name: powerFanModuleInfoId
attribute.description: Holds the name used when identifying the MO.

attribute.name: productName
attribute.description: It indicates the power fan module product name.

attribute.name: productNumber
attribute.description: It indicates the product number for the power and fan module.

attribute.name: productRevision
attribute.description: It indicates the power fan module product revision.

attribute.name: productSerialNumber
attribute.description: It indicates the power fan module product serial number.

attribute.name: hardwareVersion
attribute.description: It indicates the power and fan module harware verision.

attribute.name: manufacturingDate
attribute.description: It indicates the power and fan module manufacturing date.

attribute.name: deviceType
attribute.description: It indicates the information about which is the device type for the module providing power and fan to the shelf.

attribute.name: xPosition
attribute.description: It indicates the xposition for the power and fan module.

attribute.name: yPosition
attribute.description: It indicates the yposition of the power and fan module.

mim.author: Sivakumar Ganoz
mim.name: AxeInfrastructureTransportM
mim.description: AXE Infrastructure Transport Management function MOM.

struct.name: Ipv4SubnetVlan
struct.description: IPV4 subnet for the VLAN ID classification. One or more attributes setting can fail due to one of the following reasons: - Infrastructure Communication Failure: Communication with infrastructure HW failed and requested configuration could not be applied. - Invalid VLAN ID reference: Specified VLAN ID does not match any existing VLAN on the Bridge. - Unsupported Bridge for Subnet VLAN: Subnet VLAN is not supported on the selected Bridge. - Invalid IPv4 subnet: Specified value for ipv4Subnet attribute is not a valid IPv4 subnet. - Specified Ipv4Subnet is already used: Another Subnet VLAN with the same IPv4 subnet already exists on the same Bridge.

structMember.name: vlanId
structMember.description: Specifes the VLAN ID to be assigned to the classified frames.

structMember.name: ipv4Subnet
structMember.description: Specifies the IPv4 subnet for the VLAN ID classification. One subnet can be assigned more than one VLAN.

enum.name: VrrpSessionState
enum.description: VRRP state of the virtual router.

enumMember.name: INIT
enumMember.description: Indicates that the virtual router is waiting for a startup event.

enumMember.name: BACKUP
enumMember.description: Indicates that the virtual router is monitoring the availability of the master router.

enumMember.name: MASTER
enumMember.description: Indicates that virtual router is forwarding packets for IP addresses associated with this router.

enum.name: VrrpErrReason
enum.description: Possible reasons for encountered VRRP errors.

enum.name: BfdSessionDiagnosticCode
enum.description: Common BFD diagnostic codes.

enum.name: BfdSessionOperState
enum.description: The operational states of a BFD session.

enum.name: AclAction
enum.description: ACL actions.

enumMember.name: PERMIT
enumMember.description: Allow the packet that matches the ACL to flow.

enumMember.name: DENY
enumMember.description: Drop the packet if it matches the ACL.

enum.name: FragmentType
enum.description: Type of IP fragment.

enumMember.name: FRAGMENT
enumMember.description: The entry matches all fragments. FO > 0 or MF != 0.

enumMember.name: INITIAL
enumMember.description: The entry matches complete (unfragmented) packets as well as initial fragments, FO==0.

enumMember.name: NONINITIAL
enumMember.description: The entry matches non-initial fragments. FO>0.

enum.name: BfdStaticRoutesInterfaceType
enum.description: State of BFD static routes.

enum.name: VrrpvPrioSession
enum.description: Configure the type of this VRRP router.

enumMember.name: TRUE
enumMember.description: Vrrpv3 session with higher priority than the other session referencing the same Vrrpv3Interface MO.

enumMember.name: FALSE
enumMember.description: Vrrpv3 session with lower priority than the other session referencing the same Vrrpv3Interface MO.

enum.name: EthPortOperatingMode
enum.description: Operating modes specify speed, duplex and master/slave states.

enumMember.name: 10M_HALF
enumMember.description: 10Mbps speed, half duplex.

enumMember.name: 10M_FULL
enumMember.description: 10Mbps speed, full duplex.

enumMember.name: 100M_HALF
enumMember.description: 100Mbps speed, half duplex.

enumMember.name: 100M_FULL
enumMember.description: 100Mbps speed, full duplex.

enumMember.name: 1G_FULL
enumMember.description: 1Gbps speed, full duplex.

enumMember.name: 1G_FULL_SLAVE
enumMember.description: 1Gbps speed, full duplex, slave mode.

enumMember.name: 1G_FULL_MASTER
enumMember.description: 1Gbps speed, full duplex, master mode.

enumMember.name: 10G_FULL
enumMember.description: 10Gbps speed, full duplex.

enumMember.name: 40G_FULL
enumMember.description: 40Gbps speed, full duplex.

enumMember.name: 100G_FULL
enumMember.description: 100Gbps speed, full duplex.

enumMember.name: 10G_FULL_MASTER
enumMember.description: 10Gbps speed, full duplex, master mode.

enumMember.name: 10G_FULL_SLAVE
enumMember.description: 10Gbps speed, full duplex, slave mode.

derivedDataType.name: Ipv4AddressAndPrefixLengthStr
derivedDataType.description:
IPv4 address string, controlled by a regular expression. The address is specified in dotted-quad decimal notation in accordance with RFC791, without leading zeros.
The IPv4 address is within the range [0-126,128-223].[0-255].[0-255].[0-255], 7-15 characters. The prefix length is a number from 0 to 32.

derivedDataType.name: DistanceValueType
derivedDataType.description: Distance Value Type.

derivedDataType.name: Ipv4UnicastAddressStr
derivedDataType.description:
IPv4 address string, controlled by a regular expression.
The address is specified in dotted-quad decimal notation in accordance with RFC791, without leading zeros.
IPv4 addresses are within the range [1-126,128-223].[0-255].[0-255].[0-255], 7-15 characters. Valid characters: 0123456789.
Example: 1.1.1.1, 1.1.255.255

derivedDataType.name: VlanId
derivedDataType.description: VLAN id 12-bit value.

derivedDataType.name: MacAddressStr
derivedDataType.description:
MAC address string, controlled by a regular expression.
Address should be specified in colon separated hexadecimal notation as described in IEEE 802. MAC addresses must have 17 characters. Valid characters: 0123456789abcdefABCDEF Regular expression: ([0-9A-Fa-f]{2}:){5}[0-9A-Fa-f]{2} Example: 00:12:34:56:78:9A

derivedDataType.name: VlanName
derivedDataType.description: Type of vlanName. The string must not contain whitespace and must be less than 32 characters long.

derivedDataType.name: IpDscpStrST
derivedDataType.description:
Smart type for IpDscp, covering a single value or a range. Regexp : ^((BT)|((BT)(\.\.)(BT)))$ where BT=[0-9]|[1-5][0-9]|6[0-3]
A DSCP value. Can be a single value [dd] or a range [dd..dd], where dd represents an integer in {0..63}.
Example: 1 or 5..10

derivedDataType.name: IcmpType
derivedDataType.description:
Regular expression pattern for IP ACL ICMP Type [0-255], covering single and range.
Regexp : ^((BT)|((BT)(\.\.)(BT)))$ where BT=[0-9]{1,2}|1[0-9]{2}|2[0-4][0-9]|25[0-5]

derivedDataType.name: IpProtocolNumberStrST
derivedDataType.description:
Regular expression pattern for IP protocol numbers [0-255], covering a single value or a range.
Regexp : ^((BT)|((BT)(\.\.)(BT)))$ where BT=[0-9]{1,2}|1[0-9]{2}|2[0-4][0-9]|25[0-5]
Example: 1 or 5..10

derivedDataType.name: L4PortStrST
derivedDataType.description:
Regular expression pattern type for transport protocol port [0-65535] inputs.
Covering list of values, ranges. Regexp=^((BT)|((BT)(\.\.)(BT)))$ where BT=[0-9]{1,4}|[1-5][0-9]{4}|6[0-4][0-9]{3}|65[0-4][0-9]{2}|655[0-2][0-9]|6553[0-5].

derivedDataType.name: Priority
derivedDataType.description:
Priority of a policy rule.
Priority values must be unique amongst policy rules under the same policy. Rule: valid values are 0 and positive integers. Note: 0 is the highest priority, larger values give lower priority.
Maximum possible range: 0..65535

derivedDataType.name: VirtualRouterId
derivedDataType.description:
Virtual Router Identifier. It must be in the format: <subrack>_<slot>:<VRname> where <subrack> and <slot> are the subrack address and the slot position of the physical router hosting the VR. <VRname> is a string identifying the VR, it must not contain white spaces or special characters.
E.g.: 1.0.0.0_0:VRInstance1

rule.exceptionText: Virtual Router Identifier must be in the format: "<subrack>_<slot>:<VRname>". VRname must not contain special character and must not exceed 12 characters in length.
rule.name: Pattern Constraint

derivedDataType.name: AddressId
derivedDataType.description: Address Identifier.

rule.exceptionText: AddressId must not contain special character and must not exceed 12 characters in length.
rule.name: Pattern Constraint

derivedDataType.name: VrrpSessionId
derivedDataType.description: VRRP Session Identifier.

rule.exceptionText: VrrpSessionId must not contain special character and must not exceed 12 characters in length.
rule.name: Pattern Constraint

derivedDataType.name: BfdProfileId
derivedDataType.description: BFD Profile Identifier.

derivedDataType.name: InterfaceId
derivedDataType.description: Interface Identifier.

derivedDataType.name: DstId
derivedDataType.description: Dst Identifier.

rule.exceptionText: DstId must not contain special character and must not exceed 12 characters in length.
rule.name: Pattern Constraint

derivedDataType.name: NextHopId
derivedDataType.description: NextHop Identifier.

rule.exceptionText: NextHopId must not contain special character and must not exceed 12 characters in length.
