rule.name: Pattern Constraint

derivedDataType.name: AddressIPv4andPrefixLengthStr
derivedDataType.description:
IPv4 address string, controlled by a regular expression. The address is specified in dotted-quad decimal notation in accordance with RFC791, without leading zeros.
The IPv4 address is within the range [0-126,128-223].[0-255].[0-255].[0-255], 7-15 characters. The prefix length is a number from 0 to 31.

class.name: TransportM
class.description: Represents the root MOC for AXE Infrastructure Transport function MOM. It is automatically created in case APG cableless configuration with SMX or SCX shelf architecture. It allows the configuration of infrastructure L2 and L3 network connectivity. The L2 configuration includes: • Port configuration • VLAN configuration • Link aggregation configuration (LAGs) The L3 configuration can be further divided in 2 subparts: • basic settings: Routers, IPv4 interfaces, Static Routes. • advanced settings:Bidirectional Forwarding Detection (BFD), Virtual Router Redundnacy Protocol (VRRP), Access Control List (ACL).

attribute.name: transportMId
attribute.description: Holds the name used when identifying the MO.

class.name: Bridge
class.description: Represents an ethernet L2 forwarding technique. A network bridge connects multiple network segments at the data link layer (Layer 2) of the OSI model. In Ethernet networks, the term bridge formally means a device that behaves according to the IEEE 802.1D standards. Bridging takes place at OSI Model Layer 2 (data-link layer), that it (including MAC Bridge, Provider Bridge) directs frames according to hardware assigned MAC addresses.

attribute.name: bridgeId
attribute.description: Holds the name used when identifying the MO.

attribute.name: bridgeAddress
attribute.description: Specifies the MAC address of the Bridge.

attribute.name: numberOfPorts
attribute.description: Specifies the number of ports attached to the bridge.

attribute.name: numberOfVlans
attribute.description: Specifies the current number of VLANs defined on the bridge.

attribute.name: ipv4SubnetVlan
attribute.description: Represents an IPv4 subnet based VLAN. For an inbound untagged frame, if it has an IPv4 header and its source IPv4 address belongs to the IPv4 subnet of this entry, the VlanId of this entry must be used.

attribute.name: userLabel
attribute.description: Specifies a label for free usage.

class.name: BridgePort
class.description: Represents a port attaching to a bridge. One or more attributes setting can fail due to one of the following reasons: - Infrastructure Communication Failure: Communication with infrastructure HW failed and requested configuration could not be applied.

attribute.name: bridgePortId
attribute.description: Holds the name used when identifying the MO.

attribute.name: operState
attribute.description: Specifies the current operative state of the port.

attribute.name: defaultVlanId
attribute.description: Specifies the default VLAN ID for the inbound untagged frames.

attribute.name: portAddress
attribute.description: Specifies the physical address of the port attached to the bridge.

attribute.name: userLabel
attribute.description: Specifies a label for free usage.

attribute.name: adminState
attribute.description: Specifies the intended state of the port.

class.name: Vlan
class.description: Represents a VLAN entity. One or more attributes setting can fail due to one of the following reasons: - Infrastructure Communication Failure: Communication with infrastructure HW failed and requested configuration could not be applied. - System-protected object cannot be modified or deleted: The MO is system-protected and cannot be modified or deleted. - Cannot remove an object referenced by other object(s): The MO cannot be deleted since it is referenced by other MO(s), whose DN(s) are listed in reservedBy attribute. - Specified VLAN ID is already used: Another VLAN with the same VLAN ID already exists on the same Bridge. - Cannot modify VLAN ID: A previously assigned VLAN ID cannot be changed. - Cannot delete a VLAN used by a Subnet VLAN: Selected VLAN cannot be removed since it is used by a Subnet VLAN. - Invalid tagged BridgePort specified: One or more of tagged BridgePort(s) specified are not valid for this VLAN. - Invalid untagged BridgePort specified: One or more of untagged BridgePort(s) specified are not valid for this VLAN. - Specified BridgePort is member of an Aggregator: One or more of tagged/untagged BridgePort spcified are member of an Aggregator and cannot be individually set as member of a VLAN. - Same BridgePort cannot be set as both tagged and untagged member of a VLAN: One or more BridgePort are configured as both tagged and untagged in the same VLAN.

attribute.name: vlanId
attribute.description: Holds the name used when identifying the MO. Specifies the name of the VLAN.

attribute.name: taggedBridgePorts
attribute.description: Specifies the set of tagged member BridgePorts for this VLAN. Frames belonging to this VLAN will be VLAN-tagged upon transmission through tagged BridgePort members.

attribute.name: untaggedBridgePorts
attribute.description: Specifies the set of un-tagged BridgePort members for this VLAN. Frames belonging to this VLAN will be un-tagged when transmitted through an un-tagged member BridgePort.

attribute.name: vid
attribute.description: Specifies The VLAN identifier. If this attribute has no value, it will be ignored. If it has a non-empty value, this value must be unique. For a Vlan being a child of a Bridge MO, uniqueness means that no other Vlan under the same Bridge can have the same ID.

attribute.name: userLabel
attribute.description: Specifies a label for free usage.

attribute.name: reservedBy
attribute.description: Contains a list of MO instances that reserve this MO instance.

class.name: EthernetPort
class.description: Represents a physical entity that provides Ethernet-like MAC service access point. One or more attributes setting can fail due to one of the following reasons: - auto-negotiation configuration not allowed on this Ethernet port : the Ethernet port does not support auto-negotiation or it doesn't allow to ENABLE/DISABLE it.

attribute.name: ethernetPortId
attribute.description: Holds the name used when identifying the MO.

attribute.name: macAddress
attribute.description: Specifies the assigned MAC address.

attribute.name: maxFrameSize
attribute.description: Specifies the maximum size in byte that the layer can pass onwards. The recommended value range is from 64 to 9600.

attribute.name: operOperatingMode
attribute.description: Specifies the operational speed, duplex and master/slave state of the Ethernet port.

attribute.name: userLabel
attribute.description: Specifies a label for free usage.

attribute.name: autoNegotiateAdminState
attribute.description: Specifies the intended state of the auto-negotiation on the Ethernet port. If supported by the Ethernet port, the auto-negotiation allows to negotiate with a connected device the mode of operation: speed rate, duplex mode (half duplex or full duplex), and flow control. The transmission parameters that can be negotiated vary depending on the capabilities of the Ethernet port.

attribute.name: autoNegotiateOperState
attribute.description: Specifies the current operative state of the auto-negotiation on the Ethernet port.

class.name: Aggregator
class.description: Represents a LAG.

attribute.name: aggregatorId
attribute.description: Holds the name used when identifying the MO.

attribute.name: adminAggMember
attribute.description: Specifies the link aggregation member or the candidate group of the aggregator. If static mode, this attribute represent link aggregation member that references to ethernet port. Nil value in this mode means no port member in this aggregator. If dynamic mode, for candidate approach, this attribute represents the candidate group of the aggregator, it references to ethernet port. Nil value in this mode means no candidate port for this dynamic aggregator.

attribute.name: dataRate
attribute.description: Specifies the current data rate of the link aggregation in M-bits per second. The value is calculated as N times the data rate of a single link in the aggregation, where N is the number of active links.

attribute.name: operState
attribute.description: Represents the operative state of the aggregator. It is ENABLED if at least one ethernet port in the group is operative.

attribute.name: operAggMember
attribute.description: Specifies the ethernet port that are actually being a member of the aggregator. Empty value in this attribute means no actual port is added in this aggregator.

attribute.name: userLabel
attribute.description: Specifies a label for free usage.

class.name: Router
class.description: Represents an IP routing domain instance. It provides data plane isolation of routed traffic and control plane isolation of routing entities from other routing instances. It allows for further fragmentation of the routing domain. One or more attributes setting can fail due to one of the following reasons: - Infrastructure Communication Failure: Communication with infrastructure HW failed and requested configuration could not be applied. - System-protected object cannot be modified or deleted: The MO is system-protected and cannot be modified or deleted.

attribute.name: routerId
attribute.description: Holds the name used when identifying the MO.

attribute.name: userLabel
attribute.description: Specifies a label for free usage.

class.name: BfdSessionIPv4
class.description: Represents an IPv4 BFD Session Information.

attribute.name: bfdSessionIPv4Id
attribute.description: Holds the name used when identifying the MO.

attribute.name: detectionTime
attribute.description: Specifies the detection time of the local endpoint. It is the period of time lapsed without receiving BFD packets, after which the local endpoint will declare the session down. RFC 5880 specifies that the Detection Time calculated in the local endpoint is equal to the value of the detection multiplier received from the remote endpoint, multiplied by the agreed transmit interval of the remote system. If the remote endpoint has a shorter detection time value, this will be the effective detection time for the session.

attribute.name: intervalTxNegotiated
attribute.description: Specifies the negotiated interval at which the local node transmits BFD control packets.

attribute.name: localDiscriminator
attribute.description: Specifies the local discriminator for this BFD session used for unique identification.

attribute.name: addrDst
attribute.description: Specifies the remote IP address of the BFD session.

attribute.name: portSrc
attribute.description: Specifes the source UDP port for BFD session control packets. RFC5881 specifies the value to be within the range of 49152 through 65535.

attribute.name: sessionState
attribute.description: The state of this BFD session.

attribute.name: remoteDiscriminator
attribute.description: Specifies the remote discriminator defined by the remote endpoint for this BFD session.

attribute.name: diagCode
attribute.description: Specifies the reason for the latest transition of sessionState from UP to another state.

attribute.name: addrSrc
attribute.description: Specifies the local IP address of the BFD session.

class.name: BfdProfile
class.description: Represents a BFD Session Profile. One or more attributes setting can fail due to one of the following reasons: - Infrastructure Communication Failure: Communication with infrastructure HW failed and requested configuration could not be applied. - Cannot remove an object referenced by other object(s): The MO cannot be deleted since it is referenced by other MO(s), whose DN(s) are listed in reservedBy attribute.

attribute.name: bfdProfileId
attribute.description: Holds the name used when identifying the MO.

attribute.name: detectionMultiplier
attribute.description: Specifies the desired detection time multiplier. The negotiated control packet transmission interval, multiplied by the multiplier, defines the detection time for this session, as seen by the remote system.

attribute.name: intervalTxMinDesired
attribute.description: Specifies the desired minimum transmission interval. It is the preferred minimum interval that the local system uses when transmitting BFD control packets.

attribute.name: intervalRxMinRequired
attribute.description: Specifies the minimum required reception interval. It is the minimum interval between received BFD control packets that the local system is capable of supporting.

attribute.name: reservedBy
attribute.description: Contains a list of MO instances that reserve this MO instance.

class.name: AddressIPv4
class.description: Represents an assigned IPv4 address including information about the subnet it resides on. One or more attributes setting can fail due to one of the following reasons: - Infrastructure Communication Failure: Communication with infrastructure HW failed and requested configuration could not be applied. - System-protected object cannot be modified or deleted: The MO is system-protected and cannot be modified or deleted. - Invalid IPv4 address: Specified value for address attribute is not a valid IPv4 address. - Specified address conflicts with another address on the same Router: The subnet specified in address attribute includes or is included in another subnet configured on a different interface of the same Router.

attribute.name: address
attribute.description: Specifies the IPv4 decimal address + "/" + prefix length <0-31>.

attribute.name: addressIPv4Id
attribute.description: Holds the name used when identifying the MO.

attribute.name: userLabel
attribute.description: Specifies a label for free usage.

class.name: InterfaceIPv4
class.description: Represents an IPv4-addressed termination point. It is an interface on an IPv4 routing domain. One or more attributes setting can fail due to one of the following reasons: - Infrastructure Communication Failure: Communication with infrastructure HW failed and requested configuration could not be applied. - System-protected object cannot be modified or deleted: The MO is system-protected and cannot be modified or deleted. - Cannot define multiple loopback interfaces on same Router: A loopback interface already exists for this Router. - One of the attributes encapsulation and loopback must be set, but not both at the same time: Both encapsulation and loopback attributes are set or both are empty. - Invalid encapsulation specified: Specified encapsulation does not match any existing VLAN on the High Speed (HS) switch connected to the Router this interface belongs to. - Specified encapsulation VLAN does not have a valid VLAN ID: The VLAN selected as encapsulation does not have a VLAN ID configured. - Specified encapsulation VLAN is already used: Another Router's interface with the same encapsulation VLAN already exists.

attribute.name: interfaceIPv4Id
attribute.description: Holds the name used when identifying the MO.

attribute.name: adminState
attribute.description: Specifies the administrative state of L3 interface. When LOCKED, the connection to the L3 stack is disabled and no L3 packets are received or transmitted or routed through.

attribute.name: bfdProfile
attribute.description: Specifies a reference to the BFD profile used for BFD sessions from this IP interface.
attribute.dependencies: When bfdStaticRoutes is ENABLED, bfdProfile must refer to a valid BfdProfile MO.

attribute.name: encapsulation
attribute.description: Specifies the reference to the underlying VLAN encapsulation.

attribute.name: operationalState
attribute.description: Specifies the operational state of the IPv4 interface.

attribute.name: aclIngress
attribute.description: Specifies a reference to an ACL MO applied in the ingress direction. If this attribute is empty, no ACL MO filtering will take place in the ingress direction.
attribute.dependencies: If this attribute is set, loopback cannot be set.The referenced AclIpv4 MO must have at least one AclEntryIpv4 as a child. Only AclIpv4 MOs within the same router are allowed in an ACL association.

attribute.name: mtu
attribute.description: Specifies the MTU for IPv4.

attribute.name: bfdStaticRoutes
attribute.description: Specifies the intended state of BFD monitoring of static routing nexthops on this interface. To enable BFD monitoring, bfdStaticRoutes must be ENABLED, and bfdProfile must be defined. When BFD monitoring is enabled, all static routing nexthops on subnets of this IP interface will be monitored, unless explicitly disabled on peer/nexthop.

attribute.name: loopback
attribute.description: Specifies if the interface is an IP Loopback Interface.
attribute.dependencies: One of the attributes encapsulation and loopback must be set, but not both at the same time. Loopback cannot be set, if an ACL association exists, that is if aclEgress or aclIngress are set.The attribute egressQosMarking cannot be configured on an IP Loopback interface.

attribute.name: userLabel
attribute.description: Specifies a label for free usage.

class.name: RouteTableIPv4Static
class.description: Represents an IPv4 static route table information.

attribute.name: routeTableIPv4StaticId
attribute.description: Holds the name used when identifying the MO.

class.name: Dst
class.description: Represents an IPv4 destination network Information. One or more attributes setting can fail due to one of the following reasons: - Infrastructure Communication Failure: Communication with infrastructure HW failed and requested configuration could not be applied. - Specified dst is already used: Another Dst with the same dst subnet already exists. - Invalid IPv4 subnet: Specified value for dst attribute is not a valid IPv4 subnet.

attribute.name: dstId
attribute.description: Holds the name used when identifying the MO.

attribute.name: dst
attribute.description: Specifies the IPv4 destination prefix for the route.

class.name: NextHop
class.description: Represents an IPv4 route Information. It contains next hop information on how to reach a destination network. One or more attributes setting can fail due to one of the following reasons: - Infrastructure Communication Failure: Communication with infrastructure HW failed and requested configuration could not be applied. - One of the attributes address and discard must be set, but not both at the same time: Both address and discard attributes are set or both are empty. - Specified address conflicts with own address: Specified address coincides with an address configured on an InterfaceIPv4 on this Router.

attribute.name: nextHopId
attribute.description: Holds the name used when identifying the MO.

attribute.name: adminDistance
attribute.description: Specifies the distance of next hop. It is used to select the best path when there are two or more routes to the same destination from two different routing protocols.

attribute.name: bfdMonitoring
attribute.description: Specifies whether the availability of this route depends on a BFD session that monitors the nexthop. By setting this attribute to true, the availability of this route depends on the session state if a BFD session monitors the nexthop. By setting this attribute to false the availability of this route does not depend on the session state, even when a BFD session monitors the nexthop.

attribute.name: address
attribute.description: Specifies the IP address of the nexthop gateway of this route. One of the attributes address and discard must be set, but only one of them.
attribute.dependencies: The address must not coincide with an address configured on an InterfaceIPv4 on this router.

attribute.name: discard
attribute.description: Specifies that packets with a destination that match this route are discarded. One of the attributes address and discard must be set, but only one of them at the same time.

class.name: Vrrpv3Session
class.description: Represents a VR session on one router. Normally these MOs exist in pairs, one for each InterfaceIpv4 MO with the same VLAN on each router in the node. An instance of the Vrrpv3Session MO can be created only if instances of the AddressIpV4 MO are created on both the referenced Vrrpv3Interface MO and the parent InterfaceIpv4 MO. Several Vrrpv3Session MOs that are children of the same InterfaceIpv4 are not allowed to reserve the same Vrrpv3Interface MO. One or more attributes setting can fail due to one of the following reasons: - Infrastructure Communication Failure: Communication with infrastructure HW failed and requested configuration could not be applied. - Prioritized VRRP session already defined: Another VRRP session referencing the same VRRP interface is already configured as prioritized session. - VRRP session in owner mode must be prioritized: Referenced VRRP address matches an address configured on an InterfaceIPv4 of this Router hence this VRRP session is in owner mode and prioritizedSession must be set to true.

attribute.name: vrrpv3SessionId
attribute.description: Holds the name used when identifying the MO.

attribute.name: administrativeState
attribute.description: Specifies the administrative state of the VRRP session. Protocol operations are disabled when it is LOCKED.

attribute.name: prioritizedSession
attribute.description: Specifies the default role for this VRRP router. The value true defines the master role, and the value false defines the backup role. One of the two Vrrpv3Session MOs referring to the same Vrrpv3Interface MO must be configured as true, and the other must be configured as false. When the IP addresses in the two AddressIpv4 MOs specified below under a) and b) are equal, the session is in owner mode when it is in the master role. In this case, the attribute proiritizedSession must be configured as true. a) AddressIpv4 MO that is a child of the InterfaceIpv4 MO, of which this MO is a child. b) AddressIpv4 MO that is a child of the Vrrpv3Interface that this MO references.

attribute.name: vrrpState
attribute.description: Specifies the state of the virtual router.

attribute.name: userLabel
attribute.description: Specifes a label for free usage.

attribute.name: vrrpv3InterfaceRef
attribute.description: Specifies the reference to the Vrrpv3Interface MO. Referenced MO contains common parameters for two Vrrpv3Sessions that are backup for each other. If prioritizedSession is set to false, the addresses of the two AddressIpv4 MOs specified below under a) and b) must not be equal: a) AddressIpv4 MO that is a child of the InterfaceIpv4 MO that this MO is a child of. b) AddressIpv4 MO that is a child of the Vrrpv3Interface that this MO is referencing.

attribute.name: priority
attribute.description: Specifies the master election priority. The value is 255 for a VRRP router in owner mode.

class.name: Vrrpv3Interface
class.description: Represents the unique VRRP router provided for a pair of VRRP sessions on two routers. It contains the attributes common for both VRRP sessions. One or more attributes setting can fail due to one of the following reasons: - Infrastructure Communication Failure: Communication with infrastructure HW failed and requested configuration could not be applied. - Cannot remove an object referenced by other object(s): The MO cannot be deleted since it is referenced by other MO(s), whose DN(s) are listed in reservedBy attribute. - Specified VR ID is already used: Another VRRP Interface with the same VR ID already exists.

attribute.name: vrrpv3InterfaceId
attribute.description: Holds the name used when identifying the MO.

attribute.name: vrIdentity
attribute.description: Specifies the VRRP router identifier. The vrIdentity must be unique among all Vrrpv3Interface MO instances.

attribute.name: advertiseInterval
attribute.description: Specifies the time between sending the VRRP advertisement messages. Real VRRP convergence time = advertiseInterval * (4-(priority/256)). Priority is defined in the Vrrp3Session MO that becomes the new master.

attribute.name: preemptMode
attribute.description: Specifies the preemptive mode. When true, a higher-priority VRRP router can preempt a lower-priority master VRRP router. By default, preemption is enabled with no hold time. Preemption is enabled for a VRRP router in owner mode.

attribute.name: preemptHoldTime
attribute.description: Specifies the master preemption hold time. It is the time for which a higher-priority VRRP backup router must wait before preempting a lower-priority VRRP master. Configure the preemption hold time when the higher-priority server must wait before trying to preempt the current master. The preemption hold time is zero for a VRRP router in owner mode.

attribute.name: reservedBy
attribute.description: Contains a list of MO instances that reserve this MO instance.

attribute.name: userLabel
attribute.description: Specifes a label for free usage.

class.name: AclIpv4
class.description: Represents an ACL. It contains an ordered list of ACL entries. See the attribute priority for details on ordering. One or more attributes setting can fail due to one of the following reasons: - Infrastructure Communication Failure: Communication with infrastructure HW failed and requested configuration could not be applied.

attribute.name: aclIpv4Id
attribute.description: Holds the name used when identifying the MO.

attribute.name: reservedBy
attribute.description: Contains a list of MO instances that reserve this MO instance.

attribute.name: userLabel
attribute.description: Specifies a label for free usage.

class.name: AclEntryIpv4
class.description: Represents an entry in an ACL. It contains a set of filters for the ACL entry as well as an action and a priority. All filters refer to fields in the IP protocol header. One or more attributes setting can fail due to one of the following reasons: - Infrastructure Communication Failure: Communication with infrastructure HW failed and requested configuration could not be applied.

attribute.name: aclEntryIpv4Id
attribute.description: Holds the name used when identifying the MO.

attribute.name: action
attribute.description: Specifies the action of the ACL entry. When a packet matches the filters in this entry, the action is executed.

attribute.name: addrDst
attribute.description: Specifies the destination IP Address filter. The value is a list of IPv4 subnets: Value/prefix-length. The ACL entry matches if any address in the list matches. If the value list is empty, any IP address matches this entry.

attribute.name: addrSrc
attribute.description: Specifies the source IP Address filter. The value is a list of IPv4 subnets: Value/prefix-length. The ACL entry matches if any address in the list matches. If the value list is empty, any IP address matches this entry.

attribute.name: dscp
attribute.description: Specifies the DSCP field filter. The value is a list of DSCP values: Ranges [dd..dd] or single-values [dd], where dd represents an integer in {0..63}. The ACL entry matches if any DSCP value in the list matches. If the value list is empty, any DSCP value will match this entry.

attribute.name: fragmentType
attribute.description: Specifies the fragment type filter. The value is a fragment type. If the value is empty, state-less handling of fragments is performed.

attribute.name: icmpType
attribute.description: Specifies the ICMP type filter. The ACL entry matches if any element in the list matches. If the value list is empty, any ICMP types match this entry. It can be non-empty only if ipProtocol contains one single-value element, equal to ICMP (1).

attribute.name: ipProtocol
attribute.description: Specifies the protocol number filter. The value is a list of ranges [ddd..ddd] or single-values [ddd], where ddd represents an integer in the range {0..255}. The ACL entry matches if any protocol number in the list matches. If the value list is empty, any protocol number matches this entry.

attribute.name: portDst
attribute.description: Specifies the transport layer destination port filter (UDP, TCP or SCTP only). The value is a list of port numbers: Ranges [ddddd..ddddd] or single values [ddddd], where ddddd represents an integer in the range {0..65535}. This attribute can be non-empty only if the protocol is non-empty and if it contains elements that are single values equal to UDP (17), TCP (6), or SCTP (132). The ACL entry matches if any port number in the list matches. If the value list is empty, any port number matches this entry.

attribute.name: portSrc
attribute.description: Specifies the transport layer source port filter (UDP, TCP or SCTP only). The value is a list of port numbers: Ranges [ddddd..ddddd] or single values [ddddd], where ddddd represents an integer in the range {0..65535}. This attribute can be non-empty only if the protocol is non-empty and if it contains elements that are single values equal to UDP (17), TCP (6), or SCTP (132) The ACL entry matches if any port number in the list matches. If the value list is empty, any port number matches this entry.

attribute.name: priority
attribute.description: Specifies the priority of this ACL entry relative to the other entries in the list. The attribute values of the AclEntryIpv4 instances must be unique within the same AclIpv4 MO.

attribute.name: userLabel
attribute.description: A label for free usage.

enum.name: LicenseMode
enum.description: Represents the possible license mode types.

enumMember.name: VIRGIN
enumMember.description: Indicates License Manager mode when the node is installed for the first time.

enumMember.name: LICENSECONTROLLED
enumMember.description: Indicates License Manager mode when a valid License Key file is installed.

enumMember.name: GRACE
enumMember.description: Indicates License Manager mode when an invalid or loss of License Key File is detected. This mode lasts 60 days. No alarm raised in the first 30 days. In this mode the application uses the last licensing information that was available.

enumMember.name: EMERGENCY
enumMember.description: Indicates License Manager mode when Emergency mode is activated. During this mode, capacity features which are intended for use during emergency situations are unlocked in order to provide as good accessibility as possible.

enumMember.name: MAINTENANCE
enumMember.description: Indicates License Manager mode when Maintenance mode is activated. During this mode, license controlled features are frozen to allow maintenance activities without affecting in service performances. An observation alarm is raised when Maintenance mode is unlocked and will be ceased in the following cases. - Maintenance mode is Locked manually - Automatically after 25 days of Unlock

class.name: LicenseM
class.description: Represents the root MOC for License Management function MOM. The main use cases of License Management function are : 1) Installation of LKF. 2) Viewing information of electronic keys present in the installed LKF. 3) License Management function modes administration.

action.name: emergencyUnlock
action.description:
Activates the Emergency Mode of License Management function.
The action may fail due to any one of the following reasons: -Command not executed, AP backup in progress: When backup or restore operation is going on. -Emergency State Mode already activated: When the Emergency Mode is already activated. -Emergency State Mode not allowed: When the two emergency state activation attempts are already used. -Unable to connect to server: When service encounters internal fault like inter service communication failure.

action.name: installLicenseKeyFile
action.description:
Installs the LKF taking it from folder /license_file on APG file system. After the installation the LKF is removed from APG file system.
The action may fail due to any one of the following reasons: -Command not executed, AP backup in progress: When backup or restore operation is going on. -Invalid license key file: When the specified LKF is invalid. -Invalid license key file path: When the specified path for LKF is wrong. -Missing License Key File: When the LKF file is missing on APG file system. -Physical file error: When the LKF is corrupted. -Unable to connect to server: When service encounters internal fault like inter service communication failure.

parameter.name: licensefile
parameter.description: Specifies the name of the LKF. The LKF is expected to be present in the folder /license_file on APG file system.

action.name: exportLicenseKeyFile
action.description:
Exports the installed LKF to destination folder "license_file" on APG file system with filename <fingerprint>_lkf. The file is overwritten if it already exists in the destination folder and automatically deleted by the system after thirty days.
The action may fail due to any one of the following reasons: -Internal error: LKF not found: An internal error when exporting LKF. -Not allowed in Grace Mode: LKF cannot be exported in Grace Mode. -Not allowed in Virgin Mode: LKF cannot be exported in Virgin Mode. -Quota limit exceeded: Unable to export LKF in the destination folder. -Unable to connect to server: When service encounters internal fault like inter service communication failure.

attribute.name: licenseMId
attribute.description: Holds the name used when identifying the MO.

attribute.name: emergencyActivationCount
attribute.description: Specifies the number of activations left for the emergency with the current LKF.

attribute.name: endDateforEmergencyMode
attribute.description: Specifies the end date until which the Emergency Mode is valid. If Emergency Mode is not set no value is displayed.

attribute.name: fingerprint
attribute.description:
Specifies the fingerprint of the AXE node in clear text. Fingerprint is in the format: <Node Name>-<Cluster IP Address>
"Node Name" is the value of attribute managedElementId in ManagedElement MOC.
"Cluster IP Address" is the IP address assigned to cluster of 2 AP nodes.
In case the OAM network is configured with both IPv4 and IPv6 connectivity, the IPv4 and IPv6 fingerprints are both valid but the attribute specifies only the valid IPv4 fingerprint value: <Node Name>-<Cluster IPv4 Address>

attribute.name: licenseMode
attribute.description: Specifies the current License Management function mode.

attribute.name: maintenanceMode
attribute.description: Allows to activate/deactivate the Maintenance Mode. Default state is not active.

attribute.name: endDateforMaintenanceMode
attribute.description: Specifies the end date until which the Maintenance Mode is valid. If Maintenance Mode is not set no value is displayed.

attribute.name: hashedFingerprint
attribute.description:
Specifies the fingerprint of the AXE node in encrypted format.
In case the OAM network is configured with both IPv4 and IPv6 connectivity, the IPv4 and IPv6 fingerprints are both valid but the attribute specifies only IPv4 fingerprint value in encrypted format.

class.name: ElectronicKey
class.description: Represents the set of Electronic Keys part of LKF.

attribute.name: electronicKeyId
attribute.description: Holds the name used when identifying the MO.

attribute.name: description
attribute.description: Specifies the description of electronic Key.

attribute.name: startDate
attribute.description: Specifies the start date of the electronic key.

attribute.name: expiryDate
attribute.description: Sepcifies the end date of the electronic key. In case of no end date for an electronic key then there no value is displayed.

attribute.name: licensedCapacityValue
attribute.description: Specifies the capacity value of the electronic key. If value is 1, it means the key is a feature electronic key. If the value is more than 1, it means the key is a capacity electronic key and the value represents the capacity value.

attribute.name: daysToExpire
attribute.description: Specifies the number of remaining days to expire the electronic key. If the value is a number, it means the electronic key is going to expire in these number of days. If the value is "EXPIRED", it means the electronic key is expired. If the value is "NEVER", it means the electronic key never expires.

derivedDataType.name: LockoutBadCountValue
derivedDataType.description: This attribute specifies the range for LockoutBadCount attribute.

derivedDataType.name: MinimumPasswordLengthValue
derivedDataType.description: This attribute specifies the range for MinimumPasswordLength attribute.

derivedDataType.name: PasswordHistorySizeValue
derivedDataType.description: This attribute specifies the range for PasswordHistorySize attribute.

derivedDataType.name: LockoutDurationValue
derivedDataType.description: This attribute specifies the range for LockoutDuration attribute.

derivedDataType.name: MaximumAccountAgeValue
derivedDataType.description: Specifies the valid range for attribute maximumAccountAge.

class.name: LocalTsUsersPolicyM
class.description:
Represents the configurable settings on AP for new created TS user management. These include password policies and account policies. All changes on the class apply only for new defined TS users.
One or more attributes setting can fail due to one of the following reasons: - Internal Error: Wrong/missing configuration file. - Error connecting to server : Internal Error.

attribute.name: localTsUsersPolicyMId
attribute.description: Holds the name used when identifying the MO.

attribute.name: lockoutDuration
attribute.description: It defines the minimum duration after which locked accounts are automatically unlocked. The default value is 15 minutes.

attribute.name: lockoutBadCount
attribute.description: Specifies the maximum number of login attempts that are allowed before the user is locked out. The default value is 3.

attribute.name: minimumPasswordLength
attribute.description: Specifies the minimum number of characters to be used in a password. The default value is 8 characters.

attribute.name: passwordHistorySize
attribute.description: Specifies the maximum number of previous passwords remembered for a user. The default value is 24.

attribute.name: maximumAccountAge
attribute.description: Specifies the maximum number of days a user account is valid. The default value is 5 days.

interMim.description: This is a contribution from AxeLocalTSUsersPolicyM class to SecurityHandling.

relationship.name: SecurityHandling_to_LocalTsUsersPolicyM
relationship.description: This is a contribution from AxeLocalTSUsersPolicyM class to SecurityHandling.

enum.name: MMLAuthorizationMethodValue
enum.description: Lists the possible values for the MML authorization method.

enumMember.name: CPUSER
enumMember.description: The MML authorization method is based on CP user.

enumMember.name: COCA
enumMember.description: The MML authorization method is based on COCA groups.

class.name: MmlAuthorizationM
class.description:
Represents the root MOC for MML Authorization Management function MOM. The function allows managing the MML authority of an OaM user for opening an MML session and give MML commands.
One or more attributes setting can fail due to one of the following reasons:
- Not allowed in this system configuration : Modification of the attribute mmlAuthorizationMethod is not allowed in Multi-CP System.

attribute.name: mmlAuthorizationMId
attribute.description: Holds the name used when identifying the MO.

attribute.name: mmlAuthorizationMethod
attribute.description:
Specifies the MML authorization method.
In Single-CP System it can be based either on CP user or on COCA groups. In Multi-CP System, it is based only on COCA groups.

attribute.name: ignoreCpSuperUserRole
attribute.description: Specifies whether the MML authority associated to role CpRole0 is ignored or not.

attribute.name: ignoreCpUserRoles
attribute.description: Specifies whether the MML authority associated to roles CpRole1..CpRole15 is ignored or not.

attribute.name: ignoreApSystemAdminRole
attribute.description: Specifies if the SystemAdministrator role does not provide permission to operate in Expert Mode. If true, the permission to operate in Expert Mode is only assigned using clusterExpertPermission attribute value in MmlSystemRole and MmlRole MOCs. If false, the permission to operate in Expert Mode is assigned either using clusterExpertPermission attribute value or by SystemAdministrator role.

class.name: MmlRole
class.description:
Represents an association between a role and an MML authority profile.
One or more attributes setting can fail due to one of the following reasons:
- Wrong COCA-numbers value : In case of MML authorization method based on COCA groups and the specified COCA values are not integer in the ranges from 0..255. - Wrong number of characters in mmlProfile : This message appears when the MML authorization method is based on CP user and the size of attribute mmlProfile exceeds 16 characters. - Unreasonable value : This message appears either when the role name used as value for mmlRoleId attribute has been already used for any of MmlSystemRole MOs as value for mmlSystemRoleId attribute; or when one of the following role names is used as value for mmlRoleId attribute: CpRole0, SystemAdministrator, SystemSecurityAdministrator, SystemReadOnly, EricssonSupport.

attribute.name: mmlRoleId
attribute.description: Holds the name used when identifying the MO.

attribute.name: mmlProfile
attribute.description:
Specifies the MML authority profile.
This attribute value depends on system type (Single-CP System, Multi-CP System) and on MML authorization method hosted in the attribute "mmlAuthorizationMethod" in MOC "MmlAuthorizationM". If attribute "mmlAuthorizationMethod" is equal to CPUSER, in Single-CP System, the value of this attribute is a CP user identity, for ex. CPADM, created on CP via MML command IOUAL. If attribute "mmlAuthorizationMethod" is equal to COCA, the value of this attribute is a list of COCA groups in the range of 0..255, separated by a comma sign ','.To specify a range double dots can be used '..'. Example: 14,32..59,200..212, 25

attribute.name: clusterExpertPermission
attribute.description: Specifies the permission to operate in Expert Mode.

attribute.name: cptPermission
attribute.description: Specifies the permission to open CPT session.

class.name: MmlSystemRole
class.description: Represents an association between a AXE application defined role and an MML authority profile.

attribute.name: mmlSystemRoleId
attribute.description: Holds the name used when identifying the MO. It is an AXE Application defined role.

attribute.name: mmlProfile
attribute.description: Specifies the MML authority profile.

attribute.name: clusterExpertPermission
attribute.description: Specifies the permission to operate in Expert Mode.

attribute.name: cptPermission
attribute.description: Specifies the permission to open CPT session.

class.name: NbiFoldersM
class.description:
Represents the main folders exposed on APG file system. Each attribute value specifies the path of such folders.
Once a File Transfer session is opened the APG file system is shown under '/' root path and a user can access to it depending on his authority level.

attribute.name: nbiFoldersMId
attribute.description: Holds the name used when identifying the MO.

attribute.name: cpPrintout
attribute.description: Specifies the folder path storing CP printouts routed in a file. The value is "/cp/printouts".

attribute.name: cpFiles
attribute.description: Specifies the folder path hosting files imported/exported to/from CP file system. The value is "/cp/files".

attribute.name: mmlCommandsFile
attribute.description: Specifies the folder path where downloading MML commands file. The file is to be run via mml AP command in format 3. The value is "/cp/mml".

attribute.name: auditLog
attribute.description: Specifies the folder path hosting ALOG related files. The value is "/audit_logs".

attribute.name: scrFiles
attribute.description: Specifies the folder path where downloading the SCR file. The value is "/sts_scr".

attribute.name: backupRestore
attribute.description: Specifies the folder path hosting APG backup files. The value is "/backup_restore".

attribute.name: dataTransferForResponding
attribute.description: Specifies the folder path storing files a remote destination configured in responding mode can access. The value is "/data_transfer/destinations".

attribute.name: mirroring
attribute.description: Specifies the folder path storing mirrored data during a block based transfer. The value is "/data_transfer/data_mirrored".

attribute.name: swPackageFW
attribute.description: Specifies the folder path where downloading the IPMI, RFU, and PFM FW packages. The value is "/sw_package/FW".

attribute.name: healthCheck
attribute.description: Specifies the folder path storing the result for health check reports. The value is "/health_check".

attribute.name: licenseFile
attribute.description: Specifies the folder path where storing the LKF. The value is "/license_file".

attribute.name: supportData
attribute.description: Specifies the folder path storing the info needed to write a CSR. It contains the output of AP command mktr. The value is "/support_data".

attribute.name: sourceDataForCpFile
attribute.description: Specifies the folder path storing CP related files. They are ready to transferred out to a remote destination. The value is "/data_transfer/source/cp_file".

attribute.name: sourceDataForStsFile
attribute.description: Specifies the folder path storing statistical counter related files. They are ready to be transferred out to a remote destination. The value is "/data_transfer/source/sts".

attribute.name: swPackageAPG
attribute.description: Specifies the folder path where downloading the APG related SW. The value is "/sw_package/APG". The UP SW is to be stored under folder "/sw_package/APG/UPGRADE". Other APG related SW is to be stored under folder "/sw_package/APG".

attribute.name: swPackageCP
attribute.description: Specifies the folder path where downloading CP related SW package. The value is "/sw_package/CP".

attribute.name: media
attribute.description: Specifies the folder path exposing the file system of a mounted external media. The value is "/media".

attribute.name: tools
attribute.description: Specifies the folder path where storing the output of additional tools. These tools are installed for maintenance or supervision purposes. The value is "/tools".

attribute.name: swPackage
attribute.description: Specifies the folder path where downloading the SW for APG and other different blades. A sub-folder for each of them is predefined on APG file system. The value is "/sw_package".

attribute.name: sourceCallRecords
attribute.description: Specifies the folder path storing CP data records. They are ready to transferred out to a remote destination. The value is "/data_transfer/source/data_records".

attribute.name: swPackageCCF
attribute.description: Specifies the folder path where downloading the CCF used in a Multi-CP System configuration. The value is "/sw_package/CP/CCF".

attribute.name: certificates
attribute.description: Specifies the folder path where downloading APG certificates. The value is "/certificates".

attribute.name: swPackageZip
attribute.description: Specifies the folder where downloading zipped package files. The value is "/sw_package/zip".

struct.name: ScrInfo
struct.description: Stores the CFG Information.

structMember.name: cdlVersion
structMember.description: Version of the counter rules grammer.

structMember.name: configuration
structMember.description: Configuration name.

structMember.name: configurationId
structMember.description: Product Number and Revision information.

structMember.name: slogan
structMember.description: Brief description of the configuration.

enum.name: OutputFormat
enum.description: Specifies the format type for the output file.

enumMember.name: ASN1
enumMember.description: ASN.1 format.

enumMember.name: LF
enumMember.description: LF format.

enum.name: Format
enum.description: This derived data type is used for the attribute 'format'.

enumMember.name: NOFORMAT
enumMember.description: The enum value '0' is refers to without format.

enumMember.name: SYBASE
enumMember.description: The enum value '1' is refers to Sybase database format.

enumMember.name: ORACLE
enumMember.description: The enum value '2' is refers to Oracle database format.

enumMember.name: CUSTOMDB
enumMember.description: The enum value '3' is refers to custom database format.

enum.name: OutputMode
enum.description: Specifies the level counters are aggregated.

enumMember.name: CPLEVEL
enumMember.description: CP level.

enumMember.name: CLUSTER
enumMember.description: CP Cluster level.

enum.name: Status
enum.description: This enum is used for the attribute 'status'

enumMember.name: NORMAL
enumMember.description: This enum value '0' is used to represent JobStatus as 'normal'.

enumMember.name: CANCELLED
enumMember.description: This enum value '1' is used to represent JobStatus as 'cancelled'.

enumMember.name: TERMINATED
enumMember.description: This enum value '1' is used to represent JobStatus as 'terminated'.

enum.name: AreaType
enum.description: Specifies the type of CP area.

enumMember.name: CURRENT
enumMember.description: An SCR file is downloaded from the CURRENT area of the LASCS block to STS file group location.

enumMember.name: PENDING
enumMember.description: An SCR file is downloaded from the PENDING area of the LASCS block to STS file group location.

enum.name: ApplicationLine
enum.description: This derived data type is used for the attribute 'applicationLine'.

enumMember.name: ALL
enumMember.description: This enum value '0' is used to represent apllicationLine as 'ALL'.

enumMember.name: GSM
enumMember.description: This enum value '1' is used to represent apllicationLine as 'GSM'.

enumMember.name: UMTS
enumMember.description: This enum value '2' is used to represent apllicationLine as 'UMTS'.

enumMember.name: WIRELINE
enumMember.description: This enum value '3' is used to represent apllicationLine as 'Wireline'.

enumMember.name: CMS88
enumMember.description: This enum value '4' is used to represent apllicationLine as 'CMS88'.

enum.name: BRP
enum.description: Specifies the possible values for a BRP time.

enumMember.description: 5 minutes
15 minutes.

enum.name: CounterType
enum.description: Specifies the possible counters types.

enumMember.name: PC
enumMember.description: Peg Counter.

enumMember.name: ST
enumMember.description: Status Counter.

enumMember.name: RE
enumMember.description: Recovery Counter.

enumMember.name: FL
enumMember.description: Flag Counter.

enumMember.name: ID
enumMember.description: Identifier Counter.

enum.name: PegCounterValue
enum.description: Specifies the way to handle the value for the Peg Counters.

enumMember.name: DELTA
enumMember.description: Value for a Peg Counter as DELTA.

enumMember.name: ABSOLUTE
enumMember.description: Value for a Peg Counter as ABSOLUTE.

derivedDataType.name: DatabaseFileCacheSize
derivedDataType.description: This data type is used for the attribute 'databaseFileCacheSize'.

derivedDataType.name: ThresholdLevel
derivedDataType.description: This derived data type is used for the attribute 'thresholdLevel'.

derivedDataType.name: TTCollectionFrequency
derivedDataType.description: This derived data type is used for the attribute 'ttCollectionFrequency'.

derivedDataType.name: Period
derivedDataType.description: This derived data type is used for the attribute 'period'.

derivedDataType.name: Repeats
derivedDataType.description: Specifies the number of times to repeat an MP.

derivedDataType.name: MPDateTime
derivedDataType.description: This Derived datatype is used to represent the attribute beginTime/endTime.

derivedDataType.name: MeasurementProgramIdType
derivedDataType.description: Specifies the pattern the attribute measurementProgramId must follow.

derivedDataType.name: ReportIdType
derivedDataType.description: Specifies the pattern which the attribute reportId must follow.

derivedDataType.name: TransferQueueName
derivedDataType.description: This derived datatype is used for validating the transferqueue name.

class.name: StatisticalCounterM
class.description: Represents the root MOC for Statistical Counter Management function MOM. It collects and provides statistical data from the AXE switching system. STS provides the collection, storage and provisioning of statistical data from CP(s)/APG(s).

attribute.name: statisticalCounterMId
attribute.description: Holds the name used when identifying the MO.

attribute.name: uniqueIdentityOfNode
attribute.description: Specifies the identity of the node. This value is assigned to the "nEUserName" field in the measurement file and it is also appended to the name of the measurement file. Only the following characters are allowed: 'A'-'Z', 'a'-'z', '0'-'9', ' ', '(', ')', '+', ',', '-', '.', '=' and '\''. It is used for ASN.1 output only. Default value is undefined, an empty string.

attribute.name: useUtcTimeStamps
attribute.description: Specifies whether UTC or local time is used for the time stamps within the statistical data files. The statistical data files are generated by STS. It also specifies if the legacy or new name convention should be used. If the value is set to true then UTC timestamps are used else the local timestamps are used. The default value is true. Note: The value 'false' (which denotes the LOCAL time stamps) should never be used in an environment which uses any part of Ericsson OSS.

attribute.name: nmcForcesSuspectFlag
attribute.description: Specifies whether analysis on NMC Indicator has to take place. Set the value to true to make NMC on and set to false to make NMC off. The default value is false.

attribute.name: vendorName
attribute.description: Specifies the name of the vendor which provides the measurement file. It is assigned to the "vendor name" field in the ASN.1 measurement file and the default value is "Ericsson".

attribute.name: counterCollectionState
attribute.description: Specifies the state of counter collection. Set the value to true to initiate the counter collection or set to false to discard the counter collection. The default value is true.

class.name: TranslationTable
class.description: Represents the initiation of the collection of translation table DIDs from CP. Translation is an internal concept which: - Ensures that the objects under measurement have the same names that the user gave them when defining them in the CP. - Maps between the counters defined on the CP and the counters defined in the OT.

action.name: updateTranslationTable
action.description: Invokes updation of the translation table.

attribute.name: translationTableId
attribute.description: Holds the name used when identifying the MO.

attribute.name: lastUpdate
attribute.description: Specifies the latest updated Translation Table time.

class.name: Reports
class.description: Represents the report management.

attribute.name: reportsId
attribute.description: Holds the name used when identifying the MO.

class.name: MeasurementPrograms
class.description: Represents the MP management The actions for resume and suspend of all MPs are available in this class.

action.name: suspendAllMp
action.description:
Invokes the suspend operation on all the Measuring Programs.
The action can fail due to the following reason: - No running program(s) defined : All currently defined measuring programs are already suspended.

action.name: resumeAllMp
action.description:
Invokes the resume operation on all the Measuring Programs.
The action can fail due to the following reason: - No suspended program defined : None of the currently defined programs are suspended.

attribute.name: measurementProgramsId
attribute.description: Holds the name used when identifying the MO.

class.name: Report
class.description:
Represents a report. The report contains a list of one or more OTs that may be referenced in a MP.
One or more attributes setting can fail due to one of the following reasons: - Internal Program Fault: Internal Processing error. - At least one object type needed in a report : Attempting to remove the last Object Type in a report is not permitted. - Duplicate object type(s):< object_type > : Duplicate object types. - Failed to modify report for object types: < object_type1 object_type2 ... > : This error may be returned for two types of modification. The first type of modification is where an Object Type is specified for addition and is already defined in the report. The second type is where an Object Type is specified for removal and is not defined in the report. - Invalid object type(s): < object_type1 object_type2 ... > : Attempting to create a report with invalid Object Type(s) or attempting to add invalid Object Type(s) to an already existing report. - The report name cannot contain character space and the following characters: |\\/&^*<>\":? : The listed characters are not allowed in the report name. - The report name cannot contain more than 256 characters : The report name is limited to 256 characters while creating or modifying a report. - Report in use : The deletion or modification of the specified report is not permitted as it is currently being used by a Measuring Program. - Too many reports defined : The maximum number of reports has already been reached.

attribute.name: reportId
attribute.description: Holds the name used when identifying the MO. It is in the format "reportId=XXXX", where XXXX is the report Id and must be in the range of 2000-2999.

attribute.name: name
attribute.description: Specifies the report name. Note: When naming a report the following characters are not allowed: |\\/&^*<>\":?

attribute.name: objectTypeList
attribute.description:
Specifies the OTs which are to be used in report. The input value should be DN of the corresponding ObjectType MOs.
In case of single OT: - Directly assign the value to the attribute.
In case of multiple OTs: - Report with multi-valued DNs should be separated by comma.

attribute.name: objectTypeDn
attribute.description: Specifies the DN for the OTs present in a report.

class.name: MeasurementProgram
class.description:
Represents a MP. An MP is a operator-defined periodic request to generate a file at regular intervals. An MP is identified by a unique identity.
One or more attributes setting can fail due to one of the following reasons: - An MP name may not contain the following characters | \ / & ^ * < > quot; : ? . The listed characters including character space are not allowed in the name of the MP. - Begin time earlier than current time : The Begin time specified is earlier than current time. - Begin time later than end time : The specified begin-time in the command is later than the end-time. - DBMS is not supported : No Database Format Definition File is available for the specified DBMS. - Destination not Valid: < target > : This message appears when the transfer queue name entered is not defined. - Incorrect interval value : The interval value specified in the command is incorrect. - Internal Program Fault: < detailed information > - Interval value can not be greater than MP running time : The interval value specified in the command is incorrect. The interval value can not be greater than the time between begin-time and end-time of the Measuring Program. - Invalid Output Format Value : An invalid output format is entered. Valid output format values are ASN.1 and LF. - Managed Object Element does not exist : The MP does not exist. - Period not valid : The specified accumulation period is not a multiple of 15 minutes or the accumulation period exceeds the time between the begin-time and end-time. - Program name already in use: < Name > : The specified name of the MP is already in use. - Repeat Value must be greater than zero : An invalid repeat value is entered. - Report not defined: < ReportID > : The report does not exist. - Time not valid : The specified time is not valid. This is either because an illegal time value is entered, or that daylight saving changes have affected the validity of the time. - Too many programs defined : The maximum number of Measuring programs has already been reached. - Unset mandatory attribute(s): < interval,reportId and transferQueue > - Wrong time format : The specified begin-time or end-time is not in the format [[[YYYY]MM]DD]hhmm.

action.name: suspendMP
action.description:
Invokes the suspend operation on the Measuring Programs.
The action can fail due to the following reason: - No running program(s) defined : The currently defined measuring program is already suspended.

action.name: resumeMP
action.description:
Invokes the resume operation on the Measuring Programs.
The action can fail due to the following reason: - No suspended program defined : None of the currently defined program is suspended.

attribute.name: reportDn
attribute.description: Specifies the DN of the instance of MOC Report linked in the MP.

attribute.name: measurementProgramId
attribute.description: Holds the name used when identifying the MO. It is in the format "measurementProgramId=XXXX", where XXXX is the identity of MP and must be in the range of 1000-1999.

attribute.name: utcFlag
attribute.description: Specifies if begin-time, end-time of data generation are in UTC. If the value is 0 the begin-time and the end-time are stated in local time. Default value is 0. Note: This option does not affect the time stamps of the output file(s).

attribute.name: beginTime
attribute.description: Specifies the value of begin time of the Measurement Program. The time must be specified as [[[YYYY]MM]DD]hhmm. The time is dependent of the BRPs of the Object Types included in the report specified in operand reportId. If all Object Types are defined with a BRP of 5 minutes, this value is empty or mm can be assigned 00, 05, 10, ..., or 55. In this case, if the value is empty, the current time is used. Minutes (mm) in the current time is rounded up to 00, 05, 10, ..., or 55. If any Object Type is configured with BRP of 15 minutes, the attribute beginTime is strongly recommended and mm must be assigned 00, 15, 30, or 45. In this case, if this value is empty, the user is likely to miss data due to nonalignment of the begin time to multiple of 15, that is assigned 00, 15, 30, or 45. Note: If the attribute utcFlag (in this class) is set to 0, the beginTime and the endTime of the MP are stated in Local Time. Statistics and Traffic measurement Subsystem (STS) uses Coordinated Universal Time (UTC) internally within STS. Therefore, if the beginTime and endTime are in Local Time, they will be converted to UTC when the command is executed. Hence, if any Daylight Saving Time (DST) adjustment happens before the beginTime or the endTime of the MP, the time adjustment must be considered.

attribute.name: endTime
attribute.description: Specifies the end-time of the MP. The end-time must be specified as [[[YYYY]MM]DD]hhmm. If it is not equal to a BRP then it is aligned to the last BRP before the end-time. The default value is empty. Note: If the attribute utcFlag (in this class) value is 0, the begin-time and the end-time of the MP are stated in Local Time. STS uses UTC internally within STS. Therefore, if the begin-time and end-time are in Local Time, they will be converted to UTC when the command is executed. Hence, if any DST adjustment happens before the begin-time or the end-time of the MP, the time adjustment must be considered. If the running time of the MP is to be limited, either this attribute or repeats (in this class) is used. If both this attribute and repeats are set to empty, the MP will run indefinitely.

attribute.name: repeats
attribute.description: Specifies the number of times the MP is run before terminating. If it is not set then no restriction is imposed.

attribute.name: interval
attribute.description:
Specifies the interval of generation of output files. This attribute is dependent of the BRPs of the OTs included in the MOC Report specified in the attribute reportId and the attribute period. Value of interval is specified in minutes.
Note 1: If at least one OT is configured with the BRP of 15 minutes and the attribute period value is set to 0, value of interval must be a multiple of 15 and in the range of <15 - 1440>. If the value of attribute period is set to other than 0, value of interval must be a multiple of period value and in the range of <period - 1440>.
Note 2: If only OTs with BRP of 5 minutes exist in the MOC Report and attribute period value is set to 0, the value of interval must be a multiple of 5 and in the range of <5 - 1440>. If the value of attribute period is set to other than 0, the value of interval must be a multiple of period and in the range of <period - 1440>.

attribute.name: outputFormat
attribute.description: Specifies the file output format. Use one of the following values: LF: Output files in format Load File will be generated. ASN.1: Output files in format Basic Encoding Rules (BER) encoded Abstract Syntax Notation 1 will be generated. The default value is ASN.1.

attribute.name: status
attribute.description: Specifies the status of Measurement Program. A Measurement Program can be in any of the below five states and there are rules controlling to which states an MP can transition to based on its current state. (1) waiting (2) running (3) suspended (4) faulty (5) expired

attribute.name: name
attribute.description: Specifies the name of the MP. If the value of this attribute is set to empty, a unique name is given to the MP automatically. The following characters including character space are not allowed in a name of an MP: |\\/&^*<>\":? Note: In case if this attribute is not set then the MP name can be viewed in the attribute 'defaultMpName' which is set by the service at runtime.

attribute.name: period
attribute.description: Specifies the time in which the counters are accumulated. If the value is 0, the output file(s) contains counter value of each BRP. The value is specified in minutes and should be a multiple of 15 and in the range of 0 - 1440. The default value is 0.

attribute.name: outPutMode
attribute.description: Specifies the option to generate Cluster level output along with CP level output. The value shall be set to CPLEVEL to generate the CP level output files or CLUSTER to generate the cluster level output files. The default value is CPLEVEL and CLUSTER is applicable only in case of Multi-CP Systems.

attribute.name: transferQueue
attribute.description: Specifies the TQ name using which the output files can be sent to a remote destination. The destination is defined via Data Transfer Management function.

attribute.name: reportId
attribute.description: Specifies the report to be used by the MP. It is expressed as the key value of the defined instance of MOC Report representing the report.

attribute.name: valueForPegCounter
attribute.description: Specifies the choice to select the absolute or delta values of Peg Counters. Set the value to ABSOLUTE for generating absolute values or set to DELTA for delta values.

attribute.name: eventFlag
attribute.description: Specifies the choice to generate an event data Load Files. Set the value to 1 to generate event files. The file contains all recorded events between two given times. The event data can be used for error checking, and for checking the causes of inconsistencies in counter data.

attribute.name: regularDataFlag
attribute.description: Specifies the choice to generate regular data files. These files describe the relationship between Object Types and counters. The contents of the files can only be affected by a function change of software STSCOUNTERS in the AP or by changing the counter rules dynamically in CP(s).

attribute.name: format
attribute.description: Specifies the Relational Database Management System (RDBMS) for which output is generated. A format file describes the structure of an output file of format Load File in a manner that can be loaded into a RDBMS. Use one of the following value of format: Sybase: The definition file Sybase.def is included in STS delivery. Oracle: The definition file Oracle.def is included in STS delivery. Custom database : The definition file must be supplied by the operator.

class.name: ObjectType
class.description:
Represents an Object Type (OT).
One or more attributes setting can fail due to one of the following reasons: - Internal Program Fault: Internal Processing error. - Invalid BRP : BRP values other than 5 or 15 minutes are invalid

attribute.name: objectTypeId
attribute.description: Holds the name used when identifying the MO.

attribute.name: isIncluded
attribute.description: Specifies whether the object type is included in collection or not. Set the value to true(activate) to include the OT for collection and set false (deactivate) to not to include the OT for collection.

attribute.name: brp
attribute.description: Specifies the Basic Recording Period (BRP) BRP denotes the frequency of counters collection for an object Type (OT). The value is restricted to either 5 or 15.

attribute.name: numberOfCounters
attribute.description: Spceifies the number of counters in the Object Type.

attribute.name: isAvailable
attribute.description: Specifies the availability status of the Object Type. The availability of an OT specifies that the data for this OT has been collected from CP and converted successfully.

attribute.name: category
attribute.description: Specifies the list of tags that are attached for this object type.

class.name: Counter
class.description: Represents the counter information. For each counter in an OT there is an instance of this class. All attributes in this class are read-only.

attribute.name: counterId
attribute.description: Holds the name used when identifying the MO. It specifies the name of the counter.

attribute.name: number
attribute.description: Specifies a unique number to identify the Counter.

attribute.name: type
attribute.description: Specifies the counter type.

attribute.name: description
attribute.description: Specifies the description of the counter.

class.name: ScrFileManager
class.description: Represents the SCR file management.

attribute.name: scrFileManagerId
attribute.description: Holds the name used when identifying the MO.

class.name: ScrFile
class.description: Represents the SCR file information. The action to upload the SCR file is available in this class.

action.name: importToCp
action.description:
Uploads an SCR file to CP side. This is applicable only in Single-CP System.
The action can fail due to one of the following reasons: - Insufficient memory in LASCS located at CP : Memory at LASCS block is not sufficient to upload an SCR file. - Can't connect to LASCS located at CP : Error occurred while connecting to LASCS block located at CP. - LASCS, located at CP, is busy : LASCS block is busy. - Protocol error between STS and LASCS located at CP : Protocol error occurred between Statistics and Traffic Measurement Subsystem (STS) and LASCS located at CP. - JTP error : Job Transfer Protocol (JTP) error occurred. - Internal Program Fault: Processing Error.

action.name: importToCpCluster
action.description:
Uploads an SCR file to CP side. This is applicable only in Multi-CP System.
The action can fail due to one of the following reasons: - Insufficient memory in LASCS located at CP : Memory at LASCS block is not sufficient to upload an SCR file. - Can't connect to LASCS located at CP : Error occurred while connecting to LASCS block located at CP. - The CP Name is not defined : The action was invoked with a CP name which is not defined. - LASCS, located at CP, is busy : LASCS block is busy. - Protocol error between STS and LASCS located at CP : Protocol error occurred between Statistics and Traffic Measurement Subsystem (STS) and LASCS located at CP. - JTP error : Job Transfer Protocol (JTP) error occurred. - Internal Program Fault: Processing Error.

parameter.name: cpName
parameter.description: This parameter represents the blade name to which the SCR file has to be uploaded.

attribute.name: scrFileId
attribute.description: Holds the name used when identifying the MO. It is the SCR file name.

attribute.name: fileName
attribute.description: Specifies the name of SCR file to be stored in folder /sts_scr of APG file system.

attribute.name: date
attribute.description: Specifies the date when the SCR file was created.

attribute.name: slogan
attribute.description: Specifies the short description about the SCR file.

attribute.name: info
attribute.description: Specifies the list of configurations available in the SCR file. It refers to a set of statistical counter rules.

class.name: ObjectTypes
class.description: Represents the ObjectType management.

attribute.name: objectTypesId
attribute.description: Holds the name used when identifying the MO.

class.name: InUse
class.description: Represents the information of the SCR files downloaded by CP. In case of Single-CP System there is only one SCR file. In case of Multi-CP System, STS downloads the SCR file from each blade and stores each of them.

attribute.name: inUseId
attribute.description: Holds the name used when identifying the MO.

class.name: ReadyToUse
class.description: Represents the set of SCR files located in the folder /sts_scr on APG file system. Any of these SCR files, represented as instances of MOC ScrFile, may be uploaded to the CP and once an uploaded SCR file is placed in the CP CURRENT area STS function starts using it. When an SCR file is downloaded from the CP it is automatically placed into folder /sts_scr as well.

action.name: exportFromCp
action.description:
Downloads to APG an SCR file stored in LASCS block located in the CP. The destination folder is /sts_scr on APG file system. This action is only applicable for a Single-CP System.
The action can fail due to one of the following reasons: - Invalid area : The action was invoked with invalid area argument. - No data to download : No data is found to download from the specified area. - The given file name is invalid : The provided file name must have suffix ".scr". - The file already exist : The file already exist. - A file already exists with the same name : Simillar file instance exists. - Can’t connect to LASCS located at CP : Error occurred while connecting to LASCS block located at CP. - JTP error : Job Transfer Protocol (JTP) error occurred. - LASCS, located at CP, is busy : LASCS block is busy. - Protocol error between STS and LASCS located at CP : Protocol error occurred between STS and LASCS located at CP.

parameter.name: areaType
parameter.description: Indicates the type of CP area where SCR file should be exported from. It can be either CURRENT or PENDING.

parameter.name: fileName
parameter.description: Indicates the name of the file where the SCR file is exported. It should be expressed as <fileName>.scr. After successful exporting the file is stored under folder /sts_scr in APG file system.

action.name: exportFromCpCluster
action.description:
Downloads to APG an SCR file stored in LASCS block from a specified CP blade. The destination folder is /sts_scr on APG file system. This action is only applicable for a Multi-CP System.
The action can fail due to one of the following reasons: - Invalid area : The action was initiated with invalid area argument. - No data to download : No data is found to download from the specified area. - The given file name is invalid : The provided file name must have suffix ".scr". - The file already exist : The file already exists. - A file already exists with the same name : Simillar file instance exists. - Not allowed in this system configuration : This is applicable only in Single-CP System. - Can’t connect to LASCS located at CP : Error occurred while connecting to LASCS block located at CP. - The CP Name is not defined : The action was invoked with a CP name which is not defined. - JTP error : Job Transfer Protocol (JTP) error occurred. - LASCS, located at CP, is busy : LASCS block is busy. - Protocol error between STS and LASCS located at CP : Protocol error occurred between Statistics and Traffic Measurement Subsystem (STS) and LASCS located at CP.

parameter.name: areaType
parameter.description: Indicates the type of CP area where SCR file should be exported from. It can be either CURRENT or PENDING.

parameter.name: fileName
parameter.description: Indicates the name of the file where the SCR file is exported. It should be expressed as <fileName>.scr. After successful exporting the file is stored under folder /sts_scr in APG file system.

parameter.name: cpName
parameter.description: Indicates the blade name from which the SCR file has to be dowloaded.

attribute.name: readyToUseId
attribute.description: Holds the name used when identifying the MO.

class.name: CapacityInfo
class.description: Represents the performance characteristics of STS. This information is given in terms of total number of counters being processed.

attribute.name: capacityInfoId
attribute.description: Holds the name used when identifying the MO.

attribute.name: totalNumberOfCounters
attribute.description: Specifies the number of counters processed in a BRP. It does not specify the number of counters of latest BRP, instead the maximum value in last 4 BRPs is displayed.

attribute.name: totalNumberOfDIDPositions
attribute.description: Specifies the total number of processed dids information.

struct.name: SCXNetworkConfigurationStruct
struct.description: Specifies network configuration of an SCX on public network. This allow it to reach external network time servers.

structMember.name: ipAddress
structMember.description: Identifies the IP address of SCX on public network.

structMember.name: netmask
structMember.description: Identifies the netmask of SCX on public network.

structMember.name: gateway
structMember.description: Identifies the gateway SCX uses to reach external network time server.

struct.name: SwitchNetworkConfigStruct
struct.description: Specifies network configuration of an switch on public network. This allow it to reach external network time servers.

structMember.name: ipAddress
structMember.description: Identifies the IP address of switch on public network.

structMember.name: netmask
structMember.description: Identifies the netmask of switch on public network.

structMember.name: gateway
structMember.description: Identifies the gateway switch uses to reach external network time server.

enum.name: ExternalReferenceType
enum.description: Lists external time reference types.

enumMember.name: NOT_CONFIGURED
enumMember.description: No external refrence type is configured (Default Value).

enumMember.name: NETWORK_REFERENCE
enumMember.description: AXE time reference uses network time servers as external time references.

enumMember.name: GPS_REFERENCE
enumMember.description: Axe time reference uses GPS devices as external time references.

enum.name: TimeReferenceStatus
enum.description: Check the status of the synchronization of the switch boards with the external reference(s).

enumMember.name: NOT_CONNECTED
enumMember.description: Switch is not connected to any external time reference.

enumMember.name: CONNECTED
enumMember.description: Switch is synchornized with an external time reference.

enumMember.name: RESYNCH
enumMember.description: Switch is resynchronizing with the external time reference.

enum.name: TimeServiceType
enum.description: List of results about changing of time service type.

enumMember.name: NOT_CONFIGURED
enumMember.description: No time service type is configured (Default Value).

enumMember.name: NTP
enumMember.description: Axe time reference uses NTP as type of UTC Reference Clock (URC) time service.

enumMember.name: NTPHP
enumMember.description: Axe Time Reference uses NTPHP as type of URC time service.

enum.name: ChangeAdmStateResultType
