enum.description: List of results about changing of administrative state.

enumMember.name: EXECUTED
enumMember.description: Indicates a successfully administrative state change.

enumMember.name: NOT_ALLOWED_BY_CP
enumMember.description: Indicates CP has rejected request to change of administrative state.

enumMember.name: REFERENCE_TYPE_NOT_CONFIGURED
enumMember.description: Indicates that reference type is not configured during administrative state change.

enumMember.name: SERVICE_TYPE_NOT_CONFIGURED
enumMember.description: Indicates that service type is not configured during administrative state change.

enumMember.name: NO_REFERENCE_EXIST
enumMember.description: Indicates that no time reference exist during administrative state change.

enumMember.name: INVALID_REFERENCE_TYPE
enumMember.description: Indicates that invalid reference type is configured during administrative state change.

enumMember.name: SNMP_FAILURE
enumMember.description: Indicates SNMP communication failure during administrative state change.

enumMember.name: INTERNAL_ERROR
enumMember.description: Indicates some internal error during administrative state change.

derivedDataType.name: TimeServerReferenceId
derivedDataType.description: External time server reference identifier.

class.name: TimeReferenceM
class.description:
Represents the root MOC for the Time Reference Configuration Management function. The function allows configuring the switch boards present into APZ magazine for connecting them to external time servers or the external GPS device in order to provide time of day or high precision synchronization.
NTP is used for communicating with the time servers, while NTPHP is used for communicating with the external GPS device. SNTP is used instead between the other switch boards present into an AXE node and the external time servers.

attribute.name: timeReferenceMId
attribute.description: Holds the name used when identifying the MO.

attribute.name: operationalState
attribute.description: Identifies the operative status of the time synchronization service.

attribute.name: administrativeState
attribute.description: Identifies the administrative state of the service.

attribute.name: changeAdmStateResult
attribute.description: Identifies the last result info about changing of administrative state.

class.name: NetworkTimeServer
class.description:
Represents the set of external time servers which are used to synchronize the time. Up to eight (8) external references can be defined at any time. The deletion of the last NetworkTimeServer instance is rejected when the attribute operationalState is set to ENABLED.
Attributes setting can fail due to one of the following reasons: -Incorrect IP address : This message appears when incorrect IP value is provided. -Cannot delete last NetworkTimeServer when operationalState is ENABLED. -Network Time Server IP address already exists : This message appears when already existing network server IP value is provided. -Operation not allowed in this system configuration: This message appears when network server IP is provided in wrong system configuration.

attribute.name: networkTimeServerId
attribute.description: Holds the name used when identifying the MO.

attribute.name: ipAddress
attribute.description: Identifies the IP address of network time server. It must be an IPv4 address in a dotted decimal form expressed as a.b.c.d.

class.name: ScxTimeReference
class.description:
Represents the entry point for external IP configuration functionality of SCX. There are two instances: one for the SCX board Side A (the SCX board in the slot 0) and one for the SCX board Side B (the SCX board in slot 25) on the shelf (where the AP board is placed) to make them available on the public network.
One or more attributes setting can fail due to one of the following reasons: -Incorrect IP address : This message appears when incorrect IP value is provided. -Incorrect netmask : This message appears when incorrect netmask value is provided. -Incorrect default gateway : This message appears when incorrect gateway value is provided. -Operation not allowed in this system configuration : This message appears when this class is configured in a SMX-based APZ magazine.
class.statusInformation: The MOC SwitchTimeReference should be used instead.

attribute.name: scxTimeReferenceId
attribute.description: Holds the name used when identifying the MO.

attribute.name: timeServiceStatus
attribute.description: Specifies the time synchronization status. It checks the status of time synchronization of the switch boards with the external reference(s).

attribute.name: timeReferenceId
attribute.description: Identifies the external time server the SCX is synchronized to.

attribute.name: networkConfiguration
attribute.description: Specify the network configuration of the additional IP address on the SCX.

class.name: ScxTimeService
class.description:
Is the entry point for the time service configuration. It is used to configure the type of external time reference and time service type. It contains two instances of ScxTimeReference, one for each SCX board present in the subrack where the AP board is placed. Time reference uses network time servers or GPS device as reference type. The type of time service can be either NTP or NTPHP.
One or more attributes setting can fail due to one of the following reasons: -Cannot modify serviceType when operationalState is ENABLED. -Cannot modify referenceType when operationalState is ENABLED. -Operation not allowed in this system configuration : This message appears when this class is configured in a SMX-based APZ magazine.
class.statusInformation: The MOC SwitchTimeService should be used instead.

attribute.name: scxTimeServiceId
attribute.description: Holds the name used when identifying the MO.

attribute.name: referenceType
attribute.description: Specifies the type of external time reference to synchronize with. It cannot be changed if the attribute operationalState in MOC TimeReferenceM is set to ENABLED, that is when the time synchronization is running.

attribute.name: serviceType
attribute.description: Specifies the type of time service. It cannot be changed if the attribute operationalState in MOC TimeReferenceM is set to ENABLED, that is when the time synchronization is running.

class.name: SwitchTimeReference
class.description:
Represents the entry point for external IP configuration of switches. There are two instances: one for the switch board Side A (the switch board in the slot 0) and one for the switch board Side B (the switch board in slot 25) on th shelf (where AP board is placed) to make them available on the public network. It is used to configure the external IP address of switch on the same network as the external time reference.
One or more attributes setting can fail due to one of the following reasons: -Incorrect IP address : This message appears when incorrect IP value is provided. -Incorrect netmask : This message appears when incorrect netmask value is provided. -Incorrect default gateway : This message appears when incorrect gateway value is provided.

attribute.name: switchTimeReferenceId
attribute.description: Holds the name used when identifying the MO.

attribute.name: timeServiceStatus
attribute.description: Specifies the time synchronization status. It checks the status of the synchronization of the switch boards with the external reference(s).

attribute.name: timeReferenceId
attribute.description: Identifies the external time server the switch is synchronized to.

attribute.name: networkConfiguration
attribute.description: Specify the network configuration of the additional IP address on the switch.

class.name: SwitchTimeService
class.description:
Is the entry point for the time service configuration. It is used to configure the type of external time reference and time service type. It contains two instances of SwitchTimeReference, one for each switch board present in the shelf where the AP board is placed. Time reference uses network time servers or GPS device as reference type. The type of time service can be either NTP or NTPHP.
One or more attributes setting can fail due to one of the following reasons: -Cannot modify serviceType when operationalState is ENABLED. -Cannot modify referenceType when operationalState is ENABLED.

attribute.name: switchTimeServiceId
attribute.description: Holds the name used when identifying the MO.

attribute.name: referenceType
attribute.description: Specifies the type of external time reference to synchronize with. It cannot be changed if the attribute operationalState in MOC TimeReferenceM is set to ENABLED, that is when the time synchronization is running.

attribute.name: serviceType
attribute.description: Identifies the type of service. It is not allowed to modify serviceType when operationalState is ENABLED.

struct.name: BladeSwMAsyncActionResult

structMember.name: result
structMember.description: Specifies the result state of completed import upgrade package action. This field has a value NOT_AVAILABLE if the action has been never used.

structMember.name: resultInfo
structMember.description: Specifes the description of the outcome/result of import upgrade package action. E.g., it can contain an error message if the action failed.

structMember.name: state
structMember.description: Specifes the current state of import upgrade package action.

structMember.name: timeActionCompleted
structMember.description: Specifies the date and time when the import upgrade package action was completed (successfully or unsuccessfully).

struct.name: ManagedSwPackageActionResult

structMember.name: result

structMember.name: timeActionCompleted
structMember.description: Specifies the date and time when the action was completed (successfully or unsuccessfully).

structMember.name: resultInfo

derivedDataType.name: PackageIdentity
derivedDataType.description: Cxp number.

derivedDataType.name: SlotNumber
derivedDataType.description: A slot number must be a value either in the range 0-25 or 26 or 28.

derivedDataType.name: ShelfAddress
derivedDataType.description: It is used to defined the shelf address for the magazine where the board is placed. The address is made up from the address plugs in the magazine. Expressed as a.b.c.d where a Address plug 0 Integer 0-15, 255. When address plug is not present this value is 255 for GESB board and 0 for all other boards. b Address plug 1 Integer 0-15, 255. When address plug is not present this value is 255 for GESB board and 0 for all other boards. c Address plug 2. Shall always be zero. Integer 0 d Address plug 3 Integer 0-15, 255. When address plug is not present this value is 255 for GESB board and 0 for all other boards.

derivedDataType.name: ShelfAndSlot
derivedDataType.description: A shelf address and a slot number separated by "_" character, e.g.: 1.2.0.4_25

class.name: BladeSwM
class.description: Represents the root MOC for Blade SW Management function MOM. It handles the SW packages used to upgrade AXE managed blades.

action.name: importUpgradePackage
action.description:
Allows to create a new ApManagedSwPackage or CpManagedSwPackage MO, depending on Functional Board Name (FBN) provided as input.
The action can be invoked when there is no other action in progress on this MO and returns immediately (i.e. it is an asynchronous action).
The action can fail due to one of the following reasons: - Configuration not supported: The specified FBN is not applicable to current system configuration. - Import Package action already running : Another import operation is already in progress. - Invalid file path or file name: The specified file name does not exists on the corresponding NBI folder. - Invalid file format: The specified file name extension is not valid (only .zip, .tar and .tar.gz extensions are accepted).
The progress of the action can be tracked via the attribute asyncActionProgress.
The upgrade package is expected to be stored in the exposed file system under the folder related to the FBN the package applies to. See the 'sw_packages' related attributes in the NorthBoundFolders MO for more information.
The upgrade package is removed only in case of succes. It's up to the remote MS to remove it in case of failure.

parameter.name: fbn
parameter.description: Functional Board Name (FBN) This parameter identifies the functional board name this upgrade package is applicable to.

parameter.name: fileName
parameter.description: Upgrade package file name to import.

attribute.name: bladeSwMId
attribute.description: Holds the name used when identifying the MO.

attribute.name: asyncActionProgress
attribute.description: Specifies the query progress of import upgrade package action

class.name: ApManagedSwPackage
class.description:
Represents the attributes and actions to describe and control the process of changing the software configuration of a board which upgrade is handled by APG.
The sequence in which a Software upgrade executes is:
1. Prepare 2. Activate 3. Commit

action.name: prepareUpgrade
action.description:
Allows to prepare the board for the activation of current upgrade package.
The action is monitored by a supervision timer. Executing prepare() does not have any negative impact on the in service performance of that board.
The action returns immediately after invocation. The progress of the action can be tracked via the specific progress report object. The action returns FALSE if the action could not start for any reason (e.g., another parallel action is in progress), otherwise returns TRUE.

parameter.name: shelf
parameter.description: The shelf address of a board to upgrade with this package (e.g. "1.2.0.4")

parameter.name: slot
parameter.description: The slot number of a board to upgrade with this package (e.g. "0")

parameter.name: upgradeType
parameter.description: Indicates the type of load module upgrade. It can be either a NORMAL upgrade or an INITIAL_INSTALLATION upgrade for intial installation of the board.

parameter.name: force
parameter.description: Indicates if the upgrade should be forced regardless the status of the other blade(s) in the same cluster. If the upgrade is forced, all checks regarding the status of the cluster, the blade belongs to, will be skipped and the upgrade will be started even if the other blade(s) in the cluster (if any) are not in a proper state (that means that functionalities provided from this type of blade may be temporary interrupted).

action.name: activate
action.description:
Allows to take current upgrade package into operation on the specified board.
This action can be invoked when the state is PREPARED. If the action is invoked in a state where it has no meaning or it could not start for any other reason, it returns FALSE, otherwise returns TRUE. The progress of the action can be tracked via the specific progress report object.
The action is monitored by a supervision timer. If activation fails for any reason then an automatic rollback occurs.

parameter.name: shelf
parameter.description: The shelf address of a board to upgrade with this package (e.g. "1.2.0.4")

parameter.name: slot
parameter.description: The slot number of a board to upgrade with this package ((e.g. "0")

action.name: cancel
action.description:
Allows to cancel an ongoing upgrade. The consequence is that the specific board stops the operation and revert back to the previous software version.
It's allowed when the upgrade is in PREPARED or ACTIVATED state and returns immediately after invocation. If the action is invoked in a state where it has no meaning or it could not start for any other reason, it returns FALSE, otherwise returns TRUE. The progress of the action can be tracked via the specific progress report object.

parameter.name: shelf
parameter.description: The shelf address of a board to upgrade with this package (e.g. "1.2.0.4")

parameter.name: slot
parameter.description: The slot number of a board to upgrade with this package (e.g. "0")

action.name: commitUpgrade
action.description: Allows to complete the upgrade procedure on the board. This operation must be invoked regardless of upgrade result. It's allowed when the upgrade status is ACTIVATED, CANCELLED and ROLLBACK_COMPLETED. The action returns true or false when it has completed (synchronous).

parameter.name: shelf
parameter.description: The shelf address of a board to upgrade with this package (e.g. "1.2.0.4")

parameter.name: slot
parameter.description: The slot number of a board to upgrade with this package (e.g. "0")

action.name: setAsDefault
action.description: Allows to configure this upgrade package as default package for this board type (specified by its functional board name).

action.name: prepare
action.description:
Allows to prepare the board for the activation of current upgrade package. This action is deprecated, prepareUpgrade should be used instead.
The action is monitored by a supervision timer. Executing prepare() does not have any negative impact on the in service performance of that board.
The action returns immediately after invocation. The progress of the action can be tracked via the specific progress report object. The action returns FALSE if the action could not start for any reason (e.g., another parallel action is in progress), otherwise returns TRUE.

parameter.name: shelf
parameter.description: The shelf address of a board to upgrade with this package (e.g. "1.2.0.4")

parameter.name: slot
parameter.description: The slot number of a board to upgrade with this package (e.g. "0")

attribute.name: apManagedSwPackageId
attribute.description: Holds the name used when identifying the MO. It is composed by product number and revision of the upgrade package, for example CXP012345_R1A01.

attribute.name: isDefaultPackage
attribute.description: Specifies whether this upgrade package is the default package for the specific board type. The default package is the one used as default when a new board of that type is defined in the system.

attribute.name: functionalBoardName
attribute.description: Specifies the functional board name which this package applies to.

attribute.name: productIdentity
attribute.description: Specifies the product number and revision of software within the upgrade package. e.g. CXC012345_R1A01

attribute.name: usedBy
attribute.description: Specifies the list of boards where this software package is running on.

attribute.name: asyncActionProgress
attribute.description: Specifies the current progress of actions.

attribute.name: packageStatus
attribute.description: Specifies the status of the Software Package. It is FAULTY in case Load Module is missing on the File System, otherwise it is VALID.

class.name: ReportProgress
class.description: Represents the progress of ongoing upgrade procedure. An instance is created for each board when the upgrade starts and is kept also after upgrade completion. This instance is deleted whenever a new upgrade procedure is started on the board it refers to.

attribute.name: reportProgressId
attribute.description: Holds the name used when identifying the MO. It is composed by shelf number and slot position of the board, for example 1.2.0.4_0.

attribute.name: resultInfo
attribute.description: Specifies the outcome/result of upgrade package procedure. E.g., it can contain an error message if the action failed.

attribute.name: result
attribute.description: Specifies the result state of upgrade package procedure.

attribute.name: state
attribute.description: Specifies the current state of upgrade package procedure.

attribute.name: timeUpgradeCompleted
attribute.description: Specifies the date and time when the upgrade package procedure was completed (successfully or unsuccessfully).

attribute.name: upgradeType
attribute.description: Specifies the type of load module upgrade. It can be either a NORMAL upgrade or an INITIAL upgrade for intial installation of the board.

attribute.name: forcedUpgrade
attribute.description: Specifies if the upgrade has been forced regardless the status of the other board in the same cluster.

class.name: CpManagedSwPackage
class.description: Represents the attributes and actions to support the process of changing the software configuration of a board which upgrade is handled by CP. APG contributes to this process.

action.name: prepare
action.description:
Allows to prepare a board in the specified shelf and slot for the activation of current upgrade package. This action is deprecated, prepareUpgrade should be used instead.
It returns true or false when it has completed (synchronous).

parameter.name: shelf
parameter.description: The shelf address of a board to upgrade with this package (e.g. "1.2.0.4")

parameter.name: slot
parameter.description: The slot number of a board to upgrade with this package (e.g. "0")

action.name: prepareShelf
action.description:
Allows to prepare all boards of this board type (specified by its functional board name) in the specified shelf for the activation of current upgrade package. This action is deprecated, prepareUpgrade should be used instead.
It returns true or false when it has completed (synchronous).

parameter.name: shelf
parameter.description: The shelf address of a board to upgrade with this package (e.g. "1.2.0.4")

action.name: prepareAll
action.description:
Allows to prepare all boards of this board type (specified by its functional board name) for the activation of current upgrade package. This action is deprecated, prepareUpgrade should be used instead.
It returns true or false when it has completed (synchronous).

action.name: setAsDefault
action.description: Allows to configure this upgrade package as default package for this board type (specified by its functional board name).

action.name: prepareUpgrade
action.description:
Allows to prepare a board in the specified shelf and slot for the activation of current upgrade package. It returns true or false when it has completed (synchronous).
The action can fail due to one of the following reasons: - Invalid parameter: Specified parameter combination is not valid.

parameter.name: shelf
parameter.description: The shelf address of a board to upgrade with this package (e.g. "1.2.0.4"). If not specified (or if value "ALL" is provided) the action applies to all boards of this board type (specified by its functional board name).

parameter.name: slot
parameter.description: The slot number of a board to upgrade with this package (e.g. "0"). It can be provided only in combination with parameter shelf. If not specified (or if value "ALL" is provided) the action applies to all boards of this board type (specified by its functional board name) in the specified shelf.

attribute.name: cpManagedSwPackageId
attribute.description: Holds the name used when identifying the MO. It is composed by product number and revision of the upgrade package, for example CXP012345_R1A01.

attribute.name: isDefaultPackage
attribute.description: Specifies whether this upgrade package is the default package for the specific board type. The default package is the one used as default when a new board of that type is defined in the system.

attribute.name: functionalBoardName
attribute.description: Specifies the functional board name which this package applies to.

attribute.name: productIdentity
attribute.description: Specifies the product number and revision of software within the upgrade package. e.g. CXC012345_R1A01

attribute.name: usedBy
attribute.description: Specifies the list of boards where this software package is running on.

attribute.name: asyncActionProgress
attribute.description: Specifies the current progress of actions.

attribute.name: packageStatus
attribute.description: Specifies the status of the Software Package. It is FAULTY in case Load Module is missing on the File System, otherwise it is VALID.

struct.name: BrmAsyncActionProgress
struct.description: This records the progress of an asyncronous action.

structMember.name: actionName
structMember.description: The name of the invoked asynchronous action.

structMember.name: additionalInfo
structMember.description: Used for logging significant messages during execution of an action.

structMember.name: progressInfo
structMember.description: Textual information describing the actual state of the execution of the action.

structMember.name: progressPercentage
structMember.description: Progress of the action. The range is between 0 and 100.

structMember.name: result
structMember.description: Result state of completed action. This field has the value NOT_AVAILABLE if the action is not finished.

structMember.name: resultInfo
structMember.description: Textual description of the outcome/result of the action containing useful info for the NMS. It can contain an error message if the action failed.

structMember.name: state
structMember.description: Current state of the action.

structMember.name: actionId
structMember.description: Uniquely identifies the invocation of an action.

structMember.name: timeActionStarted
structMember.description: The date and time when the current action was started.

structMember.name: timeActionCompleted
structMember.description: The date and time when the action was completed (successfully or unsuccessfully).

structMember.name: timeOfLastStatusUpdate
structMember.description: The date and time when the struct member state was last updated.

enum.name: BrmBackupStatus
enum.description: Indicates the status of a Backup. The status will be INCOMPLETE during creation or deletion of a backup. Once a backup is successfully created, its status is COMPLETE. If the integrity of the backup is violated, then it is marked as CORRUPTED.

enumMember.name: BRM_BACKUP_COMPLETE
enumMember.description: The backup is complete and can be safely restored.

enumMember.name: BRM_BACKUP_INCOMPLETE
enumMember.description: The backup is incomplete. The reason could be failure during creation or deletion. An incomplete backup is never allowed to be restored. The only permissible operation on the incomplete backup is to delete it.

enumMember.name: BRM_BACKUP_CORRUPTED
enumMember.description: The backup is corrupted. A corrupted backup is never allowed to be restored. The only permissible operation on the corrupted backup is to delete it.

derivedDataType.name: ActionInvocationResult
derivedDataType.description:
Indicates whether an asynchronous operation was successfully invoked. (The actual result of the operation will be communicated by other means.)
A value of zero indicates success. Non-zero error codes are implementation-specific.

derivedDataType.name: EcimPasswordString
derivedDataType.description: Holds the password string.

class.name: BrM
class.description: Represents the root MOC for Backup and Restore Management function MOM.

attribute.name: brMId
attribute.description: Holds the name used when identifying the MO.

class.name: BrmBackupManager
class.description:
Serves as container for Backup instances of a particular backupType and backupDomain.
This class also provides the actions for creating new backups, importing backups from other locations, and deleting existing backups of the corresponding type and domain.

action.name: deleteBackup
action.description: Delete a backup specified by its name and of the backupType and backupDomain managed by this BackupManager. This is an asynchronous action: progress and result are reported in the progressReport attribute.

parameter.name: name
parameter.description: The name of the backup to delete.

action.name: cancelCurrentAction
action.description: Cancels the current action.

action.name: createBackup
action.description: Creates a new backup of the backupType and backupDomain managed by the BackupManager. This is an asynchronous action: progress and result are reported in the progressReport attribute.

parameter.name: name
parameter.description: The name of the backup to create. If specified, input name validation is done to forbid illegal names. Backup name validation rules include duplicate backup names, names exceeding maximum allowed length. If not specified, a backup name is automatically generated according to below sketched format: <YYYY-MM-DDThh-mm-ss>.

attribute.name: brmBackupManagerId
attribute.description: The value component of the RDN.

attribute.name: backupType
attribute.description: Type of backup; System Data or User Data.

attribute.name: backupDomain
attribute.description: Backup domain, for example System

attribute.name: progressReport
attribute.description: Represents the progress report and final result of the ongoing (asynchronous) action, for example createBackup. This MO supports only one action to be executed at a time.

class.name: BrmBackup
class.description: Represents one backup of the type and domain specified by the BrmBackupManager in which it is contained.

action.name: restore
action.description: Restore from this backup. This is an asynchronous action - progress and result will be reported in the progressReport attribute.

action.name: cancelCurrentAction
action.description: Cancels an ongoing asynchronous restore operation. This is a synchronous action.

action.name: restoreSecuredBackupWithPasswd
action.description: Restore the current secure backup of the backupType and backupDomain managed by the BackupManager. A secure backup has some sensitive parts of the backup encrypted. This is an asynchronous action: progress and result are reported in the progressReport attribute. This action takes backupPassword parameter for generating the decryption key used to decrypt any secure parts of the the backup.

parameter.name: backupPassword
parameter.description: The backupPassword for generating the decryption key used to decrypt any secure parts of the the backup.

attribute.name: brmBackupId
attribute.description: Holds the name used when identifying the MO.

attribute.name: backupName
attribute.description: Backup name, provided by the operator. Must be unique among siblings in the MO tree.

attribute.name: status
attribute.description: Status of the backup.

attribute.name: asyncActionProgress
attribute.description: The stucture used to report the progress and final result of asynchronous actions.

attribute.name: creationTime
attribute.description: Date and time when the backup was created (start time of backup procedure)

attribute.name: progressReport
attribute.description: Represents the progress report and final result of the ongoing (asynchronous) action in this MO, for example restore. This MO supports only one action to be executed at a time.

attribute.name: swVersion
attribute.description: The administrative data portion of active software version(s) as specified in the software inventory management when the backup is created.

attribute.name: cryptoPasswordId
attribute.description: Specifies the encryption password identifier. A unique hash generated from password when a secured backup is created.

attribute.name: userLabel
attribute.description: Shows the free text provided at creation of secured backup in the userLabel parameter. It can be used to identify the key or the password to decrypt the backup during restore.

class.name: BrmFailsafeBackup
class.description: MO for activating and deactivating failsafe backups. Failsafe backups can be used when making changes to sensitive parts of the model, in which an error in configuration can lead to lost OAM connectivity or other failures from which the system can recover by a restore from a backup. When activated the failsafe backup function will automatically restore the system from a backup if the configuration as not been confirmed within a defined time period.

attribute.name: brmFailsafeBackupId
attribute.description: Holds the name used when identifying the MO.

attribute.name: backupName
attribute.description: Name of the backup that will be restored in case the failsafe function is activated.

attribute.name: progressReport
attribute.description: Represents the progress report and final result of creating backup for failsafe configuration. It will return the same information as the progressReport attribute of the BrmBackupManager managed object class.

attribute.name: timeoutLength
attribute.description:
The number of seconds the system waits before activating the failsafe function.
If the value is set while the function is active the timeRemaining is changed to that time instead.

attribute.name: timeRemaining
attribute.description: The number of seconds that remains before the system is restored from the selected backup.

attribute.name: usageState
attribute.description: Shows if the failsafe function is activated or not. Multiple failsafe points is not possible, therefore this state is either IDLE or BUSY.

mim.author: xnikvap
mim.name: CmwLogM
mim.description: This is the model for the log management fragment.

enum.name: LogSeverity
enum.description:
Each log entry is assigned a severity.
This can be used to put a filter on the log so that only events of a certain severity get logged.

enumMember.name: EMERGENCY
enumMember.description: Add this to the severity filter to capture EMERGENCY events to the log.

enumMember.name: ALERT
enumMember.description: Add this to the severity filter to capture ALERT type events in the log.

enumMember.name: CRITICAL
enumMember.description: Add this to the severity filter to capture CRITICAL events to the log.

enumMember.name: ERROR
enumMember.description: Add this to the severity filter to capture ERROR events to the log.

enumMember.name: WARNING
enumMember.description: add this to the severity filter to capture WARNING events to the log.

enumMember.name: NOTICE
enumMember.description: Add this to the severity filter to capture NOTICE events to the log.

enumMember.name: INFO
enumMember.description: Add this to the severity filter to capture INFO events to the log.

enumMember.name: DEBUG
enumMember.description: Add this to the severity filter to capture DEBUG events to the log.

enum.name: LogFacilityNumber
enum.description: Facility number as described in RFC 5424 The Syslog Protocol. To be used for log streaming to provide extra information about the log category.

enumMember.name: KERNEL_MESSAGES
enumMember.description: kernel messages.

enumMember.name: USER_LEVEL_MESSAGES
enumMember.description: user-level messages.

enumMember.name: MAIL_SYSTEM
enumMember.description: mail system.

enumMember.name: SYSTEM_DAEMONS
enumMember.description: system daemons.

enumMember.name: SECURITY_AUTH_MESSAGES
enumMember.description: security/authorization messages.

enumMember.name: INTERNAL_SYSLOG_MESSAGES
enumMember.description: messages generated internally by syslogd.

enumMember.name: LINE_PRINTER_SUBSYSTEM
enumMember.description: line printer subsystem.

enumMember.name: NETWORK_NEWS_SUBSYSTEM
enumMember.description: network news subsystem.

enumMember.name: UUCP_SUBSYSTEM
enumMember.description: UUCP subsystem.

enumMember.name: CLOCK_DAEMON
enumMember.description: clock daemon.

enumMember.name: SECURITY_AUTH_MESSAGES_2
enumMember.description: security/authorization messages.

enumMember.name: FTP_DAEMON
enumMember.description: FTP daemon.

enumMember.name: NTP_SUBSYSTEM
enumMember.description: NTP subsystem.

enumMember.name: LOG_AUDIT
enumMember.description: log audit.

enumMember.name: LOG_ALERT
enumMember.description: log alert.

enumMember.name: CLOCK_DAEMON_2
enumMember.description: clock daemon (note 2).

enumMember.name: LOCAL_USE_0
enumMember.description: local use 0 (local0).

enumMember.name: LOCAL_USE_1
enumMember.description: local use 1 (local1).

enumMember.name: LOCAL_USE_2
enumMember.description: local use 2 (local2).

enumMember.name: LOCAL_USE_3
enumMember.description: local use 3 (local3).

enumMember.name: LOCAL_USE_4
enumMember.description: local use 4 (local4).

enumMember.name: LOCAL_USE_5
enumMember.description: local use 5 (local5).

enumMember.name: LOCAL_USE_6
enumMember.description: local use 6 (local6).

enumMember.name: LOCAL_USE_7
enumMember.description: local use 7 (local7).

derivedDataType.name: RetentionDays
derivedDataType.description: Unsigned integer to be used for the logRetentionDays attribute. The aim is to eliminate the value of 0 which does not have meaning for log retention days.

class.name: LogM
class.description: Enables configuration of the LogM general properties. This is the root MO for the log management fragment. It contains various parameters concerning the log management service.

attribute.name: logMId
attribute.description: This is the identity for the LogM, it does not affect the file transfer and default value is 1.

class.name: Log
class.description: Enables configuration of the Log general properties. The Log MO contains parameters for a specific log file/stream in the system.

action.name: export
action.description: Exports this log type to a given destination. This action will move all log entries into a single ASCII encoded file which is transfered to the destination given in the parameters of the action.

parameter.name: uri
parameter.description:
A uniform resource locator describing the file transfer for the Log stream file. (i.e. identifying protocol, server and destination directory) e.g. sftp://myserver.mydomain.com/support/LogStreamA
The file name is determined by the system

parameter.name: password
parameter.description: If credentials are required, the password is filled in here. If no credentials are required, this parameter is ignored.

action.name: cancel
action.description: Action will cancel the current action invoked on this MO.

attribute.name: logId
attribute.description: Holds the name used when identifying the MO. It has no effect on the transfer function.

attribute.name: severityFilter
attribute.description:
This can be used to put a filter on the log so that only events of a certain severity get logged.
If no value is set, all entries will be kept.

attribute.name: reportProgress
attribute.description: Represents the progress and result of the ongoing action.

attribute.name: remoteLogServer
attribute.description: The remote log server this log stream is to be streamed. A reference to MO instance of the RemoteLogServer class. Optional. If omitted then the implementation shall classify the log stream to belong to a default log server.

attribute.name: logFacilityNumber
attribute.description: The facility number used by this log stream as described in RFC 5424. Optional. Can be used as extra indication of the log category. For example, to identify a log stream as a security one. One of the values 4, 10 or 13 must be used for security log streams. If omitted then the implementation shall classify the log stream to belong to a default category.

attribute.name: logRetentionHousekeeping
attribute.description: Enable or disable the log retention housekeeping. The recommended default value is enabled (UNLOCKED). If enabled then the logRetentionDays must have a value.

attribute.name: logRetentionDays
attribute.description: Number of days for log retention. If the retention housekeeping is enabled then any log file will be deleted from the local storage after this number of days has elapsed since the file creation. The minimum value is 1 day.

class.name: RemoteLogServer
class.description: Class used to configure remote server for streaming of logs. The same server can be used for a group of logs. The attributes are common for all logs of the group.

attribute.name: remoteLogServerId
attribute.description: The key attribute is the name of the remote server. Used to identify a group of log streams, e.g. security logs, regular logs, etc.

attribute.name: uri
attribute.description: The URI for streaming to be used for all logs of one group. If not provided streaming is disabled for all logs which belong to this group.

attribute.name: nodeCredential
attribute.description: The nodeCredential for streaming to be used for all logs of this group. A reference to MO of type NodeCredential from the ECIM CertM fragment.

attribute.name: trustCategory
attribute.description: The trustCategory for streaming to be used for all logs of this group. A reference to MO of type TrustCategory from the ECIM CertM fragment. If not provided streaming is disabled for all logs which belong to this group.

attribute.name: availStatus
attribute.description: Available status for this remote log server object.

attribute.name: operationalState
attribute.description: Operational state of this remote log server object.

interMim.description: Relationship to the system function LogM class dedicated to logging management. (log streams severity levels, on demand logs, logs exports, ...)

relationship.name: SystemFunctions_to_LogM
relationship.description: Relationship to the system function LogM class dedicated to logging management. (log streams severity levels, on demand logs, logs exports, ...)

struct.name: FileInfo
struct.description: Struct representing a file information.

structMember.name: size
structMember.description: The file size in kilobyte.

structMember.name: fileType
structMember.description: The type of the file. It specifies the file structure content which shall follow common practice. For example, "xml" indicates that the file content is structured according to the eXtensible Markup Language.

structMember.name: modificationTime
structMember.description: Date and time of latest modification.

structMember.name: fileName
structMember.description: The file name.

enum.name: FullAction
enum.description: Specifies the different alternatives when a file group or tree of file groups is full. A file group is considered full when, unless an action is taken, the file group exceeds a define limit.

enumMember.name: DISCARD_NEWEST
enumMember.description: A file must not be stored if that would cause the defined limit to be exceeded. Instead, the current or newest file is discarded.

enumMember.name: DISCARD_OLDEST
enumMember.description: The oldest file(s) are removed to free up space for the newest file. When a new file is stored and it causes the file group or the hierarchical tree of file groups to exceed its limit, the oldest file in the file group or tree of file groups is deleted before storing the new file.

enum.name: Severity
enum.description: Specifies the severity of passing a threshold.

enumMember.name: WARNING
enumMember.description: Issues a system failure warning.

enumMember.name: MINOR
enumMember.description: Issues a minor risk for system failure.

enumMember.name: MAJOR
enumMember.description: Issues a major risk for system failure.

enumMember.name: CRITICAL
enumMember.description: Issues a critical risk for system failure.

class.name: FileM
class.description: The top class of the the FileM model.

validationRules.rule: <schema xmlns="http://purl.oclc.org/dsdl/schematron"> <pattern> <rule> <assert test='are-distinct-values(FileGroupPolicy/@fileGroup)'>ERROR: The file group has already a policy assigned. Only one file group policy is allowed per file group</assert> </rule> </pattern> </schema>

attribute.name: fileMId
attribute.description: Value component of the RDN.

attribute.name: userLabel
attribute.description: Label for free use.

class.name: LogicalFs
class.description: Represents the root of a file system where files exposed over the NBI are represented. The included class FileGroup allows grouping of logically related files.

attribute.name: logicalFsId
attribute.description: Value component of the RDN.

attribute.name: userLabel
attribute.description: Label for free use.

class.name: FileGroup
class.description: A set of files that are logically related and possible to manage by a common policy. To allow a tree-structured hierarchical representation of groups of files, the FileGroup class has an association to itself. Over the northbound interface of the managed element, the instances of classes LogicalFs and FileGroup represent a file system.

action.name: removeFile
action.description: Removes a named file from this file group. The file name can contain a regular expression and thus a set of files in the file group that match the expression can be removed. The regular expression is interpreted according to POSIX pattern definition used for file name expansion. Action removeFile() returns True when the files are removed, otherwise False.

parameter.name: file
parameter.description: This parameter specifies the file in the FileGroup to be removed. The file string is interpreted as a regular expression and all files that match the expression are removed.

attribute.name: files
attribute.description: Container with information about the files under this file group.

attribute.name: fileGroupId
attribute.description: Value component of the RDN.

class.name: FileInformation
class.description: An instance of FileInformation represents a file.

attribute.name: fileInformationId
attribute.description: Value component of the RDN.

attribute.name: modificationTime
attribute.description: Date and time of latest modification.

attribute.name: size
attribute.description: The size of the file in kilobyte.

attribute.name: type
attribute.description: The type of the file. The type specifies how the content of the file is structured and shall follow common practice. For example, "xml" indicates that the content of the file is structured according to the eXtensible Markup Language.

relationship.name: FileGroup_to_FileGroup
relationship.description: Recursive association that allows creation and representation of nested directories.

mim.author: EAB/FLE/CD XSAIMAT
mim.name: ComFileTPM
mim.description: This fragment supports configuration management of the file transfer protocols.

class.name: FileTPM
class.description: The top class for server and client configuration of different protocols implementing file transfer. Lists the protocols supported by the ME by any file transfer client or server.

attribute.name: fileTPMId
attribute.description: The value component of the RDN.

class.name: FtpTlsServer
class.description: Represents the FTP over TLS server of the ME. The server only accepts FTP sessions that are explicitly requesting a TLS layer by the "AUTH TLS" command.

validationRules.rule: <schema xmlns="http://purl.oclc.org/dsdl/schematron"> <pattern> <rule> <assert test='(every $value in @nodeCredential satisfies exists($value))'>ERROR: the attribute value must be an existing NodeCredential MO.</assert> <assert test='(every $value in @trustCategory satisfies exists($value))'>ERROR: the attribute value must be an existing TrustCategory MO.</assert> </rule> </pattern> </schema>

attribute.name: ftpTlsServerId
attribute.description: The value component of the RDN.

attribute.name: administrativeState
attribute.description: The administrative state for the FTP server. When LOCKED all on-going connections will immediately be terminated.

attribute.name: nodeCredential
attribute.description: The credential used for FTP over TLS based file transfer. Specifies the DN of a NodeCredential MO in Certificate Management function MOM.

attribute.name: trustCategory
attribute.description: The set of certificates trusted by the FTP over TLS based file transfer. Specifies the DN of a TrustCategory MO in Certificate Management function MOM.

attribute.name: port
attribute.description:
The listening port number of the FTP over TLS server control connection.
The TLS layer is established on the regular FTP port by issuing an "AUTH TLS" command.

attribute.name: minDataPort
attribute.description:
The minimum port number for PASV data connections.
Must be lower or equal to maxDataPort.

attribute.name: maxDataPort
attribute.description:
The maximum port number for PASV data connections.
Must be greater or equal to minDataPort.

class.name: FtpServer
class.description: Generic configuration options for a file transfer server.

attribute.name: ftpServerId
attribute.description: The value component of the RDN.

attribute.name: idleTimer
attribute.description:
The amount of seconds after which an idle session is terminated.
Specifies the maximum time an FTP session may remain idle. A session is dropped if the idle length exceeds the configured time. No idleTimer means that idle sessions are not limited.

enum.name: TlsMode
enum.description: TLS establishment protocols for LDAP.

enumMember.name: STARTTLS
enumMember.description:
The TLS-layer is established by using the StartTLS method of RFC4511.
Default port number is 389.

enumMember.name: LDAPS
enumMember.description:
The TLS-layer is established by using the LDAPS protocol.
Default port number is 636.

enum.name: EricssonFilterVersion
enum.description: The valid version range of the Ericsson filter.

enumMember.description: Version 1.
Version 2.

derivedDataType.name: LdapDistinguishedName
derivedDataType.description:
Represents the international standard for the representation of Distinguished Names to be used with the LDAP protocol (RFC 4514). The string representation of the Distinguished Name structure is as follows:
distinguishedName = [ relativeDistinguishedName ( COMMA relativeDistinguishedName ) ] relativeDistinguishedName = attributeTypeAndValue ( PLUS attributeTypeAndValue ) attributeTypeAndValue = attributeType EQUALS attributeValue attributeType = descr/numericoid attributeValue = string/hexstring

class.name: Ldap
class.description: Contains the configurable information on primary and secondary LDAP directories.

validationRules.rule: <schema xmlns="http://purl.oclc.org/dsdl/schematron"> <pattern> <rule> <assert test='(every $value in @nodeCredential satisfies exists($value))'>ERROR: the attribute value must be an existing NodeCredential MO.</assert> <assert test='(every $value in @trustCategory satisfies exists($value))'>ERROR: the attribute value must be an existing TrustCategory MO.</assert> </rule> </pattern> </schema>

attribute.name: ldapId
attribute.description: The value component of the RDN.

attribute.name: ldapIpAddress
attribute.description:
The IP or DNS address of the primary LDAP server.
Default port number used is 389. The selected tlsMode overrides the default port number.

attribute.name: fallbackLdapIpAddress
attribute.description:
The IP or DNS address of the fallback LDAP server.
The fallback server is used when the primary server is inaccessible.
Default port number used is 389. The selected tlsMode overrides the default port number.

attribute.name: serverPort
attribute.description:
Specifies the server port number to access the primary and secondary LDAP servers.
Must only be specified when the default port number is not in use.
Default ports are: 389, when useTls is false. 389, when useTls is true and tlsMode is STARTTLS. 636, when useTls is true and tlsMode is LDAPS.

attribute.name: bindDn
attribute.description:
Default bind DN used to access the LDAP servers.
When configured, the ME uses the specified DN as the bind name for LDAP searches. The bind DN must be specified in an LDAP DN format, for example 'cn=bindaccount,dc=mycompany,dc=com'.

attribute.name: bindPassword
attribute.description:
Password used with bindDn to access the LDAP servers.
When configured, the ME establishes a password-based LDAP simple bind.

attribute.name: baseDn
attribute.description:
Default base DN to use in LDAP operations.
The base DN must be specified in an LDAP DN format, for example, 'ou=people,dc=mycompany,dc=com'. All LDAP objects used for authentication and authorization must be accessible from the base DN.

attribute.name: useReferrals
attribute.description:
Toggle to enable the use of referrals.
When set to false, the ME ignores referrals returned by the LDAP server.
When set to true, the ME follows referrals. Referrals can be used for authentication and authorization only if the referral URI refers back to a directory tree within the same LDAP server instance; otherwise, access is denied for referred user accounts.

attribute.name: nodeCredential
attribute.description:
The credential used for LDAP.
Specifies the DN of a NodeCredential MO in Certificate Management.

attribute.name: trustCategory
attribute.description:
The set of certificates trusted by LDAP.
Specifies the DN of a TrustCategory MO in Certificate Management.

attribute.name: useTls
attribute.description: Toggle to enable TLS access to primary and secondary LDAP targets.

attribute.name: tlsMode
attribute.description:
Toggles the TLS establishment mode to access the primary and secondary LDAP servers.
Takes effect when useTls is true.

attribute.name: userLabel
attribute.description: An additional descriptive text.

class.name: LdapAuthenticationMethod
class.description:
Root MOC of the LDAP Authentication Method.
LDAP-based authentication uses a directory to store a user's credentials and allows them to be queried over a secure LDAP interface.

attribute.name: ldapAuthenticationMethodId
attribute.description: The value component of the RDN.

attribute.name: administrativeState
attribute.description: The administrative state of this authorization method.

attribute.name: userLabel
attribute.description: An additional descriptive text.

class.name: EricssonFilter
class.description: Provides configuration of features supported by the Ericsson LDAP schema.

attribute.name: ericssonFilterId
attribute.description: The value component of the RDN.

attribute.name: roleAliasesBaseDn
attribute.description:
LDAP DN to a subtree of objects that is used to convert alias roles to roles the ME understands.
An option for authorization methods that implements Role Based Access Control.
The value is an LDAP DN. The format of the DN for such an object is 'role=[role], roleAliasesBaseDn', where [role] must be replaced with the name of a role alias or role group. All these objects must be accessible from the base DN defined in this attribute. For example: if roleAliasesBaseDn = "dc=example,dc=com" and the user has role Admin, and the object "role=Admin,dc=example,dc=com" exists and has attribute ericssonUserAuthorizationScope = Administrator, the user receives the Administrator role.

attribute.name: targetBasedAccessControl
attribute.description:
Toggles Target Based Access Control (TBAC).
The User Management MO provides the <Target Type> strings of the ME. The TBAC authorization behavior is defined in the UserManagement MOC.
The optional Ericsson LDAP-schema-specified attribute ericssonUserAuthenticationScope stores the targets where the user can be authenticated and authorized. It is a case-insensitive string of <Target Type>. The Ericsson target-type identifier, such as ‘bsc’, ‘cscf’, classifies the target type the user can access.
The optional Ericsson LDAP-schema-specified attribute ericssonUserAuthorizationScope stores the authorization profiles of which the user is a member. It is a case-insensitive string of form <Target Type>:<Authorization Profile>, where ':' is a separator; <Target Type> is the Ericsson target-type identifier, such as ‘bsc’, ‘cscf’, and it classifies the target type for which the user acquires the <Authorization Profile>. <Authorization Profile> is the Ericsson application-defined profile, for example, a role.
Attribute ericssonUserAuthenticationScope behavior:
When TBAC is LOCKED in the ME, authentication and authorization are performed without TBAC (not recommended). When TBAC is UNLOCKED in the ME and the user has a target-restricted authentication scope, authentication and authorization are performed when a match is found. If not, it fails.
Attribute ericssonUserAuthenticationScope allows the use of wild-carded scope ('*') to permit the user to be authorized on any ME based on its ericssonUserAuthorizationScope attribute.
Attribute ericssonUserAuthorizationScope behavior:
When TBAC is LOCKED in the ME, the authorization profiles without target qualifiers and with wildcard target qualifier ('*') are assigned to the user from the user database. When TBAC is UNLOCKED in the ME, the authorization profiles with matching target qualifiers and with wildcard target qualifier are assigned to the user from the user database.
Not using the Ericsson LDAP schema in the user accounts, or improper use of this schema causes authorization failure.
For more details, refer to the Ericsson LDAP Interface Description.
Example with roles: If the ME in UserManagement MOC is configured with 'cscf.ims.stockholm' and the LDAP user account contains:
ericssonUserAuthenticationScope: cscf.ims.stockholm ericssonUserAuthenticationScope: cscf.ims.malmo ericssonUserAuthorizationScope: cscf.ims.stockholm:SystemAdministrator ericssonUserAuthorizationScope: cscf.ims.malmo:SystemSecurityAdministrator ericssonUserAuthorizationScope: *:ApplicationOperator
Then given the LDAP user provided a correct password it is authenticated on the ME and assigned with role 'SystemAdministrator' and 'ApplicationOperator'.

attribute.name: version
attribute.description:
The selected version of the Ericsson filtering behavior.
Version 1 is deprecated. Version 1 allows wildcarding of roles without any qualifier and it supports the use of '*' character. Such syntax applies the given role on all targets:
ericssonUserAuthorizationScope: ApplicationOperator ericssonUserAuthorizationScope: *:ApplicationOperator
Version 2 differentiates the wildcarding behavior depending on the value of attribute targetBasedAccessControl. When targetBasedAccessControl is LOCKED, both syntaxes are allowed and assigns the role to the user in the ME. When targetBasedAccessControl is UNLOCKED, it only allows the use of '*' character, but unqualified roles are ignored.

mim.author: EAB/FLE/CD XRAMSUB
mim.name: ComLocalAuthorization
mim.description: Local Role Based Access Control (RBAC) model.

enum.name: PermissionType
enum.description:
Permission is the access right a role has on a target object specified by the ruleData attribute.
Current permission types follow UNIX/Linux permission enumeration values as follows: 0 = NO_ACCESS 1 = X (EXECUTE) 4 = R (READ) 5 = RX (READ and EXECUTE) 6 = RW (READ and WRITE) 7 = RWX (READ, WRITE and EXECUTE)
Reserved values that are not included here are as follows and if required, may be introduced at a later date:
2 = W (WRITE) 3 = WX (WRITE and EXECUTE).

enumMember.name: R
enumMember.description:
Read only access right.
The user can read MOs and can get attribute values.

enumMember.name: RW
enumMember.description:
Read and write access right.
The user can create and delete MOs and set and get attribute values.

enumMember.name: X
enumMember.description:
Execute access right.
This is valid only for actions and specific commands.

enumMember.name: RX
enumMember.description:
Read and execute access rights.
The user can read MOs, get attribute values, and execute any actions.

enumMember.name: RWX
enumMember.description:
Read, write, and execute access rights.
The user can create and delete MOs, and set and get attribute values, and execute any actions.

enumMember.name: NO_ACCESS
enumMember.description:
No access.
The user has no read, write or execute rights to the MO, attribute, or action.

derivedDataType.name: RuleDataType
derivedDataType.description:
This type specifies the target Managed Object (MO) or MO Class (MOC) that a rule applies to.
Entire sub-trees can be addressed as well as attributes and actions defined for a specific MO or MOC. Patterns are used for this purpose according to simplified regular expression syntax. Any regular expression can also be defined but must be identified as such using a specific prefix.
MOCs are specified in their containment hierarchy separated by commas “,”. For example: “ManagedElement,ApplFuncX”.
MOs are specified using the 3GPP DN notation, with the exception that the same rule may mix MO and MOC, such as “ManagedElement, ApplFuncX=1”. Omitting the instance Id is the preferred notation for singleton MOCs, which makes the rule applicable for all ManagedElement instances. Thus rule design becomes independent of system implementation for singleton MOC types.
If the naming attribute is not the same as the MO Class name + “Id”, the naming attribute is in accordance with the 3GPP part of the DN as well. This means that if ApplFuncX naming attribute is xyz, then the DN is “ManagedElement,ApplFuncX.xyz=2”. However, it is not required nor forbidden to use this more elaborate form of DN. The naming attribute xyz can be omitted.
Attributes and actions are specified after the MO or MOC separated by a dot “.”. Since the ‘,’ character is allowed in the naming attribute of MO of 3GPP DNs, escaping must be used if the character occurs in an attribute value by the reverse solidus (‘\’) character. Several attributes or actions can be specified for the same MO or MOC separated by the the bar “|” character.
The rule applies to a single MO or MOC and all its attributes and actions unless the following notation is used:
...,MOC.* The rule applies to all attributes and actions that belong to the MOC, but not to the MOC itself. ...,MOC,* The rule applies to the MOC and all its attributes and actions and all contained (child) MOCs and their attribute and actions.
(DEPRECATED: ...,MOC$ The rule applies only to the MOC itself and not to its attributes and actions.)
The above notations are also valid for MOs and must close an expression.
In addition, the ruleData attribute can specify any Perl Compatible Regular Expressions. These regular expressions must only be used by CLI command modules for tailored commands or by Netconf modules for Netconf operations. The permitted content is specified by the CLI and Netconf documentation. The only general restriction to these kinds of rule data is that they must start with “:cli:regexp:” or “:netconf:regexp:” plus a different expression from the wild card “.*”.
Examples: 1) Entire MO tree, that is the rule will match all Managed Objects: ManagedElement,*
2) Only MOs and their attributes and actions of ManagedElement MOC: ManagedElement
3) (Deprecated) Only MOs of ManagedElement MOC but not their attributes and actions: ManagedElement$
4) A specific MO including singleton parents: ManagedElement,Equipment,FRU=19
5) An entire sub-tree below that includes a specific MO: ManagedElement,Equipment,FRU=17,*
6) An entire sub-tree below that includes a specific MO that belongs to an MO class where the naming attribute is not equal to the MOC Name + “Id”. Two examples are given, both are valid and accurately describe the same MO tree: ManagedElement,Equipment,Abc.xyz=1,* ManagedElement,Equipment,Abc=1,*
7) All port attributes that belong to MOs of the Boo MOC: ManagedElement,ApplFuncX,Boo.port
8) All ipAddress and port attributes that belong to MOs of the Boo MO class: ManagedElement,ApplFuncX,Boo.ipAddress|port
9) Only the port attribute that belongs to a specific instance of the Boo MOC: ManagedElement,ApplFuncX=1,Boo=17.port
10) The restart action on the ManagedElement MOC: ManagedElement.restart
11) All CLI commands in the command module group 'System': :cli:regexp:System-[a-zA-Z0-9]+ or regexp:System-[a-zA-Z0-9]+
12) Netconf operation <operationx>: :netconf:regexp:operationx

class.name: Role
class.description:
Authorization roles that may be assigned to users.
Roles have a containment relationship to the rules which define the access controls to objects.

attribute.name: roleId
attribute.description: The value component of the RDN.

attribute.name: roleName
attribute.description:
The role name a user may have.
The name is matched against role names retrieved from the user information store.

attribute.name: userLabel
attribute.description: An additional descriptive text.

class.name: Rule
class.description:
The rules that define the access control to objects.
A Rule MO is contained by a Role MO which may be then applied to users.

attribute.name: ruleId
attribute.description: The value component of the RDN.

attribute.name: ruleName
attribute.description:
The rule name.
The rule name is a string of '<FunctionName>_<RuleNumber>'
<FunctionName> is a unique name for a system, transport, equipment, or application function.
<RuleNumber> is a numerical ID of the Rule MO within a <FunctionName>.
Examples:
BackupAndRestoreManagement_1 FileManagement_2 SecurityManagement_2 SystemManagement_1

attribute.name: permission
attribute.description: Permission is the access right the rule provides on a target specified by the ruleData attribute.

attribute.name: ruleData
attribute.description: Defines the model elements for which the permission is applicable.

attribute.name: userLabel
attribute.description: An additional descriptive text.

class.name: LocalAuthorizationMethod
class.description:
The Root MOC of the Local Authorization method.
Roles and authorization rules are defined to build a Role Based Access Control (RBAC) model for controlling access to Managed Element resources such as Managed Objects, attributes, actions and CLI commands.

attribute.name: localAuthorizationMethodId
attribute.description: The value component of the RDN.

attribute.name: userLabel
attribute.description: An additional descriptive text.

mim.author: EAB/FLE/CD XSANBOJ
mim.name: ComSecM
mim.description:
ECIM Security Management fragment.
The Security Management fragment must encompass most system security aspects to be configured on the Managed Element. This version of the model contains authentication and authorization, the User Management aspects. Authentication and authorization methods must contribute to the UserManagement MOC in a modular way.

struct.name: MethodOrder
struct.description:
Struct that represents the order of an authentication or authorization method.
The referred method must be used by a security function, that is, authentication or authorization in the given order.

structMember.name: orderNumber
structMember.description: The method (1-*) order number.

structMember.name: methodReference
structMember.description: An MO Reference to the method.

structMember.name: userLabel
structMember.description: Freetext label to describe reason for the method order.

struct.name: Cipher
struct.description: Represents a cipher algorithm.

structMember.name: protocolVersion
structMember.description:
A keyword that identifies the cipher protocol version.
For example: 'TLSv1'.

structMember.name: keyExchange
structMember.description:
A keyword that identifies the cipher key exchange algorithm.
For example: 'kEDH'.

structMember.name: authentication
structMember.description:
A keyword that identifies the cipher authentication algorithm.
For example: 'aRSA'.

structMember.name: encryption
structMember.description:
A keyword that identifies the cipher encryption algorithm.
For example: 'AES'.

structMember.name: mac
structMember.description:
A keyword that identifies the cipher Message Authentication Code algorithm.
For example: 'SHA'.

structMember.name: export
structMember.description: Shows 'EXPORT' if the cipher is classified as an EXPORT cipher, otherwise empty.

structMember.name: name
structMember.description:
A keyword that identifies the cipher name.
For example: 'TLS_DHE_RSA_WITH_AES_256_CBC_SHA'.

derivedDataType.name: CipherList
derivedDataType.description:
Derived string for the specification of a cipher list.
Contains colon-delimited (':') cipher strings that can be of any value of the members contained by a Cipher struct. A cipher string indicates an individual cipher or a set of ciphers that use the same protocol version, key exchange etc. The cipher strings can be combined in logical order and operation by character '+'. They can be optionally preceded by either an '!' or a '-' character. Character '!' means that the preceded cipher or cipher type is permanently deleted from the list. Character '-' means that the preceded cipher or cipher type is deleted from the list, but any of the ciphers can be added by later options.
They must contain at least one positive expression, that is, without character '!' or '-' in the cipher string, otherwise the filter results in an empty cipher suite.
Cipher strings with special meaning: ALL - all cipher suites except for the NULL encryption ciphers, which must be explicitly enabled. NULL authentication ciphers are included. DEFAULT - all cipher suites except the NULL authentication and NULL encryption ciphers.
Example:
ALL:!SSLv2:!RSA:!aRSA:!3DES:!DES:!MD5 ALL:!EXP-EDH-RSA-DES-CBC-SHA AES:-kRSA AES:RC4 kEDH+EXPORT:-MD5, assume that the listed cipher strings are valid values of members of Cipher structs.

derivedDataType.name: SshAlgorithm
derivedDataType.description: Data type for SSH cipher, key exchange and message authentication codes strings.

rule.exceptionText: Must be a string of alphanumeric US-ASCII characters with optional ‘-‘. Domain names following an ‘@’ character are appended to proprietary algorithm names. For example: ‘aes256-gcm@openssh.com’
rule.name: Pattern Constraint

class.name: SecM
class.description: Security Management root MOC.

attribute.name: secMId
attribute.description: The value component of the RDN.

class.name: AuthenticationOrder
class.description: MO Class used to view the order of authentication methods.

attribute.name: authenticationOrderId
attribute.description: The value component of the RDN.

attribute.name: authenticationMethodOrder
attribute.description:
The order in which authentication methods are to be used.
Methods must be called up in the order specified by the orderNumber member. The method is referenced by the methodReference member.

attribute.name: userLabel
attribute.description: An additional descriptive text.

class.name: AuthorizationOrder
class.description: MO Class used to view the order of authorization methods.

attribute.name: authorizationOrderId
attribute.description: The value component of the RDN.

attribute.name: authorizationMethodOrder
attribute.description:
The order in which authorization methods are to be used.
Methods must be called up in the order specified by the orderNumber member. The method is referenced by the methodReference member.

attribute.name: userLabel
attribute.description: An additional descriptive text.

class.name: UserManagement
class.description: User Management MOC.

attribute.name: userManagementId
attribute.description: The value component of the RDN.

attribute.name: userLabel
attribute.description: An additional descriptive text.

attribute.name: targetType
attribute.description:
Lists the target types of the ME for Target Based Access Control (TBAC).
This attribute is optional for Authentication Methods that require TBAC configuration. Authentication Methods use TBAC to determine the following: whether a user can be authorized in the ME, and which authorization profiles apply to the user in the ME, based on the target types specified in this attribute.
This attribute can contain any classifier string for the ME such as geographical, for example: 'stockholm', network, for example 'ims', or functional identifiers, for example 'cscf', and any combination of these.
The generic behavior of TBAC for authorization is as follows:
TBAC is LOCKED in the ME: authorization is performed without TBAC. TBAC is UNLOCKED in the ME: authorization is performed if the targets that the user is provided with exactly match at least one string of configured target types. Otherwise, authorization fails.
Determining the authorization profiles of the user is specific per Authentication Method.
The LOCKED and UNLOCKED states of TBAC in the ME are controlled by the Authentication Methods.
Example value: 'cscf.ims.stockholm'.

class.name: Tls
class.description: Configures security related properties of a session opened using TLS protocol. The ciphers suite that the TLS server on APG can offer to a remote client can be changed.

attribute.name: tlsId
attribute.description: The value component of the RDN.

attribute.name: enabledCiphers
attribute.description:
Lists the ciphers as filtered by the attribute cipherFilter.
Ciphers are ordered by strength. The strongest cipher is offered first.

attribute.name: cipherFilter
attribute.description:
Specifies a filter for the cipher suite.
Applied on the ciphers listed in attribute supportedCiphers. The result is shown in attribute enabledCiphers.

attribute.name: supportedCiphers
attribute.description: Lists the ciphers supported by the ME.

class.name: Ssh
class.description:
Configures security related properties of a command session opened using SSH layer protocol. The set of ciphers, key exchange algorithms, and message authentication codes that the SSH server on APG can offer to a remote client can be changed.
By default, all ciphers, key exchange algorithms, and message authentication codes are supported. The related attributes can be changed for excluding the less secure ciphers, key exchange algorithms, and message authentication codes from the set of supported ones. But this is to be done only when all remote clients are able to interwork with new set of supported ciphers, key exchange algorithms, and message authentication codes.

attribute.name: sshId
attribute.description: Holds the name used when identifying the MO.

attribute.name: selectedCiphers
attribute.description:
The list of selected ciphers.
The ciphers are offered to the SSH peer in the order as configured. Each value indicates one cipher.

attribute.name: supportedCiphers
attribute.description: Lists the supported encryption ciphers.

attribute.name: selectedKeyExchanges
attribute.description:
The list of selected key exchange algorithms.
The algorithms are offered to the SSH peer in the order as configured. Each value indicates one algorithm.

attribute.name: supportedKeyExchanges
attribute.description: Lists the supported key exchange algorithms.

attribute.name: selectedMacs
attribute.description:
The list of selected message authentication codes.
The algorithms are offered to the SSH peer in the order as configured. Each value indicates one coding algorithm.

attribute.name: supportedMacs
attribute.description: Lists the supported message authentication codes.

mim.author: EAB/FLE/CD XSHRSHR
mim.name: ComSysM
mim.description: This fragment defines the features that are used by other fragments or by the managed element itself. These include the schema for the managed element that will define the version handling for the model parts and the handling of the NTP server information.

derivedDataType.name: EcimPasswordString
derivedDataType.description: The password string.

class.name: SysM
class.description:
This is the System Management MO.
It is a parent to the MOs which represent the system level functions such as time handling and version handling as well as file transfer capabilities and netconf configuration.

attribute.name: sysMId
attribute.description:
The value component of the RDN.
It is set automatically when the MO instance is created.

attribute.name: userLabel
attribute.description: An additional descriptive text.

class.name: Schema
class.description: Represents a MIM model fragment whose corresponding functionality is operational in the Managed Element.

action.name: export
action.description:
Pushes the schema file out from the ME.
The URI shall contain both the file name and the destination address. The password is optional.

parameter.name: uri
parameter.description: The URI used for identifying the adress to the remote location to which the file shall be transferred to.

parameter.name: password
parameter.description: The password used for connecting to the remote file location.

attribute.name: schemaId
attribute.description:
The value component of the RDN.
From a usability perspective, the value could e.g. be set to the corresponding model name.

attribute.name: identifier
attribute.description: Represents the name of the data model fragment that the schema represents.

attribute.name: baseModelIdentifier
attribute.description: Represents the name of the common information model fragment that the data model fragment is derived from.

attribute.name: version
attribute.description: Represents the full version information for the data model fragment that the schema represents.

attribute.name: baseModelVersion
attribute.description: The full version information for the common information model fragment that the data model fragment is derived from.

attribute.name: selectedModelOptions
attribute.description:
Contains the model features used in the generation of the MIM.
The MS can query the information from the model without having to access the MIM file itself.

class.name: NetconfTls
class.description: Represents the NETCONF configuration management service over TLS.

validationRules.rule: <schema xmlns="http://purl.oclc.org/dsdl/schematron"> <pattern> <rule> <assert test='(every $value in @nodeCredential satisfies exists($value))'>ERROR: the attribute value must be an existing NodeCredential MO.</assert> <assert test='(every $value in @trustCategory satisfies exists($value))'>ERROR: the attribute value must be an existing TrustCategory MO.</assert> </rule> </pattern> </schema>

attribute.name: netconfTlsId
attribute.description: The value component of the RDN.

attribute.name: nodeCredential
attribute.description: The node credential used for the NETCONF over TLS service. Specifies the DN of a NodeCredential MO in Certificate Management.

attribute.name: trustCategory
attribute.description: The set of certificates trusted by the NETCONF session over TLS service. Specifies the DN of a TrustCategory MO in Certificate Management.

attribute.name: administrativeState
attribute.description: The administrative state for the NETCONF session over TLS service. When LOCKED all on-going NETCONF sessions are immediately terminated.

class.name: CliTls
class.description: Represents the CLI configuration management service over TLS.

attribute.name: cliTlsId
attribute.description: The value component of the RDN.

attribute.name: nodeCredential
attribute.description: The node credential used for the AP session over TLS service. Specifies the DN of a NodeCredential MO in Certificate Management.

attribute.name: trustCategory
attribute.description: The set of certificates trusted by the AP session over TLS service. Specifies the DN of a TrustCategory MO in Certificate Management.

attribute.name: administrativeState
attribute.description: The administrative state for the AP session over TLS service. When LOCKED all on-going AP sessions are immediately terminated.

mim.author: EAB/FLE/CC XVIRKOT
mim.name: ComTop
mim.description: This is the top level of the Ericsson Common Information Model (ECIM). This model contains the singleton, root Managed Object Class (MOC) ManagedElement under which the complete model is contained. Directly under ManagedElement are managed-function level classes SystemFunctions, Transport, Equipment and the root MOC of any managed functions. The Equipment Root MOC is in the Equipment Managed Object Model (MOM). The root MOC for a managed function is hosted in the managed function MOM.

struct.name: ProductIdentity
struct.description: Contains product information for a Managed Element and Managed Function(s). This entity is deprecated.

structMember.name: productNumber
structMember.description: The product number in Ericsson's ABC format. See Ericsson Corporate Basic Standards for information.

structMember.name: productRevision
structMember.description: The product revision in the form R[1-9][A-Z]. See Ericsson Corporate Basic Standards for information.

structMember.name: productDesignation
structMember.description: The product designation is the common name for the product.

enum.name: AdmState
enum.description: The administrative state of a resource.

enumMember.name: LOCKED
enumMember.description: The resource is administratively prohibited from performing services for its users.

enumMember.name: UNLOCKED
enumMember.description: The resource is administratively permitted to perform services for its users. This is independent of its inherent operability.

enumMember.name: SHUTTINGDOWN
